original: yongs su shes pas 'di dag pa'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: yongs su shes pas 'di dag pa'o zhes smos te /
translated: The phrase by thoroughly knowing them, they are purified is stated.

original: de ltar ji srid du sa gzhi chen po sems la snang ba yod pa de srid du /
analyzed: de ltar ji srid du sa gzhi chen po sems la snang ba yod pa de srid du /
translated: Thus, for as long as the great earth appears to the mind,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sbyong ba la bar du gcod pa yin par shes par byas nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sbyong ba la bar du gcod pa yin par shes par byas nas /
translated: one should understand that it is an obstacle to the purification of the buddha realm.

original: ci nas kyang sa gzhi chen po lta bur sems la snang bar ma gyur cing sa chen po la chags pa'i sems spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: ci nas kyang sa gzhi chen po lta bur sems la snang bar ma gyur cing sa chen po la chags pa'i sems spang bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should abandon the mind that is attached to the great earth, so that the great earth does not appear to the mind.

original: chags pa'i sems spangs nas /
analyzed: chags pa'i sems spangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned the mind of attachment,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid sems la sbyang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid sems la sbyang bar 'gyur te /
translated: one should train the mind in the characteristics of the completely pure buddha realm.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni de ltar sbyong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni de ltar sbyong ngo //
translated: Thus, the buddha realm is purified.

original: de bas na bar chad byed par yongs su shes nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji srid du sems la sa gzhi chen po lta bur yod par snang zhing /
analyzed: de bas na bar chad byed par yongs su shes nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji srid du sems la sa gzhi chen po lta bur yod par snang zhing /
translated: Therefore, the phrase having thoroughly understood them to be obstacles and so forth is stated.

original: yod par chags pa yod pa de srid du sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la bar du gcod pa yin par shes nas /
analyzed: yod par chags pa yod pa de srid du sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la bar du gcod pa yin par shes nas /
translated: As long as there is attachment to existence, it should be understood that it is an obstacle to the purification of the buddhaverse.

original: yod par chags pa spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: yod par chags pa spang bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should abandon attachment to existence.

original: de la yod par chags pa spangs na /
analyzed: de la yod par chags pa spangs na /
translated: When one has abandoned attachment to existence,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing shel gyi kha dog la sogs pa dag pa'i mtshan nyid du sems la snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing shel gyi kha dog la sogs pa dag pa'i mtshan nyid du sems la snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the buddhaverse appears to the mind as the characteristic of purity, the color of crystal, and so on.

original: dpag tu med pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: One verse on the analysis of the immeasurable.

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdag grol ba dang thar pa thob pa des sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sgrol bar byed de /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdag grol ba dang thar pa thob pa des sems can dpag tu med pa rnams sgrol bar byed de /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who possesses the true intuition, who is himself liberated and has attained release, liberates immeasurable sentient beings.

original: de bas na dpag tu med pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan to //🔽de la dpag tu med pa rnams bsdus na /
analyzed: de bas na dpag tu med pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan to // de la dpag tu med pa rnams bsdus na /
translated: Therefore, the analysis of the immeasurable is taught in one verse.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dpag tu med pa ni rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dpag tu med pa ni rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: The immeasurable of the bodhisattvas is fivefold.

original: smin par bya dang rnam sbyang dang // thob bya smin @215a * //
analyzed: smin par bya dang rnam sbyang dang // thob bya smin @215a * //
translated: The things to be matured, purified,🔽and attained, the things to be matured,🔽and the things to be taught are

original: par rung ba dang // yang dag bstan pa'i dngos po dang // blo ldan rnams kyis dpag tu med //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: par rung ba dang // yang dag bstan pa'i dngos po dang // blo ldan rnams kyis dpag tu med // ces bya ba la /
translated: incalculable for the geniuses.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dpag tu med pa'i dngos po ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dpag tu med pa'i dngos po ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The things of the bodhisattvas are incalculable in five ways.

original: yongs su smin par bya ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa dang / thob par bya ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa dang / yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su smin par bya ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa dang / thob par bya ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa dang / yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: The things to be matured are incalculable, the things to be purified are incalculable, the things to be attained are incalculable, the things to be taught are incalculable, and the things to be understood are incalculable.

original: dpag tu med pa'i dngos po rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i dngos po rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: These are the five kinds of incalculable things.

original: de la yongs su smin par bya ba'i dngos po ni khyad par med par nyan thos kyi rigs la gnas pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs la gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa dang / rigs ma nges pa dang /
analyzed: de la yongs su smin par bya ba'i dngos po ni khyad par med par nyan thos kyi rigs la gnas pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs la gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa dang / rigs ma nges pa dang /
translated: In this regard, the thing that is to be fully matured is, without distinction, someone abiding in the sravaka potential, someone abiding in the pratyekabuddha potential, someone abiding in the bodhisattva potential and someone whose potential is unascertained.

original: rigs med pa rnams te /
analyzed: rigs med pa rnams te /
translated: The things to be brought to full maturity are, without distinction, those who are of the Disciple lineage, those who are of the Solitary Buddha lineage, those who are of the Bodhisattva lineage, those who are of unfixed lineage, and those who are of no lineage.

original: nam mkha'i khams mthar thug pa sems can gyi khams der thug ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams mthar thug pa sems can gyi khams der thug ste /
translated: The realm of sentient beings is coextensive with the realm of space.

original: nam mkha'i khams mthar thug pa sems can gyi khams der thug ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams mthar thug pa sems can gyi khams der thug ste /
translated: The realm of sentient beings is coextensive with the realm of space.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du sems can gyi khams la mthar thug pa med pas na ;
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du sems can gyi khams la mthar thug pa med pas na ;
translated: Since the realm of sentient beings is limitless like space,

original: yongs su smin par bya ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin par bya ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the things to be brought to full maturity are said to be limitless.

original: de ltar nyan thos kyi rigs can dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can ni theg pa gsum du yongs su smin par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyan thos kyi rigs can dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can ni theg pa gsum du yongs su smin par bya'o //
translated: Thus, those who are of the Disciple lineage, those who are of the Solitary Buddha lineage, and those who are of the Bodhisattva lineage are brought to full maturity in the three vehicles.

original: ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams ni theg pa gsum du yongs su smin par bya'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams ni theg pa gsum du yongs su smin par bya'o //
translated: Those of unfixed potential are brought to full maturity in the three vehicles.

original: rigs med pa ni dge ba bcu la bkod nas lha dang mi'i nang du gzhag ste /
analyzed: rigs med pa ni dge ba bcu la bkod nas lha dang mi'i nang du gzhag ste /
translated: As for those without potential, they are established in virtue, the ten positive actions, and are then established in the human or celestial realms.

original: yongs su smin par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin par bya'o //
translated: They are thus brought to full maturity.

original: rnam par sbyong ba'i dngos po ni 'jig rten gyi khams snod kyi 'jig rten te /
analyzed: rnam par sbyong ba'i dngos po ni 'jig rten gyi khams snod kyi 'jig rten te /
translated: The object of purification is the world of the environment, the universe.

original: de dag kyang ngam grog dang tsher ma la sgos pa med cing ma gzhi shel la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su sbyang ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyang nam mkha'i mtha' thog thag tu za 'og gi gyur bzhin du gnas pas na /
analyzed: de dag kyang ngam grog dang tsher ma la sgos pa med cing ma gzhi shel la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su sbyang ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyang nam mkha'i mtha' thog thag tu za 'og gi gyur bzhin du gnas pas na /
translated: And since this is purified in such a way that it is free of ravines and thorns, and is made of crystal and so forth, the universe is purified to the very limits of space, like a brocade robe spread out.

original: yongs su sbyong ba'i dngos po dpag tu med do //🔽thob par bya ba'i chos dngos po ni dge ba'i chos dang mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa gnyis las mi dge ba'i chos rnams spangs nas /
analyzed: yongs su sbyong ba'i dngos po dpag tu med do // thob par bya ba'i chos dngos po ni dge ba'i chos dang mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa gnyis las mi dge ba'i chos rnams spangs nas /
translated: So the object of purification is infinite.🔽The actual object to be attained is twofold, virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos thab par bya zhing /
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos thab par bya zhing /
translated: Having eliminated nonvirtuous phenomena, one attains virtuous phenomena such as the strengths and fearlessnesses.

original: mngon du bya ba yang dpag tu med pa zhig yod de /
analyzed: mngon du bya ba yang dpag tu med pa zhig yod de /
translated: There are also immeasurable things to be manifested.🔽Immeasurable things to be matured🔽.🔽Immeasurable things to be matured are as follows.

original: smin par rung ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa ni 'di ltar rigs lnga las /🔽nyan thos kyi rigs dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / @215b theg pa chen po'i rigs dang / rigs ma nges pa'i gang zag rnams ni theg pa gsum la gzung cing mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i skal pa yod pas na /
analyzed: smin par rung ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa ni 'di ltar rigs lnga las / nyan thos kyi rigs dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / @215b theg pa chen po'i rigs dang / rigs ma nges pa'i gang zag rnams ni theg pa gsum la gzung cing mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i skal pa yod pas na /
translated: There are five kinds of potential:🔽the śrāvaka potential, the pratyekabuddha potential, the Mahayana potential, the unfixed potential and the person without potential.

original: smin par byar rung ba'i dngos po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: smin par byar rung ba'i dngos po zhes bya ste /
translated: Since those with the first four potentials have the fortune of being led to the three vehicles and attaining nirvana, they are called things to be matured.

original: smin par byar rung ba'i sems can gyi khams la yang mtha' med pas na dpag tu med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smin par byar rung ba'i sems can gyi khams la yang mtha' med pas na dpag tu med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the realm of sentient beings to be matured is also infinite, it is said to be immeasurable.

original: yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i dngos po dpag tu med pa ni /
translated: Immeasurable things to be taught🔽.

original: gdul ba'i sems can de dag gdul bar bya ba'i thabs bstan pa'i thabs kyang dpag tu med de /
analyzed: gdul ba'i sems can de dag gdul bar bya ba'i thabs bstan pa'i thabs kyang dpag tu med de /
translated: The methods for teaching those sentient beings to be trained are also immeasurable.

original: 'dod chags can la mi gtsang ba'i chos bstan pa dang / zhe sdang can la byams pa'i chos bstan pa la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bstan cing bshad pa yang dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags can la mi gtsang ba'i chos bstan pa dang / zhe sdang can la byams pa'i chos bstan pa la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bstan cing bshad pa yang dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the twelve branches of the excellent speech are taught and explained in an immeasurable way, such as the teaching of the Dharma of impurity for those with desire, the teaching of the Dharma of love for those with hatred and so on.

original: de la smin par bya ba'i dngos po dang / smin par rung ba'i dngos po gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de la smin par bya ba'i dngos po dang / smin par rung ba'i dngos po gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the thing to be ripened and the thing that is suitable to be ripened?

original: 'di ltar rigs yod pa dang / rigs med pa la sgos pa'i sems can bye brag med par sems cad thams cad la ni smin pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs yod pa dang / rigs med pa la sgos pa'i sems can bye brag med par sems cad thams cad la ni smin pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: In this way, sentient beings who are classified as having potential and those who do not have potential are not differentiated, and all sentient beings are called the thing to be ripened.

original: theg pa gsum du yongs su mya ngan las 'dar rung ba'i sems can rigs yod pa'i sems can rnams la ni smin par rung ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum du yongs su mya ngan las 'dar rung ba'i sems can rigs yod pa'i sems can rnams la ni smin par rung ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: Sentient beings who have potential and are suitable to attain nirvana through the three vehicles are called the thing that is suitable to be ripened.

original: de'ang mdor na gang la dmigs par bya ba yang dpag tu med pa dang / gang la gnas nas smin par bya ba yang dpag tu med pa dang / gang dang ldan pas smin par bya ba yang dpag tu med pa dang / gang smin par bya ba yang dpag tu med pa dang /🔽thabs gang gis smin par bya ba yang dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: de'ang mdor na gang la dmigs par bya ba yang dpag tu med pa dang / gang la gnas nas smin par bya ba yang dpag tu med pa dang / gang dang ldan pas smin par bya ba yang dpag tu med pa dang / gang smin par bya ba yang dpag tu med pa dang / thabs gang gis smin par bya ba yang dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: In brief, it teaches the immeasurable objects of observation, the immeasurable bases of maturation, the immeasurable means of maturation, the immeasurable maturations, and the immeasurable methods of maturation.

original: mdor na de rnams ston to //
analyzed: mdor na de rnams ston to //
translated: In brief, it teaches those.

original: de la gang la dmigs she na /
analyzed: de la gang la dmigs she na /
translated: What is observed?

original: rigs yod pa dang rigs med pa la sogs pa'i sems can kun la dmigs te /
analyzed: rigs yod pa dang rigs med pa la sogs pa'i sems can kun la dmigs te /
translated: It is observed in all sentient beings, whether they have the lineage or not, and so on.

original: de'ang dpag tu med do //
analyzed: de'ang dpag tu med do //
translated: Moreover, it is immeasurable.

original: gang la gnas nas smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang la gnas nas smin par byed ce na /
translated: On what basis is maturation created?

original: snod kyi 'jig rten la gnas nas smin par byed de /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten la gnas nas smin par byed de /
translated: Maturation is created on the basis of the world of the environment.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten de'ang dpag tu med do //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten de'ang dpag tu med do //
translated: That world of the environment is also immeasurable.

original: gang dang ldan pas smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang dang ldan pas smin par byed ce na /
translated: What is possessed in order to create maturation?

original: chos kyi khams dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas smin par byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas smin par byed do //
translated: Maturation is created by possessing the element of attributes, the perfections, and so on.

original: de'ang dpag tu med do //
analyzed: de'ang dpag tu med do //
translated: Moreover, that is immeasurable.

original: gang smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang smin par byed ce na /
translated: What does it bring to maturity?

original: smin par nas pa'i sems can rigs can rnams smin par byed de /
analyzed: smin par nas pa'i sems can rigs can rnams smin par byed de /
translated: It brings to maturity those sentient beings who are of the spiritual lineage of the three vehicles.

original: de yang dpag tu med do //
analyzed: de yang dpag tu med do //
translated: Moreover, that is immeasurable.

original: gang gis smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang gis smin par byed ce na /
translated: By what means does it bring to maturity?

original: @216a * // gdul bar bya ba'i thabs chos bstan pas smin par byed de /
analyzed: @216a * // gdul bar bya ba'i thabs chos bstan pas smin par byed de /
translated: It brings to maturity by the means of teaching the Dharma to those who are to be converted.

original: de'ang dpag tu med do //
analyzed: de'ang dpag tu med do //
translated: Moreover, that is immeasurable.

original: bstan pa'i 'bras bu rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bstan pa'i 'bras bu rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Two verses on the analysis of the results of teaching.

original: thabs gang gis sems can rnams 'dul bar byed ce na /
analyzed: thabs gang gis sems can rnams 'dul bar byed ce na /
translated: By what means does the bodhisattva convert sentient beings?

original: chos bstan pa'i thabs kyis sems can 'dul bar byed de /
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i thabs kyis sems can 'dul bar byed de /
translated: He converts sentient beings by the means of teaching the Dharma.

original: de bas na tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis /
analyzed: de bas na tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis /
translated: Therefore, in two verses,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can rnams la chos bstan na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can rnams la chos bstan na /
translated: it is shown that when the bodhisattvas teach the Dharma to sentient beings,

original: 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad yod par tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad yod par tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: there are eight kinds of results.

original: byang chub kyi ni sems bskyed cing //
analyzed: byang chub kyi ni sems bskyed cing //
translated: The generation of the spirit of enlightenment

original: de bzhin mi skye bzod pa dang // chung ngur dri ma med pa'i mig / zag pa zad pa de bzhin te //
analyzed: de bzhin mi skye bzod pa dang // chung ngur dri ma med pa'i mig / zag pa zad pa de bzhin te //
translated: Likewise, the acceptance of non-arising, the stainless eye of Dharma,🔽The exhaustion of defilements, the long abiding of the holy Dharma,

original: dam chos ring du gnas pa dang // shes dang gcod dang longs spyod dang // bshad pa dag gi 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: dam chos ring du gnas pa dang // shes dang gcod dang longs spyod dang // bshad pa dag gi 'bras bu ni //
translated: Understanding, cutting through, enjoyment, and explanation—

original: de brtson blo ldan dag gis shes //🔽zhes bya ba la blo ldan byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos bshad par brtson pa la /
analyzed: de brtson blo ldan dag gis shes // zhes bya ba la blo ldan byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos bshad par brtson pa la /
translated: The wise ones know the results of these.

original: 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad yod par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad yod par shes par bya ste /
translated: The wise bodhisattvas, who strive to explain the Dharma, should know that there are eight results.

original: 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad ni //
translated: The eight results are as follows:

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa dang / theg pa chung ngur chos kyi mig dri ma med pa thob pa dang / de bzhin du theg pa chung ngur zag pa zad pa thob pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa dang / theg pa chung ngur chos kyi mig dri ma med pa thob pa dang / de bzhin du theg pa chung ngur zag pa zad pa thob pa dang /
translated: The generation of the mind of enlightenment, the attainment of the acceptance of the non-arising of phenomena, the attainment of the stainless eye of Dharma of the Lesser Vehicle, likewise the attainment of the exhaustion of defilements in the Lesser Vehicle,

original: dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas pa dang / mi shes pa rnams chos kyi don shes par gyur pa dang / the tshom du gyur pa rnams the tshom gcod pa dang / chos kyi longs spyod chen po myong ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas pa dang / mi shes pa rnams chos kyi don shes par gyur pa dang / the tshom du gyur pa rnams the tshom gcod pa dang / chos kyi longs spyod chen po myong ba'o //
translated: the holy Dharma will remain for a long time, the ignorant will understand the meaning of the Dharma, those who are doubtful will have their doubts eliminated, and they will experience the great enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad bsdus na /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad bsdus na /
translated: If the results are summarized,

original: 'bras bu rnam pa gsum zhig ston te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa gsum zhig ston te /
translated: they are shown to be of three kinds.

original: nyan thos rnams kyis chos thob pa las /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis chos thob pa las /
translated: The results that the Listeners obtain from the Dharma

original: 'bras bu gang thob pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'bras bu gang thob pa dang nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' gnyi gas 'bras bu gang thob pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang thob pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'bras bu gang thob pa dang nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' gnyi gas 'bras bu gang thob pa ste /
translated: , the results that the Bodhisattvas obtain, and the results that both the Listeners and the Bodhisattvas obtain.

original: rnam pa de gsum ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa de gsum ston to //
translated: These are the three kinds of results.

original: de la chos bshad pa na /
analyzed: de la chos bshad pa na /
translated: When the Dharma is explained,

original: nyan pa'i sems can la la ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed de /
analyzed: nyan pa'i sems can la la ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed de /
translated: some sentient beings who listen to it will develop the mind of unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'bras bu thob pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'bras bu thob pa'o //
translated: This is the result that the Bodhisattvas obtain.

original: de la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa rnam pa gsum @216b ste ;
analyzed: de la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa rnam pa gsum @216b ste ;
translated: There are three kinds of acceptance of the nonarising of dharmas:

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la bzod pa thob pa'i dus na de kho na phyogs gcig pa'i ston pa nyid khong du chud pa la yang bzod pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la bzod pa thob pa'i dus na de kho na phyogs gcig pa'i ston pa nyid khong du chud pa la yang bzod pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one has attained acceptance on the level of earnest aspiration, one is said to have attained acceptance of the realization of the teacher of suchness in one part.

original: sa dang po'i dus na yang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa dang po'i dus na yang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: At the time of the first level, one is said to have attained acceptance of the nonarising of dharmas.

original: de'i tshe gzung 'dzin gnyis dang bral ba'i chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du byas pas na /
analyzed: de'i tshe gzung 'dzin gnyis dang bral ba'i chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du byas pas na /
translated: At that time, one has realized the expanse of reality free of the duality of subject and object

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and so one is said to have attained acceptance of the nonarising of dharmas.

original: sa brgyad pa thob pa'i dus na yang /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa thob pa'i dus na yang /
translated: At the time of attaining the eighth level,

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: one is said to have attained acceptance of the nonarising of dharmas.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For one has acquired spontaneous nonconceptual gnosis.

original: de la chos bshad pa'i dus na kha cig gis ni bzod pa'i dus de kho na phyogs gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du byed pa dang / kha cig gis ni sa dang po thob /
analyzed: de la chos bshad pa'i dus na kha cig gis ni bzod pa'i dus de kho na phyogs gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du byed pa dang / kha cig gis ni sa dang po thob /
translated: When the Dharma is being explained, some will actualize the meditative absorption of the single aspect of acceptance at that very time, and some will attain the first bodhisattva level.

original: kha cig gis ni sa brgyad pa la 'jug pas /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni sa brgyad pa la 'jug pas /
translated: Some will enter the eighth level.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: So this is called “acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.”

original: 'bras bu 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis thob pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis thob pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: This result is also a result obtained by bodhisattvas.🔽Obtaining the immaculate eye of Dharma

original: chos la dri ma med pa'i mig thob pa ni /
analyzed: chos la dri ma med pa'i mig thob pa ni /
translated: One obtains the eye that is unstained with regard to phenomena.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa la gnas pa rnams la mthong ba'i lam skyes nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa la gnas pa rnams la mthong ba'i lam skyes nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs te /
translated: For those who follow the Listeners’ Vehicle, once the path of seeing has arisen, they eliminate the defilements that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing

original: rgyun du zhugs pa thob pa ni chos kyi mig dri ma med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa thob pa ni chos kyi mig dri ma med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: and attain the result of stream enterer. This is called “the immaculate eye of Dharma.”

original: shes rab kyis bden pa bzhi mthong bas na /
analyzed: shes rab kyis bden pa bzhi mthong bas na /
translated: Since they see the four truths with their wisdom,

original: chos kyi mig ces bya la /
analyzed: chos kyi mig ces bya la /
translated: it is called “the eye of Dharma.”

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas na dri ma med pa zhes bya ste de bas na mdo sde dang de dag gi nang nas /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas na dri ma med pa zhes bya ste de bas na mdo sde dang de dag gi nang nas /
translated: It is called stainless because it abandons the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pas na /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pas na /
translated: Therefore, in the sutra and within it,

original: rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba'i chos la chos kyi mig skyes so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba'i chos la chos kyi mig skyes so zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said that the Dharma eye arose for the dust-free and stainless Dharma.

original: de la bzod pa'i dus na ni /
analyzed: de la bzod pa'i dus na ni /
translated: At the time of acceptance,

original: rdul med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rdul med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: it is called dust-free.

original: bzod pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because through acceptance, the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing are abandoned.

original: ye shes kyi dus na ni dri ma dang bral ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi dus na ni dri ma dang bral ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: At the time of knowledge, it is called stainless.

original: ye shes kyis rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyis rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because through knowledge, the direct realization of liberation is attained.

original: mthong ba'i lam skyes pa'i gang zag dag ni chos bshad pa'i mthus /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam skyes pa'i gang zag dag ni chos bshad pa'i mthus /
translated: The persons who have given rise to the path of seeing, through the power of explaining the Dharma,

original: bsgom pa'i lam dang / mthar thug pa'i lam skyes nas /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam dang / mthar thug pa'i lam skyes nas /
translated: having given rise to the path of cultivation and the path of conclusion,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid dgra bcom pa'i 'bras @217a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid dgra bcom pa'i 'bras @217a * //
translated: The result of arhat is characterized by freedom from all afflictions.🔽

original: bu thob pa ni zag pa zad pa thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bu thob pa ni zag pa zad pa thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The attainment of the fruit of arhatship, which is characterized by freedom from all afflictions, is called the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants.

original: dri ma med pa'i chos kyi mig thob pa dang / zag pa zad pa thob pa gnyis ni /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i chos kyi mig thob pa dang / zag pa zad pa thob pa gnyis ni /
translated: The attainment of the stainless Dharma eye and the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants

original: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis ni chos thos pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis ni chos thos pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: are the fruits of listening to the Dharma for noble disciples.

original: dam pa'i chos gzhan la bshad na /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos gzhan la bshad na /
translated: When the true Dharma is explained to others,

original: des kyang gzhan la bshad /
analyzed: des kyang gzhan la bshad /
translated: it is also explained to others by them,

original: des kyang gzhan la bshad pa'i sgo nas mar me gcig las mar me mang po 'phel ba bzhin du dam pa'i chos yun ring du mi 'jig par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: des kyang gzhan la bshad pa'i sgo nas mar me gcig las mar me mang po 'phel ba bzhin du dam pa'i chos yun ring du mi 'jig par 'gyur bas na /
translated: and by that means, just as many lamps are increased from a single lamp, the true Dharma does not perish for a long time.

original: dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the long-lasting of the true Dharma.

original: sngon theg pa che chung gi chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la shes pa med pa las /
analyzed: sngon theg pa che chung gi chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la shes pa med pa las /
translated: Previously, with regard to the general and specific characteristics of the Dharmas of the Great and Lesser Vehicles, there was no knowledge.

original: dam pa'i chos shes nas shes pa med pa dang bral te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos shes nas shes pa med pa dang bral te /
translated: But having known the true Dharma, one is free from ignorance.

original: theg pa che chung gi chos rnams kyi rang dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: theg pa che chung gi chos rnams kyi rang dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par 'gyur bas na /
translated: One becomes skilled in the general and specific characteristics of the teachings of the Great and Lesser Vehicles.

original: don shes par 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don shes par 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “understanding the meaning.”

original: sngon chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la the tshom du gyur pa'i chos /
analyzed: sngon chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la the tshom du gyur pa'i chos /
translated: Previously, one had doubts about the general and specific characteristics of phenomena.

original: chos thos nas chos kyi mtshan nyid la the tshom thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur bas na the tshom gcod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thos nas chos kyi mtshan nyid la the tshom thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur bas na the tshom gcod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having heard the teachings, one becomes free from all doubts about the characteristics of phenomena. Therefore, it is called “cutting through doubt.”

original: sngon gyi mi shes pa yang med the tshom gyi mi shes pa yang med pa nges pa'i sems thob pa rnams ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi mi shes pa yang med the tshom gyi mi shes pa yang med pa nges pa'i sems thob pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who have attained a definite mind, who have neither the ignorance of the past nor the ignorance of doubt,

original: dam pa'i chos rgya chen po dag thob nas /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos rgya chen po dag thob nas /
translated: having attained the vast, sublime Dharma,

original: chos kyi longs spyod kha na ma thob med pa'i don sems kyis myong bar 'gyur bas chos la longs spyod thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi longs spyod kha na ma thob med pa'i don sems kyis myong bar 'gyur bas chos la longs spyod thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: experience the meaning of the Dharma’s enjoyment with a mind free from wrongdoing. Therefore, it is called “attaining the enjoyment of the Dharma.”

original: de ltar dam chos yun ring du gnas pa dang / mi shes pa rnams don shes par 'gyur ba dang / the tshom gcod pa dang chos kyi longs spyod myong ba rnams ni /
analyzed: de ltar dam chos yun ring du gnas pa dang / mi shes pa rnams don shes par 'gyur ba dang / the tshom gcod pa dang chos kyi longs spyod myong ba rnams ni /
translated: Thus, the holy Dharma will remain for a long time, the ignorant will come to understand its meaning, doubts will be resolved, and those who experience the enjoyment of the Dharma will be able to do so.

original: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' gnyi ga'i chos thos pa'i thun mong gi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' gnyi ga'i chos thos pa'i thun mong gi 'bras bu'o //
translated: Thus, the long duration of the true Dharma, the understanding of the meaning by those who do not understand, the elimination of doubt, and the experience of the enjoyment of the Dharma are the common results of listening to the Dharma for both the sravaka and the bodhisattva.

original: gcig nas gcig tu 'dzin pas zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' la las gzhan dag la chos bshad na /
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu 'dzin pas zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' la las gzhan dag la chos bshad na /
translated: The phrase by the preservation of the Dharma from one to another means that when a bodhisattva explains the Dharma to others,

original: des chos bzung nas /
analyzed: des chos bzung nas /
translated: they preserve the Dharma

original: gzhan la 'chad par byed /🔽des kyang gzhan la 'chad par byed pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: gzhan la 'chad par byed / des kyang gzhan la 'chad par byed pa'i sgo nas /
translated: and explain it to others.

original: dam pa'i chos yun ring du 'jig rten du gnas par 'gyur ro //🔽nges pa rnams ni bya ba la /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yun ring du 'jig rten du gnas par 'gyur ro // nges pa rnams ni bya ba la /
translated: By this means, the true Dharma remains in the world for a long time.

original: mi shes pa med pa dang the tshom med pa'i gang zag ni nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa med pa dang the tshom med pa'i gang zag ni nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase those who are certain in their action means that a person who is free from ignorance and doubt is called certain.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi dga' ba'i ro kha na ma tho ba @217b med pa rgya chen po la longs spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi dga' ba'i ro kha na ma tho ba @217b med pa rgya chen po la longs spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: One experiences the great, irreproachable feast of delight in the holy Dharma.

original: mi shes pa med pa dang the tshom med pa'i gang zag rnams dam pa'i chos thos pa ni /
analyzed: mi shes pa med pa dang the tshom med pa'i gang zag rnams dam pa'i chos thos pa ni /
translated: Those persons who are free from ignorance and doubt, when they hear the holy Dharma,

original: chos kyi dga' ba'i ro nyon mongs pa'i dri mas ma gos pas zag pa med pa'i chos kyi longs spyod chen po myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dga' ba'i ro nyon mongs pa'i dri mas ma gos pas zag pa med pa'i chos kyi longs spyod chen po myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: experience the great feast of the Dharma, the delight of the Dharma, which is uncontaminated by the stains of the addictions.

original: theg pa chen po'i che ba po rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la /🔽gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed pa yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i che ba po rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed pa yang ma zad kyi /
translated: Two verses on the analysis of the greatness of the universal vehicle.

original: bdag nyid kyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang yang ldan te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang yang ldan te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is engaged in the perfection of the aims of others also has the perfection of his own aim.

original: de la bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of his own aim?

original: theg pa chen po'i bdag nyid chen po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i bdag nyid chen po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with the greatness of the universal vehicle.

original: de la theg pa chen po'i bdag nyid chen po la yang bdag nyid chen po rnam pa bdun yod do //
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po'i bdag nyid chen po la yang bdag nyid chen po rnam pa bdun yod do //
translated: In this regard, the greatness of the universal vehicle is sevenfold.

original: bdag nyid chen po rnam pa bdun la theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //🔽bdag nyid chen po rnam pa bdun yang /
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po rnam pa bdun la theg pa chen po zhes bya'o // bdag nyid chen po rnam pa bdun yang /
translated: The universal vehicle is so called because it is endowed with seven greatnesses.

original: chen po rnam pa gnyis su bsdus te /
analyzed: chen po rnam pa gnyis su bsdus te /
translated: The seven greatnesses are included in two greatnesses:

original: rgyu che ba dang 'bras bu che ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu che ba dang 'bras bu che ba'o //
translated: the greatness of cause and the greatness of result.🔽The greatness of objective,

original: dmigs pa dag ni che ba dang // grub pa gnyis kyang de bzhin du //
analyzed: dmigs pa dag ni che ba dang // grub pa gnyis kyang de bzhin du //
translated: and likewise the greatness of accomplishment,

original: ye shes gnyis ni brtson 'grus brtsams //
analyzed: ye shes gnyis ni brtson 'grus brtsams //
translated: and the greatness of the two knowledges,🔽and the greatness of the two vehicles,🔽and the greatness of skill in liberative art,🔽and the greatness of the two stores,

original: thabs la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang // yang dag thob pa chen po dang // sangs rgyas las ni chen po'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang // yang dag thob pa chen po dang // sangs rgyas las ni chen po'o //
translated: and the greatness of the two marvelous abilities.🔽It is called the universal vehicle

original: chen po de dag ldan pas na //🔽theg pa chen po brjod pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽chen po rnam pa bdun dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: chen po de dag ldan pas na // theg pa chen po brjod pa'o // zhes bya ba la / chen po rnam pa bdun dang ldan pas na /
translated: because it is endowed with these greatnesses.

original: theg pa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: The universal vehicle is so called because it is endowed with seven greatnesses.

original: chen po rnam pa bdun ni /
analyzed: chen po rnam pa bdun ni /
translated: The seven greatnesses are

original: dmigs pa che ba dang / sgrub pa gnyis che ba dang / ye shes gnyis che ba dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa che ba dang / thabs la mkhas par 'gyur ba che ba dang / yang dag par thob pa che ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi las che ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa che ba dang / sgrub pa gnyis che ba dang / ye shes gnyis che ba dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa che ba dang / thabs la mkhas par 'gyur ba che ba dang / yang dag par thob pa che ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi las che ba'o //
translated: and greatness of Buddha deeds.

original: dmigs pa chen po ni rgya che ba'i mdo la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa chen po ni rgya che ba'i mdo la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Greatness of object is due to the possession of the scriptures of the universal vehicle, the scriptures of the great vehicle.

original: nyan thos rnams ni sde snod gsum tsam la dmigs par zad kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni sde snod gsum tsam la dmigs par zad kyi /
translated: The disciples have only the three baskets of scriptures as their object.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni zab cing rgya che ba'i mdo sde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa la @218a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni zab cing rgya che ba'i mdo sde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa la @218a * //
translated: But the bodhisattvas have as their object the scriptures of the universal vehicle, the perfection of wisdom in one hundred thousand verses,

original: sogs pa stong phrag brgya pa'i mdo sde dpag tu med pa la dmigs pas na dmigs pa che'o //
analyzed: sogs pa stong phrag brgya pa'i mdo sde dpag tu med pa la dmigs pas na dmigs pa che'o //
translated: and the immeasurable scriptures of the universal vehicle in hundreds of thousands of verses.

original: sgrub pa chen po ni sgrub pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po ni sgrub pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Greatness of practice is due to the practice of the two aims.

original: bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don to zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two aims are the aim of self and the aim of others.

original: nyan thos rnams ni bdag gi don tsam sgrub par zad kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni bdag gi don tsam sgrub par zad kyi /
translated: The Listeners accomplish only their own goal,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dag bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga'i don bsgrubs pas na sgrub pa che'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dag bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga'i don bsgrubs pas na sgrub pa che'o //
translated: but the Bodhisattvas accomplish the goal of both themselves and others.

original: ye shes chen po ni chen po gnyis te /
analyzed: ye shes chen po ni chen po gnyis te /
translated: Great knowledge is twofold:

original: gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa ste /
translated: the selflessness of the person and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: rtogs pa'i dus na'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dus na'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: At the time of realization.

original: rtogs pa'i dus ni sa dang po la bya ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dus ni sa dang po la bya ste /
translated: The time of realization is the first ground.

original: sa dang po'i dus na gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa gnyis rtogs pas ni /
analyzed: sa dang po'i dus na gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa gnyis rtogs pas ni /
translated: At the time of the first ground, since both the selflessness of the person and the selflessness of phenomena are realized,

original: ye shes chen po zhes bya ste /🔽nyan thos kyi sa rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: ye shes chen po zhes bya ste / nyan thos kyi sa rnams kyis ni /
translated: it is called “great knowledge.”🔽The Listeners,

original: mthong ba'i lam rgyun du zhugs pa thob pa'i dus na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam rgyun du zhugs pa thob pa'i dus na /
translated: at the time of attaining the path of seeing and the state of Stream Enterer,

original: gang zag la bdag med pa las ma rtogs pa'i phyir ye shes chen po zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa las ma rtogs pa'i phyir ye shes chen po zhes mi bya'o //
translated: do not realize the selflessness of the person, and therefore it is not called “great knowledge.”

original: brtson 'grus chen po ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du rtag tu gus par sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /🔽nyan thos rnams kyi tshe gsum mam /
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du rtag tu gus par sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la / nyan thos rnams kyi tshe gsum mam /
translated: Great effort is the constant application of effort for three countless eons.

original: tshe bdun tsam zhig brtson 'grus rtsom gyi /
analyzed: tshe bdun tsam zhig brtson 'grus rtsom gyi /
translated: The disciples apply effort for three or seven lifetimes.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni rab tu nye ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni rab tu nye ba /
translated: The bodhisattvas apply effort for a long time,

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du brtson 'grus rtsom ste /

original: de bas na brtson 'grus brtsams pa che'o //
analyzed: de bas na brtson 'grus brtsams pa che'o //
translated: Therefore, their effort is great.🔽Great skill in means is the non-abandonment of cyclic existence without afflictions.

original: thabs la mkhas pa chen po ni nyon mongs pa med par 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba la nyan thos rnams ni skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan par mthong la mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'i mtshan
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa chen po ni nyon mongs pa med par 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba la nyan thos rnams ni skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan par mthong la mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'i mtshan
translated: The disciples see that cyclic existence is characterized by the suffering of birth, aging, and so forth, and that nirvana is characterized by peace.

original: nyid du mthong bas /🔽'khor ba spangs nas /
analyzed: nyid du mthong bas / 'khor ba spangs nas /
translated: Therefore,🔽they abandon cyclic existence and aspire to actualize nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du bya bar sems pa'i phyir thabs chen po zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du bya bar sems pa'i phyir thabs chen po zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, their skill in means is not great.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni shes rab dang snying rje dang ldan pas snying rjes 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni shes rab dang snying rje dang ldan pas snying rjes 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong la /
translated: Bodhisattvas, endowed with wisdom and compassion, do not abandon samsara through compassion.

original: shes rab kyis ni 'khor bar gnas kyang 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pas mi gos par byed de /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni 'khor bar gnas kyang 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pas mi gos par byed de /
translated: And through wisdom, they do not become defiled by the addictions of samsara while dwelling in samsara.🔽They are like a lotus, born in the mud but unsullied by the defects of the mud.

original: dper na padmo 'dam las skyes kyang 'dam gyi nyes pas mi gos pa bzhin du gnas pas na @218b thabs mkhas pa che'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na padmo 'dam las skyes kyang 'dam gyi nyes pas mi gos pa bzhin du gnas pas na @218b thabs mkhas pa che'o zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the greatness of their skill in means.

original: de yan chad rgyu che ba bstan to //🔽yang dag pa'i thob pa chen po ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang // 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis ni mjug tu dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mtha' dag skye mched dang / zil gyis gzon pa'i skye mched dang /
analyzed: de yan chad rgyu che ba bstan to // yang dag pa'i thob pa chen po ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang // 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis ni mjug tu dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mtha' dag skye mched dang / zil gyis gzon pa'i skye mched dang /
translated: From here on is the teaching of the greatness of the cause.🔽The greatness of the right attainment is the powers, the fearlessnesses, etc.🔽The noble disciples attain only the fruit of arhatship at the end, and only the six superknowledges, the spheres of mastery, the spheres of totality, and the liberations.

original: mngon par shes pa drug tsam las mi 'thob kyi //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug tsam las mi 'thob kyi //
translated: They do not attain the great right attainment.

original: byang chub sems sems dpa' rnams kyi ni mthar stobs dang // mi 'jigs pa dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa yon tan dpag tu med pa 'thob pa che ba zhes bya'o//
analyzed: byang chub sems sems dpa' rnams kyi ni mthar stobs dang // mi 'jigs pa dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa yon tan dpag tu med pa 'thob pa che ba zhes bya'o//
translated: The greatness of the bodhisattvas is that they attain the infinite excellences of the powers, the fearlessnesses, the unique qualities, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las chen po ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las chen po ni //
translated: The greatness of the Buddha's activities is

analyzed: mngon par byang chub ston pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag / ces bya ba la /
translated: The demonstration of perfect enlightenment and of nirvana.

original: nyan thos rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis ni //
translated: The disciples,

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu 'thob cing mya ngan 'das 'das pa thob na //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu 'thob cing mya ngan 'das 'das pa thob na //
translated: having attained the fruit of arhatship and the nirvana of passing away,

analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa'i las mi byed kyi //
translated: do not perform the deeds of perfect enlightenment, turning the wheel of the Dharma, and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni mngon par sangs rgyas nas kyang sems can bsgral bar bya ba'i phyir /'og min gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa dang / lhums su gshegs pa dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba la sogs pa nas //

translated: But the bodhisattvas, even after perfect enlightenment, remain in the palace of Akaniṣṭha, enter the womb, demonstrate perfect enlightenment, and so on, in order to liberate sentient beings.

original: yongs su mya ngan 'das 'das pa'i bar dag chos ston pa'i phrin las mdzad pas na phrin las che ba la zhes bya ste //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan 'das 'das pa'i bar dag chos ston pa'i phrin las mdzad pas na phrin las che ba la zhes bya ste //
translated: Because he performs the deeds of teaching the Dharma, up to and after his final nirvana, he is called the one with great deeds.

original: rnam pa de gnyis kyis ni 'bras bu che bar bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa de gnyis kyis ni 'bras bu che bar bstan to //
translated: These two aspects show his greatness of result.🔽Two verses on the analysis of the Great Vehicle’s inclusion.

translated: The Great Vehicle is not the vehicle of the disciples and hermit buddhas, because it is not their vehicle.

analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i skabs bshad do //
translated: It is the Great Vehicle because it is the vehicle of the great beings.🔽It is the Great Vehicle because it

original: de la theg pa chen po zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa @219a * //
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa @219a * //
translated: The so called Great Vehicle is the perfection of wisdom in the one hundred thousand verse perfection of wisdom sutra.🔽If one were to explain the meaning of the Great Vehicle in terms of its marvelousness and so on, it would be indeed immeasurable.

original: las / rmad ga cad la sogs pa la bya bas theg pa chen po'i don brjod na dpag tu med mod kyi 'on kyang dpag tu med pa de dag bsdus na chos rnam pa brgyad kyi nang du /🔽theg pa chen po'i don ma lus par 'dus pa na /
analyzed: las / rmad ga cad la sogs pa la bya bas theg pa chen po'i don brjod na dpag tu med mod kyi 'on kyang dpag tu med pa de dag bsdus na chos rnam pa brgyad kyi nang du / theg pa chen po'i don ma lus par 'dus pa na /
translated: However, when that which is immeasurable is summarized, it is subsumed within eight categories.

original: chos rnam pa brgyad la theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnam pa brgyad la theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: When all the meaning of the Great Vehicle is subsumed, it is called the Great Vehicle of eight categories.

original: de la chos rnam pa brgyad bsdus pa'i don kyang rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas mos pa spyod pa'i sar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de la chos rnam pa brgyad bsdus pa'i don kyang rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas mos pa spyod pa'i sar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrubs te /
translated: The meaning subsumed within these eight categories is that bodhisattvas who possess the Mahayana potential generate the mind aspiring to supreme enlightenment and on the level of earnest aspiration they accomplish the bodhisattva activities of the six perfections.

original: de'i 'og tu sa bcu'i rim gyis bsgoms nas sangs rgyas kyi sa mngon du byas pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sa bcu'i rim gyis bsgoms nas sangs rgyas kyi sa mngon du byas pa ste /
translated: Thereafter, they meditate on the ten levels and manifest the level of buddhahood.

original: de rnams la theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams la theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the Great Vehicle.

original: rigs dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Lineage and so on.

original: rigs zhes bya ba dang sa bon zhes bya ba dang skal pa yod pa zhes bya ba'i don gcig ste /🔽don du na sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du /
analyzed: rigs zhes bya ba dang sa bon zhes bya ba dang skal pa yod pa zhes bya ba'i don gcig ste / don du na sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du /
translated: Lineage, seed, and having a portion are synonyms.🔽In fact, it is the existence of the seed of the six perfections, from generosity to wisdom,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi sa bon yod pa la rigs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi sa bon yod pa la rigs zhes bya ste /
translated: that is called the lineage.

original: 'di ni rigs la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ni rigs la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don bstan te /
translated: This is the explanation of the meaning of the term abiding in the lineage.

original: chos rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: chos rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is the first aspect of the teaching.

original: chos la mos pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos la mos pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Aspiration to the Dharma and so on.

original: de ltar theg pa chen po'i rigs yod pas /
analyzed: de ltar theg pa chen po'i rigs yod pas /
translated: Thus, since one has the lineage of the Great Vehicle,

original: zab cing gya che ba'i chos la yang sems gcig tu dad pa ni chos la mos pa zhes bya ste 'di ni chos rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: zab cing gya che ba'i chos la yang sems gcig tu dad pa ni chos la mos pa zhes bya ste 'di ni chos rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: one has a single-pointed faith in the profound and extensive Dharma. This is called aspiration to the Dharma. This is the second aspect of the teaching.

original: de ltar sems ni bskyed pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar sems ni bskyed pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, having generated the mind and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyang yod /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyang yod /
translated: One has the lineage of the bodhisattvas.

original: zab cing rgya che ba'i chos la yang mos par 'gyur bas de'i 'og tu /
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba'i chos la yang mos par 'gyur bas de'i 'og tu /
translated: And one also becomes devoted to the profound and extensive Dharma.🔽After that, one makes the aspiration prayer, “May I attain unsurpassed enlightenment in order to benefit myself and all sentient beings.”

original: bdag dang sems can thams cad la phan par bya ba'i phyir bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs pa ni sems bskyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can thams cad la phan par bya ba'i phyir bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs pa ni sems bskyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called “generating the mind of enlightenment.”

original: 'di ni chos rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di ni chos rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: These are the three aspects of Dharma.

original: de yan chad kyis rigs la gnas pas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de zhes bya ba'i don smras so //
analyzed: de yan chad kyis rigs la gnas pas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de zhes bya ba'i don smras so //
translated: Up to this point, the meaning of “one who is abiding in the lineage generates the mind of enlightenment for unsurpassed enlightenment” has been explained.🔽The practice of generosity and so forth

original: sbyin la sogs pa sgrub pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin la sogs pa sgrub pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And the practice of generosity and so forth.🔽

original: de ltar bla na med pa'i byang chub sems bskyed nas mos pa spyod pa'i sar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du /
analyzed: de ltar bla na med pa'i byang chub sems bskyed nas mos pa spyod pa'i sar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du /
translated: Having thus generated the mind of unsurpassed enlightenment, on the ground of practice through devoted interest, one practices the six perfections from the perfection of generosity to the perfection of wisdom.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa ni chos rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa ni chos rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: This is the fourfold Dharma.

original: des ni byang @219b chub tu sems bskyed nas mos pa spyod pa'i sar pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub ces bya ba'i don bstan to //
analyzed: des ni byang @219b chub tu sems bskyed nas mos pa spyod pa'i sar pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub ces bya ba'i don bstan to //
translated: This teaches the meaning of “having generated the Thought of Awakening, on the stage of devoted conduct, one accomplishes the six perfections.”

original: skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang // zhes bya ba la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon bar chags pa ni skyon te /
analyzed: skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang // zhes bya ba la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon bar chags pa ni skyon te /
translated: “Entering into the faultless” means that the fault is the manifest attachment to the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: sa dang por gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par chags pa spangs pas na /
analyzed: sa dang por gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par chags pa spangs pas na /
translated: On the first stage, one abandons the manifest attachment to the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sar pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrubs pas sa dang po thob pa'i phyir skyon med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sar pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrubs pas sa dang po thob pa'i phyir skyon med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because one accomplishes the six perfections on the stage of devoted conduct and attains the first stage, it is called “faultless.”

original: 'di ni chos lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos lnga'o //
translated: These are the five dharmas.

original: sems can rnams ni smin byed dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni smin byed dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: “One brings sentient beings to maturity” means that

original: de nas sa gnyis nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas sa gnyis nas brtsams te /
translated: from the second stage onward,

original: sa bdun pa man chad na byang chub kyi phyogs dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rnams kyis sems can bstan pa la ma dad pa rnams ni bstan pa la dad par byed /
analyzed: sa bdun pa man chad na byang chub kyi phyogs dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rnams kyis sems can bstan pa la ma dad pa rnams ni bstan pa la dad par byed /
translated: on the seventh stage and below, one brings to maturity those sentient beings who are not faithful in the teachings by means of the factors of awakening and the perfections.

original: bstan pa la dad pa rnams ni dge ba la bkod nas yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: bstan pa la dad pa rnams ni dge ba la bkod nas yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: Having established those who have faith in the teaching in virtue, he brings them to full maturity.

original: 'di ni chos drug go //
analyzed: 'di ni chos drug go //
translated: These are the six dharmas.

original: zhing yang yongs su sbyong ba dang // mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhing yang yongs su sbyong ba dang // mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das // zhes bya ba la /
translated: He purifies the buddhaverse, and he abides in the path to nonabiding nirvana.

original: de nas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa /
analyzed: de nas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa /
translated: Thereupon, on the irreversible stage,

original: sa brgyad pa dang / dgu pa dang / bcu pa la ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la gnas par byed de /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa dang / dgu pa dang / bcu pa la ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la gnas par byed de /
translated: on the eighth, ninth, and tenth stages, he purifies the buddhaverse and he abides in the path to nonabiding nirvana.

original: 'di ni chos bdun no //
analyzed: 'di ni chos bdun no //
translated: These are the seven dharmas.

original: de sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba la ni snod kyi 'jig rten shel dang gser la sogs pa'i kha dog tu snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba la ni snod kyi 'jig rten shel dang gser la sogs pa'i kha dog tu snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: In purifying the buddhaverse, he makes the physical world appear as crystal, gold, and so on.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ni shes pa dang snying rje gnyis te /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ni shes pa dang snying rje gnyis te /
translated: In the path to nonabiding nirvana, he has both knowledge and compassion.

original: snying rjes 'khor ba yongs su ma btang na /
analyzed: snying rjes 'khor ba yongs su ma btang na /
translated: Because of compassion, he does not abandon samsara,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig gi phyogs la mi gnas so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig gi phyogs la mi gnas so //
translated: and therefore he does not abide in mere nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du 'khor ba na gnas kyang ye shes kyi mthus /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du 'khor ba na gnas kyang ye shes kyi mthus /
translated: The Bodhisattva, for the sake of sentient beings, abides in cyclic existence, but by the power of his gnosis,

original: 'khor ba'i nyes pas mi gos pas na /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i nyes pas mi gos pas na /
translated: he is not sullied by the faults of cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba na mi gnas so //
analyzed: 'khor ba na mi gnas so //
translated: Therefore, he does not abide in cyclic existence.

original: byang chub mchog kyang rnam par ston //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub mchog kyang rnam par ston // zhes bya ba la /
translated: He also displays the supreme enlightenment.

original: de nas sa bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyis sku gsum thob pas na byang chub pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nas sa bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyis sku gsum thob pas na byang chub pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Then, on the eleventh ground, the Buddha ground, he attains the three bodies of a Buddha, and so is called “enlightened.”

original: byang chub pa nas yum gyi lhums su 'jug pa dang / lhums nas 'byung ba dang / khab nas byung zhing rab tu 'byung ba bstan pa la sogs pa bstan nas mngon par sangs rgyas pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dag ston par byed de de ni chos brgyad pa'o //🔽de @220a * //
analyzed: byang chub pa nas yum gyi lhums su 'jug pa dang / lhums nas 'byung ba dang / khab nas byung zhing rab tu 'byung ba bstan pa la sogs pa bstan nas mngon par sangs rgyas pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dag ston par byed de de ni chos brgyad pa'o // de @220a * //
translated: From that enlightenment, he displays entering the womb of his mother, leaving the womb, leaving home and going forth, and so on, and then displays perfect buddhahood, turning the wheel of Dharma, and passing into parinirvāṇa. That is the eighth topic.

original: bas na theg pa chen po zhes bya ba yang mdor bsdus na /
analyzed: bas na theg pa chen po zhes bya ba yang mdor bsdus na /
translated: Therefore, the Great Vehicle, in brief,

original: rigs nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rigs nas brtsams te /
translated: is from the lineage,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dag bstan pa theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dag bstan pa theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The teaching of the stages of the path to enlightenment, from the generation of the Thought of enlightenment up to complete Nirvana, is called the Great Vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Ten verses on the analysis of the bodhisattva.

original: gang du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgrub pa des yon tan rnam pa gnyis thob ste /
analyzed: gang du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgrub pa des yon tan rnam pa gnyis thob ste /
translated: In the practice of the elements of enlightenment, one obtains two kinds of virtues.

original: yon tan gnyis ni bsgrub pa'i yon tan dang / rab tu bsngags pa'i yon tan no /
analyzed: yon tan gnyis ni bsgrub pa'i yon tan dang / rab tu bsngags pa'i yon tan no /
translated: The two virtues are the virtue of practice and the virtue of praise.

original: de la sgrub pa'i yon tan la yang rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan dang bral ba'i yon tan dang sems can la mngon du lta ba'i yon tan gsum ni 'di yan chad du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la sgrub pa'i yon tan la yang rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan dang bral ba'i yon tan dang sems can la mngon du lta ba'i yon tan gsum ni 'di yan chad du bshad zin to //
translated: The three kinds of virtue of practice are the virtue of natural outflow, the virtue of freedom, and the virtue of manifest regard for sentient beings. These have been explained above.

original: da ni byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dbye ba man chad kyis rab tu bsngags pa'i yon tan ston to //
analyzed: da ni byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dbye ba man chad kyis rab tu bsngags pa'i yon tan ston to //
translated: Now, from the analysis of the bodhisattva on, the virtue of praise is taught.

original: de la mos pa spyod pa'i sa nas /
analyzed: de la mos pa spyod pa'i sa nas /
translated: Therein, on the stage of action out of faith, the bodhisattva is called a beginner.

original: sa bcu rnams la phye na byang chub sems dpa' du yod pa dang / sa de dag la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sa bcu rnams la phye na byang chub sems dpa' du yod pa dang / sa de dag la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa ni /
translated: If one analyzes the ten grounds, how many bodhisattvas are there and what are the characteristics of the bodhisattvas who abide on those grounds?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This is presented in the chapter called “The Divisions of the Bodhisattvas.”

original: de tshigs su bcad pa bcus bstan to //
analyzed: de tshigs su bcad pa bcus bstan to //
translated: This is presented in ten verses.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lnga po ni //🔽sa rnams kun du shes par bya //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lnga po ni // sa rnams kun du shes par bya //
translated: The five kinds of bodhisattvas

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽sa bcu'i steng du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / sa bcu'i steng du /
translated: should be known on all the grounds.🔽On the ten grounds

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa bstan te sa bcu gcig po de dag la /
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa bstan te sa bcu gcig po de dag la /
translated: and on the level of earnest aspiration,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa lnga zhig yod par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gcig ni mos dang ldan pa dang / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa lnga zhig yod par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to // gcig ni mos dang ldan pa dang / zhes bya ba la /
translated: there are five kinds of bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa lnga po gang yin pa de ni ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa lnga po gang yin pa de ni ston to //
translated: The five kinds of bodhisattvas are indicated by the verse beginning with “One who is endowed with interest.”

original: de la gcig ces bya ba ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa bzhi la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhe bya ste /
analyzed: de la gcig ces bya ba ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa bzhi la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhe bya ste /
translated: Of these, the one who is endowed with interest is the bodhisattva who is on the four levels of earnest aspiration.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa bzhi la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni mos pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa bzhi la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni mos pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the four stages of the Joyous and so on, which are the stages of devoted engagement, is called the bodhisattva of devoted engagement.

original: ji lta'i phyir mos pa dang ldan pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta'i phyir mos pa dang ldan pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is he called the bodhisattva of devoted engagement?

original: de'i tshe chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid mngon sum du ma byas kyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid mngon sum du ma byas kyi /
translated: At that time, he has not yet realized the universal characteristic of the realm of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid la dad cing yid ches pa tsam yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid la dad cing yid ches pa tsam yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, he has mere faith in and conviction about the universal characteristic of the realm of the Dharma.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa gzhan //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa gzhan // zhes bya ba la / gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The other is the pure universal vehicle intention.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gnyis pa ni //🔽zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gnyis pa ni // zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The other refers to the second bodhisattva.

original: sa dang @220b po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa dang @220b po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has entered the stages is called the bodhisattva of pure universal vehicle intention.

original: ci'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is he called the bodhisattva of pure universal vehicle intention?

original: de'i tshe chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sems dang ldan pa lhag pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i tshe chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sems dang ldan pa lhag pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: At that time, he realizes the characteristic of the universal of the dharma-dhātu, and he has the thought of the perfection of benefit for self and others.🔽He is called “superior” because he has abandoned the afflictions and the obscurations to knowledge that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called “pure” because he has abandoned the afflictions and the obscurations to knowledge that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: mtshan ma dang ni zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang ni zhes bya ba la //
translated: “Signs” means

original: sa gnyis pa yan chad sa drug pa man chad la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa yan chad sa drug pa man chad la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the second stage up to the sixth stage is called the bodhisattva with signs.

original: ci'i phyir mtshan ma dang bcas pa zhes bya zhe na /🔽sa gnyis pa la ni 'di ni nyan thos kyi theg pa /🔽'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mtshan ma dang bcas pa zhes bya zhe na / sa gnyis pa la ni 'di ni nyan thos kyi theg pa / 'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa /
translated: Why is he called the one with signs?

original: 'di ni theg pa chen po'o zhes theg pa la rnam pa sna tshogs su 'byed pa'i mtshan ma spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni theg pa chen po'o zhes theg pa la rnam pa sna tshogs su 'byed pa'i mtshan ma spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: On the second stage, he engages in the practice of the signs that differentiate the vehicles in various ways, thinking, “This is the vehicle of the śrāvakas, this is the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas, this is the Great Vehicle.”

original: sa gsum pa la ni lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan ma spangs so //
analyzed: sa gsum pa la ni lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan ma spangs so //
translated: On the third ground, the signs of the innate identity view are abandoned.

original: sa bzhi pa la ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa la gnod pa'i rnam par mthong ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa la zhi ba'i rnam par mthong ba'i mtshan ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bzhi pa la ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa la gnod pa'i rnam par mthong ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa la zhi ba'i rnam par mthong ba'i mtshan ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: On the fourth ground, there are signs of seeing the truths of suffering and origin as harmful and of seeing the truths of cessation and path as peaceful.

original: sa lnga pa la ni bzo'i las kyi gnas rnam pa sna tshogs la 'jug cing rtog pa kun du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa lnga pa la ni bzo'i las kyi gnas rnam pa sna tshogs la 'jug cing rtog pa kun du 'byung ngo //
translated: On the fifth ground, there is the occurrence of conceptualization engaging in various kinds of artistic activities.

original: sa drug pa la ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba /
analyzed: sa drug pa la ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba /
translated: On the sixth ground, there are signs of realization of dependent arising

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa lugs bzhin pa dang / ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa la sogs pa lugs las bzlog pa la rtogs pa'i mtshan ma yod pas /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa lugs bzhin pa dang / ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa la sogs pa lugs las bzlog pa la rtogs pa'i mtshan ma yod pas /
translated: in the forward order, from the condition of ignorance, compositional activity arises, and so on, and in the reverse order, from the cessation of ignorance, compositional activity ceases, and so on.

original: sa de dag la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la mtshan ma dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa de dag la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la mtshan ma dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas who abide on these grounds are said to have signs.

original: mtshan ma med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med ces bya ba la /
translated: With regard to signless,

original: sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la mtshan ma med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la mtshan ma med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
