translated: The bodhisattva who is on the seventh bhumi is called the bodhisattva of signlessness.

original: ji lta mtshan ma med pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta mtshan ma med pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is he called the bodhisattva of signlessness?

original: sa de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des sa drug pa man chad la 'byung ba'i mtshan ma thams cad spangs pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des sa drug pa man chad la 'byung ba'i mtshan ma thams cad spangs pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the bodhisattva who is on that bhumi has eliminated all signs that occur on the sixth bhumi and below, he is called the bodhisattva of signlessness.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed la spyod //🔽@221a * // ces bya ba la /🔽phyir mi ldog pa'i sa brgyad pa dang / dgu pa dang / bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni /🔽mngon par 'du mi byed pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed la spyod // @221a * // ces bya ba la / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa brgyad pa dang / dgu pa dang / bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni / mngon par 'du mi byed pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: He practices without deliberate effort.🔽The bodhisattva who is on the eighth, ninth, and tenth bhumis, the irreversible bhumis, is called the bodhisattva who practices without deliberate effort.

original: ci'i phyir de gsum la gnas pa la mngon par 'du mi byed pa la spyod pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de gsum la gnas pa la mngon par 'du mi byed pa la spyod pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is he called the bodhisattva who practices without deliberate effort?

original: de'i tshe bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la rtsol 'bad med par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du gnas pas mngon par 'du mi byed pa la spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la rtsol 'bad med par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du gnas pas mngon par 'du mi byed pa la spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At that time, one is said to be practicing non-performance, because one abides in the spontaneous performance of the aims of self and other and of the non-conceptual concentration.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lnga po ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lnga po ni //
translated: The five kinds of bodhisattvas

original: sa rnams kun du shes par bya //
analyzed: sa rnams kun du shes par bya //
translated: should be known on all the stages.

original: zhes bya ba la mos pa spyod pa'i sa yan chad sa bcu pa man chad sa bcu gcig rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa lnga zhig yod par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mos pa spyod pa'i sa yan chad sa bcu pa man chad sa bcu gcig rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa lnga zhig yod par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The eleven stages, beginning with the stage of action in faith and ending with the stage of the Tathagata, should be known as the five kinds of bodhisattvas.

original: da ni byang chub sems dpa' de lnga'i mtshan nyid bshad de /
analyzed: da ni byang chub sems dpa' de lnga'i mtshan nyid bshad de /
translated: Now, the characteristics of those five kinds of bodhisattvas are explained.

original: de la gang pa rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrubs pa rnams 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das par mi bsngo'o //
analyzed: de la gang pa rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrubs pa rnams 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das par mi bsngo'o //
translated: Therein, the one who practices the six perfections and does not dedicate the practice of the six perfections to the worldly perfections or to the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas nirvanas is the bodhisattva who is in the stage of action in faith.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub chen po thob par bsngo zhing smon lam 'debs pa de /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub chen po thob par bsngo zhing smon lam 'debs pa de /
translated: The dedication and aspiration to attain the great, unsurpassed enlightenment

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir 'dod la ma chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir 'dod la ma chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: is taught to be the characteristic of a bodhisattva.

original: de la 'dod pa la ma chags pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa la ma chags pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: In this regard, “non-attachment to desire” is the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas na /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas na /
translated: If one abides in the perfection of generosity,

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan dang / longs spyod la ma chags shing phyi nang gi dngos po yongs su gtong bar byed do //🔽las gsum rnam par dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan dang / longs spyod la ma chags shing phyi nang gi dngos po yongs su gtong bar byed do // las gsum rnam par dag ces bya ba la /
translated: one is not attached to the five sense objects such as form, and one gives up external and internal things.

original: las gsum rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: las gsum rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: “Purity of the three actions” is the perfection of morality.

original: tshul khrims la gnas na lus kyi sgo nas srog mi gcod /🔽ma byin par mi len /
analyzed: tshul khrims la gnas na lus kyi sgo nas srog mi gcod / ma byin par mi len /
translated: If one abides in morality, one does not kill,

original: mi tshangs par mi spyod pas /
analyzed: mi tshangs par mi spyod pas /
translated: does not take what is not given,🔽and does not engage in sexual misconduct through the body.

original: lus kyi las rnam par dag pa dang ngag gi sgo nas brdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal ba mi smra bas ngag gi las rnam par dag pa dang / yid kyi sgo nas chags sems dang gnod sems dang log pa'i lta ba med pas yid kyi las rnam par @221b dag go //
analyzed: lus kyi las rnam par dag pa dang ngag gi sgo nas brdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal ba mi smra bas ngag gi las rnam par dag pa dang / yid kyi sgo nas chags sems dang gnod sems dang log pa'i lta ba med pas yid kyi las rnam par @221b dag go //
translated: He has purified his bodily actions by not killing, stealing, or engaging in sexual misconduct; he has purified his verbal actions by not lying, slandering, using harsh words, or engaging in idle talk; and he has purified his mental actions by being free of covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: khro ba zil gnon zhes bya ba la /🔽khro ba zil gyis gnon pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: khro ba zil gnon zhes bya ba la / khro ba zil gyis gnon pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: He is the one who conquers anger.

original: bzod pa la gnas na zhe sdang gi sems mi 'byung bar zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa la gnas na zhe sdang gi sems mi 'byung bar zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of patience is called “conquering anger” because when one is patient, the angry mind is conquered and does not arise.

original: yon tan mchog la brtson zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yon tan mchog la brtson zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is the one who strives for the highest qualities.

original: yon tan gyi sgras ni /
analyzed: yon tan gyi sgras ni /
translated: The word “qualities”

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba la bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba la bya ste /
translated: refers to the supramundane virtues such as generosity.

original: yon tan mchog la brtson pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan mchog la brtson pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of effort is called “striving for the highest qualities” because it is the cause for attaining the highest qualities.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba thams cad bsgrub pa la brtson pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba thams cad bsgrub pa la brtson pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and by means of effort, one is intent upon accomplishing all mundane and supramundane virtues.

original: chos la mi g-yo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos la mi g-yo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The line and unshaken in the Dharma

original: chos la mi g-yo ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: chos la mi g-yo ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: is the perfection of meditation,

original: bsam gtan gyis ni sems rtse gcig tu gzhag pa'i sems las sems phyi rol tu g-yo zhing g-yeng ba mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni sems rtse gcig tu gzhag pa'i sems las sems phyi rol tu g-yo zhing g-yeng ba mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by means of meditation, one does not cause the mind to waver and vacillate externally, but rather stabilizes it in a single area.

original: yang dag zab mo mthong zhes bya ba la /🔽yang dag zab mo ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'o //🔽yang dag zab mo mthong ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag zab mo mthong zhes bya ba la / yang dag zab mo ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'o // yang dag zab mo mthong ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The line seeing the profound and the real🔽is the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyis bdag med pa gnyis mthong zhing khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis bdag med pa gnyis mthong zhing khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by means of wisdom, one sees and penetrates the profound and the real, i.e., the selflessness of the person and of phenomena.

original: 'di yan chad kyi tshig gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di yan chad kyi tshig gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: Up to this point, the text has explained the practice of the six perfections.

original: byang chub chen por mos ldan byang chub sems //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub chen por mos ldan byang chub sems //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: The line the bodhisattva who is intent on great enlightenment🔽is the perfection of vows,🔽because by means of vows, one is intent on great enlightenment.

original: gang du pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i rgyur gyur cig ces bsngo ba ni byang chub chen por mos pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang du pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i rgyur gyur cig ces bsngo ba ni byang chub chen por mos pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The dedication Wherever the practice of the six perfections becomes the cause for attaining unexcelled enlightenment, is called endowed with the aspiration for great enlightenment.

original: 'dis ni byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the bodhisattva's prayer for enlightenment.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa dang / byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pas byang chub sems dpa' yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa dang / byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pas byang chub sems dpa' yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to show that one is a bodhisattva by practicing the six perfections and by praying for enlightenment, through another enumeration,

original: phan 'dogs 'dod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: phan 'dogs 'dod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, The desire to help, the desire to benefit, the desire to protect, the desire to stand as an island, the desire to be a good friend, and the desire to be a spiritual guide, and so on.

original: de la phan 'dogs par 'dod pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de la phan 'dogs par 'dod pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Therein, the desire to help is the perfection of giving,

original: sbyin pa ni bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i yo byad kyis sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽gnod pa med par lta zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa ni bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i yo byad kyis sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽gnod pa med par lta zhes bya ba la /
translated: because giving helps sentient beings with the necessities of life, such as food and clothing.🔽The desire to benefit is the perfection of morality, because one benefits sentient beings by not harming them.

original: gnod pa med par lta ba ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: gnod pa med par lta ba ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of morality is the view that does not harm.

original: tshul khrims la gnas pa rnams sems can gzhan gyi srog mi gcod pas na srog la gnod par mi byed /🔽nor la ma @222a * //🔽byin par mi len pas na /
analyzed: tshul khrims la gnas pa rnams sems can gzhan gyi srog mi gcod pas na srog la gnod par mi byed / nor la ma @222a * // byin par mi len pas na /
translated: Those who abide in morality do not harm the life of other sentient beings,

original: longs spyod la gnod par mi byed /
analyzed: longs spyod la gnod par mi byed /
translated: do not harm their enjoyments by taking what has not been given,

original: gzhan gyi bud med la mi tshangs par mi spyod pas na chung ma la gnod par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bud med la mi tshangs par mi spyod pas na chung ma la gnod par mi byed do //
translated: and do not harm their spouses by committing adultery.

original: pha rol gnod byed dag la bzod pa dang // zhes bya ba la pha rol gnod byed la bzod pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol gnod byed dag la bzod pa dang // zhes bya ba la pha rol gnod byed la bzod pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Patience is the perfection of patience.

original: bzod pa la gnas pa rnams ni /
analyzed: bzod pa la gnas pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who abide in patience

original: sems can gzhan gyis bdag gi srog dang longs spyod la gnod pa byas kyang /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyis bdag gi srog dang longs spyod la gnod pa byas kyang /
translated: do not harm the life or enjoyments of other sentient beings

original: slar gnod pa'i lan ldon par mi byed de /
analyzed: slar gnod pa'i lan ldon par mi byed de /
translated: and do not harm their spouses by committing adultery.

original: 'di ni bzod pa gsum las gnod pa la ji snyam pa'i bzod pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni bzod pa gsum las gnod pa la ji snyam pa'i bzod pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the patience of accepting suffering, the third of the three types of patience.

original: brtan pa zhes bya ba la brtan pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: brtan pa zhes bya ba la brtan pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brtsams pa ste /
translated: Steadfastness is the perfection of effort.

original: brtson 'grus drag po dang ldan pa'i rnam pa ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus drag po dang ldan pa'i rnam pa ni /
translated: The aspect of having intense effort

original: dge ba'i phyogs la brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i tshe /
translated: is that when one is engaged in the practice of effort in the virtuous group of phenomena,

original: grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong bas /
analyzed: grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong bas /
translated: one does not fear the experience of suffering, such as cold and heat,

original: mi skrag cing brtson 'grus brtsams pa las mi ldog pa'i brtan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi skrag cing brtson 'grus brtsams pa las mi ldog pa'i brtan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and one does not turn back from the practice of effort. This is called “steadfastness.”

original: bag yod ces bya ba la 'du 'dzi mang po'i nang na gnas shing bsam gtan thob pa'i ro la chags pa'i rnam pa ni bag med pa'o //
analyzed: bag yod ces bya ba la 'du 'dzi mang po'i nang na gnas shing bsam gtan thob pa'i ro la chags pa'i rnam pa ni bag med pa'o //
translated: Carefulness is the opposite of carelessness, which is to be attached to the taste of concentration while living in a place of many distractions.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ni bag yod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ni bag yod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The perfection of concentration is called “carefulness”

original: bsam gtan rdzogs par bya ba'i dgon pa na gnas shing bsam gtan gyi ro la ma chags par byed pas na bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan rdzogs par bya ba'i dgon pa na gnas shing bsam gtan gyi ro la ma chags par byed pas na bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because one lives in a place of solitude in order to perfect concentration and one does not become attached to the taste of concentration.

original: mang du thos pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mang du thos pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Much learning is the perfection of wisdom.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mang po las chos mang du thos na /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mang po las chos mang du thos na /
translated: If one hears much Dharma from many spiritual friends,

original: shes rab 'byung bas mang du thos pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab 'byung bas mang du thos pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: one's wisdom will increase. Thus, one who has heard much is one who stands in the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di yan chad kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di yan chad kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: Up to this point, the practice of the six perfections has been taught.

original: pha rol don brtson byang chub sems dpa' yin //
analyzed: pha rol don brtson byang chub sems dpa' yin //
translated: The bodhisattva is one who strives for the welfare of others.

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa sgrubs pa'i rnam pa sems can yongs su bsgral bar bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa sgrubs pa'i rnam pa sems can yongs su bsgral bar bya ba'i don du /
translated: Here is the meaning of this verse.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba ni pha rol gyi don la brtson pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba ni pha rol gyi don la brtson pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva is one who strives for the welfare of others, because he dedicates the practice of the six perfections to unsurpassed enlightenment for the sake of liberating all sentient beings.

original: des na byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des na byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the aspiration for great enlightenment is taught.

original: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang bsgrub pa byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa de byang @222b chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang bsgrub pa byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa de byang @222b chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva is one who practices the six perfections and aspires for great enlightenment. This is the meaning.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub cing byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa byang chub sems dpa' yin par bstan pa'i phyir rang gis yongs su bzung ba nyes par mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub cing byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa byang chub sems dpa' yin par bstan pa'i phyir rang gis yongs su bzung ba nyes par mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Again, in order to demonstrate that one is a bodhisattva by practicing the six perfections and making prayers for great enlightenment through another enumeration, the text mentions “seeing the faults of what one has taken up for oneself” and so on.

original: rang gis yongs su bzung ba ni bdag la yod pa'i yo byad dang longs spyod la bya ste /
analyzed: rang gis yongs su bzung ba ni bdag la yod pa'i yo byad dang longs spyod la bya ste /
translated: What one has taken up for oneself refers to one’s possessions and wealth.

original: bdag gi longs spyod rnams la /
analyzed: bdag gi longs spyod rnams la /
translated: One does not engage in generosity if one does not see the faults of one’s possessions,

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rmi lam dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin zhing longs spyod la chags pa'i skyon gyis ngan song gsum du skye ba dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thos par bya ba la /🔽bar du gcod pa'i nyes pa yod par ma mthong ba rnams ni sbyin pa la 'jug par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rmi lam dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin zhing longs spyod la chags pa'i skyon gyis ngan song gsum du skye ba dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thos par bya ba la /🔽bar du gcod pa'i nyes pa yod par ma mthong ba rnams ni sbyin pa la 'jug par mi byed kyi /
translated: such as their impermanence, their being a source of suffering, their being like a dream or an illusion, and the faults of attachment to possessions, such as being born in the three lower realms and the faults of being an obstacle to the perfect mundane and supramundane attainments.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag gi longs spyod la chags na skyon dang nyes pa yod par mthong bas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag gi longs spyod la chags na skyon dang nyes pa yod par mthong bas /
translated: Bodhisattvas see the faults and problems in attachment to their own enjoyments.

original: phyi nang gi dngos po yongs su gtong bar byed do /
analyzed: phyi nang gi dngos po yongs su gtong bar byed do /
translated: Therefore, they give away all inner and outer things.

original: 'dis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par bstan to //
translated: This shows that they possess the perfection of generosity.

original: longs spyod ma chags zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: longs spyod ma chags zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are not attached to enjoyments.

original: gang gis 'dod pa lnga'i longs spyod dang / zang zing la chags pa rnams ni khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung bar mi nus kyi /
analyzed: gang gis 'dod pa lnga'i longs spyod dang / zang zing la chags pa rnams ni khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung bar mi nus kyi /
translated: Those who are attached to the enjoyments of the five senses and to material things are unable to go forth from home to homelessness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan dang zing zing la chags pa med pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan dang zing zing la chags pa med pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung ba ste /
translated: But bodhisattvas are not attached to the enjoyments of the five senses and to material things, so they are able to go forth from home to homelessness.

original: 'dis ni tshul gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshul gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par bstan to //
translated: This shows that they possess the perfection of discipline.

original: zhe la 'dzin pa med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: zhe la 'dzin pa med ces bya ba la /
translated: They do not hold grudges.

original: sems can gyis gnod pa byas pa dang phrad nas 'dis bdag la 'di lta bu zhig gnod pa byas kyi /
analyzed: sems can gyis gnod pa byas pa dang phrad nas 'dis bdag la 'di lta bu zhig gnod pa byas kyi /
translated: When they encounter harm from sentient beings, they think, “This person has harmed me in this way because of the power of their negative emotions.

original: lan ldon du btang ngo snyam du sems pa ni zhe la 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lan ldon du btang ngo snyam du sems pa ni zhe la 'dzin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Holding a grudge is the thought I will repay the harm.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang /
translated: The bodhisattva, even when harmed by others,🔽has no thought of retaliation,

original: slar gnod pa bya'o snyam du sems pa'i bsam pa med pas /
analyzed: slar gnod pa bya'o snyam du sems pa'i bsam pa med pas /
translated: thinking, I will harm them in return.

original: zhe la 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhe la 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called without holding a grudge.

original: 'dis ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of patience.

original: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la sogs pa'i dge ba la rgyun du 'jug cing sgrub pa ni rnal 'byor zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la sogs pa'i dge ba la rgyun du 'jug cing sgrub pa ni rnal 'byor zhes bya ste /
translated: Yoga is the continuous engagement and practice of virtue such as cultivating serenity and insight. It is called yoga.

original: 'dis ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub @223a * //🔽pa dang 'dra bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub @223a * // pa dang 'dra bar bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of diligence.

original: mtshan ma mkhas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan ma mkhas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Skill in signs is as follows.

original: nam sems rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa na /
analyzed: nam sems rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa na /
translated: When cultivating the concentration of one-pointed mind,

original: zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang / gzengs bstod pa'i mtshan ma dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma la bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang / gzengs bstod pa'i mtshan ma dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma la bsgom pa ni /
translated: The cultivation of the sign of serenity, the sign of encouragement, and the sign of equanimity.

original: mtshan ma la mkhas pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma la mkhas pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: This is called skill in the sign.

original: gang gi tshe sems la 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la sogs pa g-yeng bar gyur ba'i dus na ni 'khor ba'i skyon yid la bya ba la sogs pa zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yid la byas nas sems zhi bar bya'o //🔽nam sems gnyid dang rmugs pas non te mi gsal bar gyur na bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems la 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la sogs pa g-yeng bar gyur ba'i dus na ni 'khor ba'i skyon yid la bya ba la sogs pa zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yid la byas nas sems zhi bar bya'o // nam sems gnyid dang rmugs pas non te mi gsal bar gyur na bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu'am /
translated: When the mind is distracted by the five sense-qualities, etc., then one should pacify the mind by attending to the sign of serenity, such as the faults of sarṃsāra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan la sgos pa yid la bya ba gzengs bstod pa mtshan ma yid la byas nas sems gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan la sgos pa yid la bya ba gzengs bstod pa mtshan ma yid la byas nas sems gso bar bya'o //
translated: When the mind is oppressed by sleepiness and languor and becomes unclear, one should refresh the mind by attending to the sign of encouragement, such as the result of meditation or the special qualities of the Tathāgatas.

original: nam zhum rgod spangs pa'i phyir bsngos na theg pa chen po'i spyod pa las mi nyams par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: nam zhum rgod spangs pa'i phyir bsngos na theg pa chen po'i spyod pa las mi nyams par 'gyur bas na /
translated: When one is inclined to sloth and excitability, one should refresh the mind by attending to the sign of equanimity, such as the avoidance of the two extremes.

original: nang du rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nang du rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called “abiding inwardly in serenity.”

original: tshig des byang chub chen por smon lam btab po //
analyzed: tshig des byang chub chen por smon lam btab po //
translated: By that word, he made the aspiration for great enlightenment.

original: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang bsgrubs la /
analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang bsgrubs la /
translated: Thus, he has accomplished the six perfections,

original: byang chub chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir smon lam yang 'debs pa de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir smon lam yang 'debs pa de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don bstan to //
translated: and he makes the aspiration for the attainment of great enlightenment. He is called a bodhisattva. The meaning is taught.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa dang / byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir snying rje ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa dang / byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir snying rje ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Again, in another enumeration, the accomplishment of the six perfections and the aspiration for great enlightenment are taught as the definition of a bodhisattva. Therefore, it is said that he possesses compassion, etc.

original: de la sems can bkres pa dang grang ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis nyen pa rnams la snying rje med pa dag ni bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i yo byad gtong zhing sbyin par mi byed kyis /
analyzed: de la sems can bkres pa dang grang ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis nyen pa rnams la snying rje med pa dag ni bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i yo byad gtong zhing sbyin par mi byed kyis /
translated: Among them, those who do not have compassion for sentient beings afflicted by the suffering of hunger, cold, etc. do not give up and give away necessities such as food and clothing.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can yo byad kyis phongs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can yo byad kyis phongs te /
translated: But the bodhisattva, for sentient beings who lack necessities,

original: sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje dang ldan pas bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa gtong zhing sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje dang ldan pas bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa gtong zhing sbyin par byed de /
translated: They are compassionate toward those who suffer and give them food, clothing, and so forth.

original: 'dis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa brtan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa brtan to //
translated: This shows the accomplishment of the perfection of generosity.

original: ngo tsha yon tan gnas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngo tsha yon tan gnas zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are ashamed of faults, and are the abode of good qualities.

original: gang dag srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pas sdig pa'i las byed pa la 'dzem zhing ngo tsha ba med pa de dag la tshul khrims med kyi /
analyzed: gang dag srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pas sdig pa'i las byed pa la 'dzem zhing ngo tsha ba med pa de dag la tshul khrims med kyi /
translated: Those who are shameless and have no qualms about committing evil actions such as killing and stealing have no morality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ngo tsha ba'i yon tan la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ngo tsha ba'i yon tan la gnas pa ste /
translated: But bodhisattvas are the abode of the good quality of shame.

original: @223b srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa la sogs pa sdig pa'i las byed pa bag tsha zhing 'jem pas /
analyzed: @223b srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa la sogs pa sdig pa'i las byed pa bag tsha zhing 'jem pas /
translated: They are ashamed and embarrassed to commit evil actions such as killing and stealing.

original: de dag cung zad kyang mi byed de /
analyzed: de dag cung zad kyang mi byed de /
translated: They do not commit even the slightest of such actions.

original: 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the accomplishment of the perfection of morality.

original: sdug bsngal bzod cing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bzod cing zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are patient with suffering.

original: gang dag gzhan gyis brdeg pa dang / bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa byas pa la /
analyzed: gang dag gzhan gyis brdeg pa dang / bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa byas pa la /
translated: Those who are intolerant of harm done to them by others, such as being struck or bound,

original: mi bzod pa de dag ni slar sems can la gnod pa byed na /
analyzed: mi bzod pa de dag ni slar sems can la gnod pa byed na /
translated: and in turn harm sentient beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa'i sdug bsngal rnams bzod cing nyams su len pas gzhan la slar gnod pa mi byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa'i sdug bsngal rnams bzod cing nyams su len pas gzhan la slar gnod pa mi byed de /
translated: the bodhisattvas, who are tolerant of the suffering of harm done to them by others, do not harm others in return.

original: 'dis ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the accomplishment of the perfection of tolerance.

original: bdag gi bde la chags zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag gi bde la chags zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who are attached to their own happiness

original: gang dag nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i dge ba byed na /
analyzed: gang dag nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i dge ba byed na /
translated: are unable to practice virtue such as listening and reflection.

original: bkres pa dang skom pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzod cing /
analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzod cing /
translated: They are intolerant of the suffering of hunger and thirst.

original: nyal ba dang 'phreng ba tsam gyis bdag gi bde ba la chags pa de dag ni /
analyzed: nyal ba dang 'phreng ba tsam gyis bdag gi bde ba la chags pa de dag ni /
translated: They are attached to their own happiness, such as sleeping and resting.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don du brtson 'grus rtsom par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don du brtson 'grus rtsom par mi nus kyi /
translated: They are unable to make an effort at diligence for the sake of self and other.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni nyan pa la sogs pa'i dge ba byed pas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni nyan pa la sogs pa'i dge ba byed pas na /
translated: But the bodhisattvas, who practice virtue such as listening,

original: grang ba dang bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bzod cing nyal ba dang / 'phreng ba la sogs pa'i bdag gi bde ba la ma chags pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don du brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: grang ba dang bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bzod cing nyal ba dang / 'phreng ba la sogs pa'i bdag gi bde ba la ma chags pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don du brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: Thus, one exerts oneself for the sake of self and other.

original: 'dis ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsgrub pa bstan to //🔽dran gtso bo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dis ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsgrub pa bstan to // dran gtso bo zhes bya ba la /
translated: This shows the accomplishment of the perfection of effort.

original: gang dag sems nyon mongs pa'i dbang du song nas bsgom par bya ba'i yul brjed pa de dag la ni bsam gtan med kyi /
analyzed: gang dag sems nyon mongs pa'i dbang du song nas bsgom par bya ba'i yul brjed pa de dag la ni bsam gtan med kyi /
translated: The word chief in chief among the mindful means that those who, having fallen under the influence of the mental afflictions, forget the object of meditation do not have meditative stabilization.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yul ma brjed pa'i dran pa dang ldan pa dang / rtag tu yang bsam gtan dang ldan te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yul ma brjed pa'i dran pa dang ldan pa dang / rtag tu yang bsam gtan dang ldan te /
translated: The bodhisattvas, however, are endowed with mindfulness that does not forget the object of concentration and they are always in meditative equipoise.

original: 'dis ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the accomplishment of the perfection of meditative stabilization.

original: shin tu mnyam gzhag nyid ces bya ba la gang sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin med pa de dag la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i shes rab med kyi /
analyzed: shin tu mnyam gzhag nyid ces bya ba la gang sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin med pa de dag la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i shes rab med kyi /
translated: The line and the state of profound meditative equipoise means that those who lack the samadhi of mental equipoise also lack the wisdom that knows reality as it is.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rtag tu sems mnyam par gzhag pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rtag tu sems mnyam par gzhag pas /
translated: But bodhisattvas are always in a state of mental equipoise,

original: yod med gang yang mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan te /
analyzed: yod med gang yang mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan te /
translated: and so they have the gnosis that does not conceive of existence or nonexistence.

original: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the accomplishment of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di yan chad kyis @224a * //
analyzed: 'di yan chad kyis @224a * //
translated: Up to this point,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: it has been showing the accomplishment of the six perfections.

original: theg pa mi 'khrugs byang chub sems dpa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: theg pa mi 'khrugs byang chub sems dpa'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bodhisattva is unshakable in his vehicle.

original: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa rnams 'jig rten gyi longs spyod dang / theg pa chung ngu'i mya ngan las 'das par bsngos na ni theg pa chen po'i spyod pa las nyams pas /
analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa rnams 'jig rten gyi longs spyod dang / theg pa chung ngu'i mya ngan las 'das par bsngos na ni theg pa chen po'i spyod pa las nyams pas /
translated: If those who practice the six perfections in this way dedicate them to the enjoyments of the world and to the nirvana of the Hinayana, they will degenerate in the practice of the Mahayana.

original: theg pa chen po las 'khrugs pa zhes bya na /
analyzed: theg pa chen po las 'khrugs pa zhes bya na /
translated: So if they are shaken from the Mahayana,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrubs pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngos pas theg pa chen po'i spyod pa la ma nyams pa'i phyir theg pa las mi 'khrugs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrubs pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngos pas theg pa chen po'i spyod pa la ma nyams pa'i phyir theg pa las mi 'khrugs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas' practice of the six perfections is dedicated to the attainment of supreme enlightenment.

original: 'dis ni byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the bodhisattva's aspiration for great enlightenment.

original: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang bsgrub la /
analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang bsgrub la /
translated: Thus, he practices the six perfections

original: byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa de la /
analyzed: byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa de la /
translated: and aspires for great enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o zhes bya'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o zhes bya'i don to //
translated: He is called a bodhisattva.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa dang / byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa de byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa dang / byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa de byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Again, by another enumeration, the practice of the six perfections and the aspiration for great enlightenment are the characteristics of a bodhisattva.

original: sdug bsngal spangs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal spangs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, having abandoned suffering, and so on.

original: de la sdug bsngal spangs pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal spangs pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of giving is the elimination of suffering.

original: sbyin pas sems can grang ba dang bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis nyen pa rnams la bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i yo byad byin nas grang ba dang bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal med par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽sdug bsngal byed pa med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pas sems can grang ba dang bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis nyen pa rnams la bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i yo byad byin nas grang ba dang bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal med par byed pa'i phyir ro // sdug bsngal byed pa med ces bya ba la /
translated: Through giving, one gives to sentient beings who are afflicted by the suffering of cold, hunger, and so on, such necessities as food and clothing, and thereby eliminates the suffering of cold, hunger, and so on.

original: sdug bsngal bar byed pa med pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /🔽tshul khrims kyis sems can gyi srog mi gcod /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar byed pa med pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste / tshul khrims kyis sems can gyi srog mi gcod /
translated: The perfection of morality is the absence of the cause of suffering.🔽Through morality, one does not take the life of sentient beings, nor does one take their possessions by theft.

original: nor lam byin par mi len pas na srog dang nor la sogs pa la sdug bsngal skyed par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor lam byin par mi len pas na srog dang nor la sogs pa la sdug bsngal skyed par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, one does not cause suffering to sentient beings through taking their life or possessions.

original: sdug bsngal bzod cing zhes bya ba la sdug bsngal bzod pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bzod cing zhes bya ba la sdug bsngal bzod pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of patience is the endurance of suffering.

original: bzod pa dang ldan pa rnams sems can gzhan gyis /
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan pa rnams sems can gzhan gyis /
translated: Those who are patient do not become angry at others who cause them suffering.

original: lus dang srog la gnod pa rnam pa sna tshogs byas shing sdug bsngal skye bya sdug bsngal nyams su len cing slar gnod pa'i lan mi ldon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang srog la gnod pa rnam pa sna tshogs byas shing sdug bsngal skye bya sdug bsngal nyams su len cing slar gnod pa'i lan mi ldon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not retaliate for the various harms done to their bodies and lives, and they take on suffering and generate suffering.

original: sdug bsngal 'jigs pa med ces bya @224b ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa med pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'jigs pa med ces bya @224b ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa med pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Fearless of suffering and so on. Fearlessness of the suffering of samsara is the perfection of effort.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la brtson 'grus drag tu brtsams pa rnams brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i dus na /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la brtson 'grus drag tu brtsams pa rnams brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i dus na /
translated: When they begin to apply themselves to the virtuous group of phenomena with intense effort,

original: grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i phyi nang gi sdug bsngal byung yang 'jigs pa med de /
analyzed: grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i phyi nang gi sdug bsngal byung yang 'jigs pa med de /
translated: even if they experience the inner and outer sufferings of heat and cold and so on, they are not afraid.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa las mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa las mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not turn back from their efforts.

original: sdug bsngal rnam grol zhes bya ba la sdug bsngal rnam par grol ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam grol zhes bya ba la sdug bsngal rnam par grol ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Liberation from suffering is the perfection of meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin thob pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas khams gong mar gtogs par skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin thob pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas khams gong mar gtogs par skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who have attained meditative stabilization and meditative concentration are born in the higher realms, free from the passion of the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi ngan song gsum du skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal de la mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi ngan song gsum du skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal de la mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the suffering of suffering of birth in the three miserable realms of the desire realm does not occur for them.

original: sdug bsngal rtog pa med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rtog pa med ces bya ba la /
translated: “Without conceptualization of suffering” means

original: sdug bsngal la rtog pa med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rtog pa med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is without conceptualization of suffering.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa rnams bdag dang sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu dang sdug bsngal gsum la rang bzhin yod par mi rtog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa rnams bdag dang sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu dang sdug bsngal gsum la rang bzhin yod par mi rtog pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because those who have the perfection of wisdom do not conceptualize a self, the cause of the arising of suffering, or the three kinds of suffering as having an intrinsic nature.

original: 'di dag gis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: These lines teach the practice of the six perfections.

original: sdug bsngal khas len byang chub sems dpa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal khas len byang chub sems dpa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: “The bodhisattva accepts suffering” means

original: sdug bsngal khas len pa ni byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa ste /🔽byang chub don du smon lam 'debs pa na sems can gyi don du /
analyzed: sdug bsngal khas len pa ni byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa ste / byang chub don du smon lam 'debs pa na sems can gyi don du /
translated: Accepting suffering is the prayer for great enlightenment.🔽When one prays for enlightenment, one prays,

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par shog cig ces smon lam 'debs la /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par shog cig ces smon lam 'debs la /
translated: “May I attain unsurpassed enlightenment for the sake of sentient beings.”

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyang sems can gyi don du 'khor ba mi gtong bar khas blangs na ;
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyang sems can gyi don du 'khor ba mi gtong bar khas blangs na ;
translated: And if one accepts unsurpassed enlightenment, one accepts not to abandon cyclic existence for the sake of sentient beings.

original: gdod bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gdod bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur la /
translated: Then one attains unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: 'khor ba yang sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin pas 'khor ba khas blangs na /
analyzed: 'khor ba yang sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin pas 'khor ba khas blangs na /
translated: And since cyclic existence is by nature suffering, if one accepts cyclic existence,

original: sdug bsngal khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: one accepts suffering.

original: 'dis ni byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the prayer for great enlightenment.

original: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang sgrub la ;
analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang sgrub la ;
translated: Thus, one practices the six perfections,

original: byang chub chen por yang smon lam 'debs pa de byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub chen por yang smon lam 'debs pa de byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and prays for great enlightenment. This is the meaning of “bodhisattva.”

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa dang / byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa de la byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan pa'i @225a * //
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa dang / byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa de la byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan pa'i @225a * //
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate that the practice of the six perfections and the aspiration for great enlightenment are the characteristics of a bodhisattva,

original: phyir ; chos dga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: phyir ; chos dga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “one who delights in the Dharma,” and so on.

original: de la chos la dga' ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de la chos la dga' ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Therein, one who delights in the Dharma is endowed with the perfection of generosity,

original: sbyin pa dang ldan pa rnams phyi nang gi dngos po gtong ba'i chos la dga' ba'i phyir ro //🔽rang bzhin chos la dga' zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: sbyin pa dang ldan pa rnams phyi nang gi dngos po gtong ba'i chos la dga' ba'i phyir ro // rang bzhin chos la dga' zhes bya ba la ;
translated: because those who are generous delight in the Dharma of giving away outer and inner things.

original: rang bzhin gyis chos la dga' ba ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis chos la dga' ba ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: One who delights in the Dharma by nature is endowed with the perfection of morality,

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba chos rdul tsam yang mi 'byung bar dga' ba'i phyir ro //🔽chos la smod cing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba chos rdul tsam yang mi 'byung bar dga' ba'i phyir ro // chos la smod cing zhes bya ba la /
translated: because those who are moral delight in the Dharma of not committing even the slightest sin by nature.🔽One who delights in the Dharma through practice is endowed with the perfection of patience,🔽because those who are patient delight in the Dharma of not being angry with those who commit sins.🔽One who delights in the Dharma through superior attitude is endowed with the perfection of vigor,🔽because those who are vigorous delight in the Dharma of not being discouraged in body or mind.

original: chos la smod pa ni /
analyzed: chos la smod pa ni /
translated: One who delights in the Dharma through skill in means is endowed with the perfection of meditation,🔽because those who are meditatively concentrated delight in the Dharma of not being disturbed by the distractions.🔽One who delights in the Dharma through great commitment is endowed with the perfection of wisdom,🔽because those who are wise delight in the Dharma of not being attached to either cyclic existence or final liberation.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: They are endowed with the perfection of patience.

original: bzod pa dang ldan pa rnams mi bzod pas 'gyur ba'i rgyu zhe sdang gi chos la smod pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan pa rnams mi bzod pas 'gyur ba'i rgyu zhe sdang gi chos la smod pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who have patience condemn the phenomena of anger, which are the cause of change due to impatience.

original: chos la brtson zhes bya ba la chos la brtson pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa dag ste /
analyzed: chos la brtson zhes bya ba la chos la brtson pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa dag ste /
translated: They are devoted to the Dharma. Those who are devoted to the Dharma are endowed with the perfection of effort.

original: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i rnams 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos la rtag tu brtson pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i rnams 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos la rtag tu brtson pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who have effort are always devoted to mundane and supramundane virtuous qualities.

original: chos dbang zhes bya ba la chos la dbang byed pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: chos dbang zhes bya ba la chos la dbang byed pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: They have power over the Dharma. Those who have power over the Dharma are endowed with the perfection of meditative absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang ldan pa rnams sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid du dbang sgyur zhing /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ldan pa rnams sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid du dbang sgyur zhing /
translated: Those who have meditative absorption have power over the characteristics of one-pointed mind.

original: 'phrul gyi mig la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phrul gyi mig la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have power over the superknowledges such as the magical power of the eye.

original: chos la mun pa med ces bya ba la chos mun pa med pa ni /
analyzed: chos la mun pa med ces bya ba la chos mun pa med pa ni /
translated: The Dharma is free of darkness.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa rnams te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa rnams te /
translated: Those who possess the perfection of wisdom are free of darkness.

original: dper na mun pa med par gyur na /
analyzed: dper na mun pa med par gyur na /
translated: For example, when darkness is gone,

original: blta bar bya ba'i dngos po rnams gsal bar mthong bar 'gyur ba bzhin du /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba'i dngos po rnams gsal bar mthong bar 'gyur ba bzhin du /
translated: the things that are to be seen are seen clearly.

original: shes rab kyi snang ba skyes pa rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi snang ba skyes pa rnams kyis kyang /
translated: Likewise, those in whom the light of wisdom has arisen

original: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: clearly see the general and specific characteristics of phenomena.

original: shes rab dang ldan pa rnams chos la mun pa med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa rnams chos la mun pa med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, those who possess wisdom are said to be free of darkness with regard to the Dharma.

original: tshig dang gang dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshig dang gang dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: The words that have been taught are the means of accomplishing the six perfections.🔽The bodhisattva is the one who makes the Dharma primary.

original: chos gtsor byed pa byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrubs pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub chen po thob pa'i rgyur gyur cig ces bsngos shing der gzhal bar byas na /
analyzed: chos gtsor byed pa byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrubs pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub chen po thob pa'i rgyur gyur cig ces bsngos shing der gzhal bar byas na /
translated: Those who practice the six perfections dedicate them to the attainment of unsurpassed great enlightenment and determine them there.

original: chos gtsor byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos gtsor byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called “making the Dharma primary.”

original: 'dis ni byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs @225b pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs @225b pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the aspiration for great enlightenment.

original: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang bsgrubs la byang chub por smon lam 'debs pa de la /
analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang bsgrubs la byang chub por smon lam 'debs pa de la /
translated: Thus, one who both practices the six perfections and aspires for great enlightenment is called a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the term “bodhisattva.”

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa dang / byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa de byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir longs spyod bag yod ces bya ba la sgos pa smos so //🔽gang dag 'dod pa lnga'i longs spyod yod pa bdag nyid spyod cing gzhan la mi gtong ba de dag ni /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa dang / byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa de byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir longs spyod bag yod ces bya ba la sgos pa smos so // gang dag 'dod pa lnga'i longs spyod yod pa bdag nyid spyod cing gzhan la mi gtong ba de dag ni /
translated: Again, in order to show that the practice of the six perfections and the aspiration for great enlightenment are the characteristics of a bodhisattva, he says, “enjoyment, heedlessness, and so on.”

original: longs spyod la bag med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: longs spyod la bag med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who enjoy the pleasures of the five senses and do not give them to others are called “heedless in regard to enjoyment.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i longs spyod kyang mi gtsang ba lta bur mthong bas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i longs spyod kyang mi gtsang ba lta bur mthong bas /
translated: The bodhisattva, however, sees even the enjoyments of a universal monarch and so on as impure.

original: gzhan la gtong bar byed pas longs spyod la bag yod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan la gtong bar byed pas longs spyod la bag yod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He is heedful with regard to his enjoyments because he gives them away to others.

original: 'dis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par bstan to //
translated: This shows that he is endowed with the perfection of generosity.

original: gdul ba la bag yod dang zhes bya ba la gang dag gis bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang / rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba ma bsrungs pa de dag ni gdul ba la bag med pa ste /
analyzed: gdul ba la bag yod dang zhes bya ba la gang dag gis bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang / rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba ma bsrungs pa de dag ni gdul ba la bag med pa ste /
translated: He is heedful with regard to his disciples. Those who do not guard themselves from natural and proscribed offenses are heedless with regard to their disciples.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum ma thul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum ma thul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their body, speech, and mind are undisciplined.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rang bzhin gyi kha na tho ba dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba gnyis ka srung bar byed pas gdul ba la bag yod pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rang bzhin gyi kha na tho ba dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba gnyis ka srung bar byed pas gdul ba la bag yod pa ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas guard themselves from both natural and proscribed offenses, so they are heedful with regard to their disciples.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum dul ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum dul ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because their body, speech, and mind are disciplined.

original: 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that he is endowed with the perfection of morality.

original: bsrung ba bag yod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bsrung ba bag yod ces bya ba la /
translated: He is heedful in guarding.

original: gang dag gzhan gyis gnod pa byas na /
analyzed: gang dag gzhan gyis gnod pa byas na /
translated: Those who, when harmed by others,

original: legs 'khrugs nas gzhan la gnod pa byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: legs 'khrugs nas gzhan la gnod pa byed pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who, in a fit of anger, harm others

original: bsrung ba la bag med de /
analyzed: bsrung ba la bag med de /
translated: are heedless in their protection.

original: bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga'i sems ma bsrungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga'i sems ma bsrungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not protect their own minds or the minds of others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang /
translated: But the bodhisattvas, even when harmed by others,

original: bdag nyid zhe mi sdang zhing gzhan la slar gnod pa mi byed pas /
analyzed: bdag nyid zhe mi sdang zhing gzhan la slar gnod pa mi byed pas /
translated: do not become angry themselves, nor do they harm others in return.

original: bsrung ba la bag yod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsrung ba la bag yod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, they are said to be heedful in their protection.

original: bdag gi sems kyang zhe sdang gi dbang du ma song bar bsrungs la /
analyzed: bdag gi sems kyang zhe sdang gi dbang du ma song bar bsrungs la /
translated: Because they protect their own minds from falling under the power of anger,

original: gzhan gyi sems kyang 'khrugs par mi 'gyur par bsrung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems kyang 'khrugs par mi 'gyur par bsrung ba'i phyir te /
translated: and because they protect the minds of others from becoming disturbed.

original: 'dis ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa bstan to //
translated: This shows their perfection of tolerance.

original: dge ba bag yod dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba bag yod dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse says, “The virtuous are heedful. ”

original: gang le lo'i dbang du @226a * //🔽song nas dge ba mi byed pa de dag ni dge ba la bag med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang le lo'i dbang du @226a * // song nas dge ba mi byed pa de dag ni dge ba la bag med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who, under the influence of laziness,🔽do not practice virtue are said to be heedless of virtue,

original: de la dge ba 'phel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dge ba 'phel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because virtue does not increase in them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni le lo thams cad spangs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni le lo thams cad spangs nas /
translated: The bodhisattva, having abandoned all laziness,

original: mnyan pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i dge ba rgyun du spyod pas /
analyzed: mnyan pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i dge ba rgyun du spyod pas /
translated: always practices virtue such as listening and reflection.

original: dge ba la bag yod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba la bag yod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, he is called “heedful with regard to virtue.”

original: 'dis ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par bstan to //
translated: This shows his possession of the perfection of effort.

original: dge ba la bag yod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba la bag yod ces bya ba la /
translated: With regard to the statement, “heedful with regard to virtue,”

original: gang dag bsam gtan thob kyang bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i ro la chags par byed pa de dag ni bde ba la bag med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag bsam gtan thob kyang bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i ro la chags par byed pa de dag ni bde ba la bag med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: those who, although they have attained meditative concentration, create attachment to the taste of the bliss of meditative concentration are called “heedless with regard to bliss.”

original: bsam gtan khyad par can mi thob cing /
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can mi thob cing /
translated: Because they do not attain special meditative concentration,

original: sngar thob pa'i bsam gtan las kyang nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar thob pa'i bsam gtan las kyang nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and they fall away from the meditative concentration they have already attained.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bsam gtan thob kyang bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i ro la chags par mi byed pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bsam gtan thob kyang bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i ro la chags par mi byed pas /
translated: The bodhisattvas, although they have attained meditative concentration, do not create attachment to the taste of the bliss of meditative concentration.

original: de la bag yod pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la bag yod pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, they are called “heedful with regard to that.”

original: 'dis ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa bstan to //
translated: This shows his possession of the perfection of meditative concentration.

original: chos la bag yod pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos la bag yod pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase carefulness with regard to the Dharma🔽means that those who grasp the Dharma as permanent,

original: gang dag gis chos rnams la rtag pa dang / bag yod pa la sogs par bzung ba de dag ni chos la bag med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag gis chos rnams la rtag pa dang / bag yod pa la sogs par bzung ba de dag ni chos la bag med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: careful, and so on are said to be careless with regard to the Dharma,

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid log par bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid log par bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they grasp the characteristics of the Dharma incorrectly.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi rtag pa dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas chos la bag yod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi rtag pa dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas chos la bag yod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas are said to be careful with regard to the Dharma, because they know impermanence, emptiness, and selflessness just as they are.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid ma nor bar bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid ma nor bar bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they grasp the characteristics of the Dharma without error.

original: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshig de dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa smras pa yin no //
translated: Those words express the practice of the six perfections.

original: theg pa bag yod byang chub sems dpa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: theg pa bag yod byang chub sems dpa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bodhisattva vehicle is the careful one.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngos na theg pa chen po la bag yod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngos na theg pa chen po la bag yod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When those who practice the six perfections dedicate them to the attainment of unexcelled enlightenment, that is called conscientious attitude toward the Great Vehicle.

original: 'dis ni byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa bstan to //🔽de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang bsgrubs la /
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa bstan to // de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang bsgrubs la /
translated: This shows the bodhisattva's prayer for great enlightenment.

original: byang chub chen por yang smon lam 'debs pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrubs pa dang / byang chub chen @226b por smon lam 'debs pa de /
analyzed: byang chub chen por yang smon lam 'debs pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrubs pa dang / byang chub chen @226b por smon lam 'debs pa de /
translated: Thus, those who practice the six perfections and pray for great enlightenment are bodhisattvas.🔽This is the meaning.🔽Again, in another way, the practice of the six perfections and the prayer for great enlightenment are the characteristics of a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: sbyin med ngo tsha zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sbyin med ngo tsha zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: without generosity, ashamed, and so on.

original: de la dper na slong ba po rnams la bslangs pa las /
analyzed: de la dper na slong ba po rnams la bslangs pa las /
translated: There, for example, with regard to those who beg,

original: gtong bas ma byin na ngo tsha'o //
analyzed: gtong bas ma byin na ngo tsha'o //
translated: one is ashamed if one does not give because of being asked.

original: de dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis ma bslangs par gtong ba'i bdag nyid can yin na /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis ma bslangs par gtong ba'i bdag nyid can yin na /
translated: In the same way, a bodhisattva is by nature a giver,

original: gal te slong ba po 'ongs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te slong ba po 'ongs pa'i tshe /
translated: but if, when a petitioner comes,

original: mig gnags  nas bkyigs te ma byin na ngo tsha'o //
analyzed: mig gnags  nas bkyigs te ma byin na ngo tsha'o //
translated: he does not give after looking at him with eyes wide open, he is ashamed.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' bdag gi chos nyid dang 'gal lo zhes slong ba po 'ongs pa'i rnams la phyi nang gi dngos po sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' bdag gi chos nyid dang 'gal lo zhes slong ba po 'ongs pa'i rnams la phyi nang gi dngos po sbyin par byed de /
translated: Therefore, a bodhisattva gives to petitioners both external and internal things, saying, “I would violate my own Dharma.”

original: 'dis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par bstan to //🔽nyes chung ngo tsha zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par bstan to // nyes chung ngo tsha zhes bya ba la /
translated: This shows his possession of the perfection of generosity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba la 'jigs par lta bas rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba 'byung ba srung ba bzhin du bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba nyes pa chung ngu rdul tsam la yang 'jigs par lta bas
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba la 'jigs par lta bas rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba 'byung ba srung ba bzhin du bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba nyes pa chung ngu rdul tsam la yang 'jigs par lta bas
translated: “Shame at a slight fault” means that a bodhisattva, seeing danger in even the slightest natural fault, guards against even the slightest fault that is a natural offense, as if it were a great abyss.

original: / gal te nyes pa chung ngu rdul tsam byung na yang ngo tsha zhing 'dzem pa yin no //
analyzed: / gal te nyes pa chung ngu rdul tsam byung na yang ngo tsha zhing 'dzem pa yin no //
translated: If even a small fault arises, the size of a mere atom, he is ashamed and embarrassed.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' chos nyid las 'das so zhes nyes pa chung ngu yang srung bar byed de /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' chos nyid las 'das so zhes nyes pa chung ngu yang srung bar byed de /
translated: Therefore, even with regard to a small fault, he thinks, “The bodhisattva has transgressed reality,” and he guards against it.

original: 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the perfection of morality.

original: mi bzod do tsha zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' ni phyogs thams cad dang dus thams cad du sems can thams cad la /
analyzed: mi bzod do tsha zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' ni phyogs thams cad dang dus thams cad du sems can thams cad la /
translated: “He is not patient” means that the bodhisattva is by nature patient with all sentient beings in all ways and at all times.

original: bzod par byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin na gal te mi bzod pa'i sems shig byung na yang byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha bar byed do //
analyzed: bzod par byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin na gal te mi bzod pa'i sems shig byung na yang byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha bar byed do //
translated: If he should have an impatient thought, the bodhisattva is ashamed.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid las 'das so zhes dus thams cad du phyogs thams cad du sems can thams cad la bzod par byed de /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid las 'das so zhes dus thams cad du phyogs thams cad du sems can thams cad la bzod par byed de /
translated: Therefore, at all times and in all ways, he is patient with all sentient beings, thinking, “The bodhisattva has transgressed reality.”

original: 'dis ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of patience.

original: nyams pas ngo tsha ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyams pas ngo tsha ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Shame at degeneration” means

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rang bzhin gyis le lo spangs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rang bzhin gyis le lo spangs nas /
translated: that the bodhisattva, having naturally abandoned laziness,

original: brtson 'grus kyi mthus dge ba rgyun du byed pa'i bdag nyid can yin na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mthus dge ba rgyun du byed pa'i bdag nyid can yin na /
translated: is by the power of his effort of the nature of one who always practices virtue.

original: gal te le lo'i dbang du byas nas brtson 'grus nyams pas dge ba rgyun du mi byed na ngo tsha ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te le lo'i dbang du byas nas brtson 'grus nyams pas dge ba rgyun du mi byed na ngo tsha ba yin no //
translated: If, having come under the influence of laziness, he degenerates from effort and does not always practice virtue, he is ashamed.

original: @227a * // de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid dang 'gal lo zhes le lo spangs nas brtson 'grus rgyun du rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: @227a * // de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid dang 'gal lo zhes le lo spangs nas brtson 'grus rgyun du rtsom par byed do //
translated: Therefore, in order to avoid laziness and to always practice effort, he thinks, “I am contradicting the very nature of a bodhisattva.”

original: 'dis ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of effort.

original: g-yeng bas ngo tsha zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: g-yeng bas ngo tsha zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Shame at distraction” means

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis lus dpen par byed de dgon pa na gnas pa dang / sems dben par byed de gzugs la sogs pa la rtog cing g-yeng ba spong ba'i bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis lus dpen par byed de dgon pa na gnas pa dang / sems dben par byed de gzugs la sogs pa la rtog cing g-yeng ba spong ba'i bdag nyid yin na /
translated: The bodhisattva naturally makes the body secluded by living in the forest, and makes the mind secluded by the nature of abandoning thoughts and distractions concerning form, etc.

original: gal te lus 'du 'dzi'i nang na gnas shing sems gzugs la sogs pa la g-yeng na ngo tsha bar byed de /
analyzed: gal te lus 'du 'dzi'i nang na gnas shing sems gzugs la sogs pa la g-yeng na ngo tsha bar byed de /
translated: If the body dwells in the midst of distractions and the mind is distracted by form, etc., he is ashamed.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid las 'das so zhes byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lus kyi 'du 'dzi dang sems kyi g-yeng ba gnyi ga spong bar byed de /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid las 'das so zhes byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lus kyi 'du 'dzi dang sems kyi g-yeng ba gnyi ga spong bar byed de /
