translated: Therefore, bodhisattvas abandon both the distractions of the body and the distractions of the mind, because they transcend the nature of the bodhisattva.

original: 'dis ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of meditative absorption.

original: lta chung ngo tsha zhes bya ba la /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rang bzhin gyis shes rab chen po dang ldan pas /
analyzed: lta chung ngo tsha zhes bya ba la / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rang bzhin gyis shes rab chen po dang ldan pas /
translated: “Low view” and “shame”🔽The bodhisattvas naturally have great wisdom,

original: lta ba chen po'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: lta ba chen po'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: and so they have the nature of great view.

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med par lta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med par lta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he views the selflessness of persons and things.

original: de lta bu yin pa las chos la bdag med par lta ba ni med kyi /
analyzed: de lta bu yin pa las chos la bdag med par lta ba ni med kyi /
translated: In that way, he does not view the selflessness of things,

original: lta ba chung ngu gang zag la bdag med pa tsam du lta na /
analyzed: lta ba chung ngu gang zag la bdag med pa tsam du lta na /
translated: but views the selflessness of persons alone, the lesser view.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is ashamed of that.🔽Therefore, he transcends the reality of the bodhisattva,

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid las 'das so zhes byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gang zag dang chos gnyi ga la bdag med par lta ste /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid las 'das so zhes byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gang zag dang chos gnyi ga la bdag med par lta ste /
translated: and the bodhisattvas view the selflessness of both persons and things.

original: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par bstan te /
translated: This shows the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshig de dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: These words show the practice of the six perfections.

original: theg gzhan ngo tsha byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: theg gzhan ngo tsha byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is ashamed of the other vehicle.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what it says.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa yang bla na med pa'i byang chub chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa yang bla na med pa'i byang chub chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattva, by nature, practices the six perfections in order to attain unsurpassed great enlightenment.

original: bsngos shing smon lam 'debs pa yin na /🔽gal te pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa rnams theg pa gzhan te /
analyzed: bsngos shing smon lam 'debs pa yin na / gal te pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa rnams theg pa gzhan te /
translated: If you dedicate and make prayers,🔽then even if you practice the six perfections for the sake of attaining🔽the other vehicles,🔽

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngo zhing smon lam 'debs na ngo tsha ba yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngo zhing smon lam 'debs na ngo tsha ba yin no //
translated: If one dedicates and prays for the attainment of the Nirvana of the Disciples and Solitary Buddhas, that is shameful.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid las 'das so zhes pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub @227b pa rnams byang chub chen por thob par bya ba'i sngo bar byed de 'dis ni byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa bstan to //🔽de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang bsgrub la /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid las 'das so zhes pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub @227b pa rnams byang chub chen por thob par bya ba'i sngo bar byed de 'dis ni byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa bstan to // de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang bsgrub la /
translated: Therefore, those who practice the six perfections dedicate them to the attainment of great enlightenment, so as not to transgress the Dharma of the bodhisattvas.🔽This shows the bodhisattva's prayer for great enlightenment.🔽Thus, one who practices the six perfections and prays for great enlightenment is a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub chen por yang smon lam 'debs pa de byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub chen por yang smon lam 'debs pa de byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: slong ba la rim gro med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: slong ba la rim gro med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Lack of respect for beggars means

original: slong ba 'ongs na mig gnags nas bkyigs te ster ba ni rim gro med pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: slong ba 'ongs na mig gnags nas bkyigs te ster ba ni rim gro med pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: When a beggar comes, he gives with eyes closed, bound by his vow. This is called without respect.

original: de lta bu dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha'o //
translated: Such things are also a bodhisattva's shame.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag thams cad kyis zhes bya ba la 'dod la ma chags las gsum rnam dag ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag thams cad kyis zhes bya ba la 'dod la ma chags las gsum rnam dag ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: All these verses, beginning with not attached to desire, three actions pure,

original: theg gzhan ngo tshas byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: theg gzhan ngo tshas byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: up to through shame for other vehicles, a bodhisattva,

original: zhes bya ba yan chad kyis don gyi rnam grangs gzhan nas gzhan du sbyar te /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa dang byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yan chad kyis don gyi rnam grangs gzhan nas gzhan du sbyar te / pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa dang byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: connect to other categories of meaning.🔽The meaning is that the characteristic of a bodhisattva is taught through accomplishing the six perfections and aspiring to great enlightenment.

original: dgong pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa dang byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa'i don /
analyzed: dgong pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa dang byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa'i don /
translated: The meaning of accomplishing the six perfections and aspiring to great enlightenment.

original: rnam grangs du mas rgyas par bshad pa'i don gyi 'jug mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mas rgyas par bshad pa'i don gyi 'jug mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the extensive explanation in many ways in brief,

original: 'di dang pha rol dag dang btang ba snyoms kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos so //
analyzed: 'di dang pha rol dag dang btang ba snyoms kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos so //
translated: he states one verse: “By giving equally to those who are inferior, etc.”

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa dang / byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams ji ltar sems can la phan 'dogs pa de ston to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa dang / byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams ji ltar sems can la phan 'dogs pa de ston to //
translated: This verse also shows how the bodhisattvas benefit sentient beings by means of accomplishing the six perfections and by means of aspiring to great enlightenment.

original: phan 'dogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The benefit is twofold:

original: rgyu'i chos kyis phan 'dogs pa dang / 'bras bu'i chos kyis phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i chos kyis phan 'dogs pa dang / 'bras bu'i chos kyis phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: benefit by means of the dharmas of the cause and benefit by means of the dharmas of the result.

original: de la tshe 'dir phan 'dogs pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas byed de /
analyzed: de la tshe 'dir phan 'dogs pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas byed de /
translated: Among them, benefit in this life is accomplished by the perfection of generosity,

original: yo byad kyis phongs pa rnams la yo byad byin nas longs spyod pa la gzhag pa'i sgo nas phan 'dogs so//
analyzed: yo byad kyis phongs pa rnams la yo byad byin nas longs spyod pa la gzhag pa'i sgo nas phan 'dogs so//
translated: because one benefits by giving resources to those who are in need of resources and by establishing them in enjoyment.

original: tshe rabs pha rol du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas phan 'dogs te /
analyzed: tshe rabs pha rol du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas phan 'dogs te /
translated: In future lives, the perfection of morality benefits them.

original: sems can dag tshul khrims la bkod na /
analyzed: sems can dag tshul khrims la bkod na /
translated: For when beings are established in morality,

original: lha dang mi la sogs pa'i skye ba bzang po 'thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha dang mi la sogs pa'i skye ba bzang po 'thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: they obtain good rebirths as gods and humans.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i sgo nas phan @228a * //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i sgo nas phan @228a * //
translated: The perfection of patience benefits them by means of tolerance.

original: 'dogs te / sems can gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang /🔽slar gnod pa'i lan mi glon zhing ci'ang mi byed par btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dogs te / sems can gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang / slar gnod pa'i lan mi glon zhing ci'ang mi byed par btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For when others harm them,🔽they do not retaliate, but remain indifferent and do not react at all.

original: sbyor bar 'du byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyor bar 'du byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The perfection of vigor benefits them by means of application and performance.

original: sbyor ba ni sems can gyi las su bya ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni sems can gyi las su bya ba'o //
translated: Application is the activity for sentient beings.

original: 'du byed pa ni grogs su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'du byed pa ni grogs su 'gro ba ste /
translated: Performance is the assistance.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sems can gyi las su bya ba rnams kyi grogs byed pa'i sgo nas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sems can gyi las su bya ba rnams kyi grogs byed pa'i sgo nas phan 'dogs so //
translated: The perfection of vigor benefits them by means of the activity for sentient beings and by means of assistance.

original: 'byor ba thob ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byor ba thob ces bya ba la /
translated: The perfection of concentration benefits them by means of attainment.

original: 'byor pa thob pa ni mngon par shes pa thob pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'byor pa thob pa ni mngon par shes pa thob pa la bya ste /
translated: The attainment of mastery is to be understood as the attainment of the superknowledges.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mngon par shes pas thob par byas nas mngon par shes pa thob pa'i sgo nas sems can la phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mngon par shes pas thob par byas nas mngon par shes pa thob pa'i sgo nas sems can la phan 'dogs so //
translated: The perfection of meditation is the attainment of the superknowledges, and through the attainment of the superknowledges, one benefits sentient beings.

original: mtshungs par ston dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshungs par ston dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The line “and the teaching of equality” means

original: theg pa gsum gyi chos gang la gang bstan na 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i chos de ston pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi chos gang la gang bstan na 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i chos de ston pa zhes bya ste /
translated: that the teaching of whatever Dharma of the three vehicles will tame a disciple is called “teaching.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni sems can dang 'tsham pa'i chos bshad de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni sems can dang 'tsham pa'i chos bshad de /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the explanation of the Dharma in accordance with sentient beings.

original: the tshom bcad pa'i sgo nas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: the tshom bcad pa'i sgo nas phan 'dogs so //
translated: Through the elimination of doubt, one benefits.

original: de ltar tshig de dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pas rgyu'i chos kyis phan 'dogs par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshig de dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pas rgyu'i chos kyis phan 'dogs par bstan to //
translated: Thus, by these lines, the benefit through the dharmas of the cause has been taught, through the accomplishment of the six perfections.

original: 'bras bu chen pos phan 'dogs par 'jug pa byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bras bu chen pos phan 'dogs par 'jug pa byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The line “the bodhisattva who engages in the benefit through the great fruit” means

original: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngos nas bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngos nas bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ste /
translated: Thus, having dedicated the practice of the six perfections to unsurpassed enlightenment, he attains unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: byang chub thob pa dang mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i sgo nas sems can la phan 'dogs pa dang / 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub thob pa dang mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i sgo nas sems can la phan 'dogs pa dang / 'jug par byed de /
translated: And he benefits sentient beings by attaining enlightenment, by manifesting the attainment of enlightenment, and by turning the wheel of the Dharma.

original: 'dis ni byang chub chen por smon pas 'bras bu'i chos kyis phan 'dogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub chen por smon pas 'bras bu'i chos kyis phan 'dogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that he benefits by the resultant reality through his aspiration for great enlightenment.

original: de ltar rgyu'i chos kyis kyang phan 'dogs pa 'bras bu'i chos kyis kyang phan 'dogs pa de byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu'i chos kyis kyang phan 'dogs pa 'bras bu'i chos kyis kyang phan 'dogs pa de byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, he benefits by the reality of the cause and he benefits by the reality of the result. He is a bodhisattva. This is the meaning.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid spyir rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid spyir rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad do zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the general analysis of the characteristics of a bodhisattva.

original: de ltar sa bcu gcig po dag na /
analyzed: de ltar sa bcu gcig po dag na /
translated: Thus, on the eleven stages,

original: byang chub sems dpa' grangs kyis du yod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid bshad nas da ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag la mi dbye bar mtshan du ji skad bya ba'i mtshan 'chad do//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' grangs kyis du yod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid bshad nas da ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag la mi dbye bar mtshan du ji skad bya ba'i mtshan 'chad do//
translated: Having explained the number of bodhisattvas and the characteristics of bodhisattvas, now, in order to explain the names of those bodhisattvas without distinction, he explains the names.

original: @228b de la ming la rnam pa gnyis te don dang bcas pa dang don med pa'o //
analyzed: @228b de la ming la rnam pa gnyis te don dang bcas pa dang don med pa'o //
translated: There are two kinds of names: those with meaning and those without meaning.

original: de la don dang bcas pa ni yon tan las drangs nas ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: de la don dang bcas pa ni yon tan las drangs nas ming du btags pa ste /
translated: Among them, those with meaning are names derived from qualities.

original: dper na bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, Bhagavat.

original: don med pa ni dper na mi dbul po la dbang phyug ces btags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: don med pa ni dper na mi dbul po la dbang phyug ces btags pa lta bu'o //
translated: Those without meaning are, for example, calling a poor man lord.

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi mtshan gyi rnam grangs bcu drug po 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi mtshan gyi rnam grangs bcu drug po 'byung ste /
translated: Here, the sixteen synonyms of bodhisattvas appear.

original: de dag thams cad ni yon tan las drangs nas mtshan du btags pas don dang bcas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni yon tan las drangs nas mtshan du btags pas don dang bcas par rig par bya'o //
translated: All of those should be known as having meaning, because they are names derived from qualities.

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis shes bya zab mo la dad pas na /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis shes bya zab mo la dad pas na /
translated: They have faith in the profound objects of knowledge, which are characterized by the absence of a self in the individual and in phenomena.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //🔽mthu chen po mos pas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o // mthu chen po mos pas na /
translated: He is called a bodhisattva because he has faith in the profound knowable objects through the characteristics of the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: sems dpa' che zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' che zhes bya ste /
translated: He is called a great being because he has great power.

original: mthu chen po ni ba spu'i bu ga gcig nas kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i bskal pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthu chen po ni ba spu'i bu ga gcig nas kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i bskal pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great power is because he can display the kalpas of the formation and destruction of the trichiliocosm from a single pore.

original: yang na bdag bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya bar sems pas byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya bar sems pas byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: Or, he is a bodhisattva because he thinks, “I will attain unsurpassed enlightenment.”

original: sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las bsgral nas mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhag par sems pas na sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las bsgral nas mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhag par sems pas na sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called a great being because he thinks, “I will liberate all sentient beings from the suffering of cyclic existence and establish them in nirvana.”

original: yang na shes rab dang ldan pas na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na shes rab dang ldan pas na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, he is called a bodhisattva because he possesses wisdom.

original: shes rab dang ldan pa rnams kyang 'khor ba na gnas kyang 'khor ba'i nyes pas gos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa rnams kyang 'khor ba na gnas kyang 'khor ba'i nyes pas gos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And even though they have wisdom, they do not become defiled by the faults of cyclic existence.

original: brtson 'grus ni chen por 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni chen por 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas /
translated: Diligence is the cause of greatness.

original: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because they have diligence, they are called “great beings.”

original: yang na chen po rnam pa bdun dang ldan pas sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na chen po rnam pa bdun dang ldan pas sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, they are called “great beings” because they have seven kinds of greatness.

original: chen po rnam pa bdun ni sngar bshad pa rnams so //
analyzed: chen po rnam pa bdun ni sngar bshad pa rnams so //
translated: The seven kinds of greatness have been explained above.

original: shin tu zab cing rgya che ba'i shes rab dang ldan pas /
analyzed: shin tu zab cing rgya che ba'i shes rab dang ldan pas /
translated: They have the wisdom that is very profound and vast.

original: blo ldan zhes bya ba zab mo'i don gyi dgongs pa 'grel bar byed pa'i shes rab kyi snang ba chen po thob pas na gzi brjid mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: blo ldan zhes bya ba zab mo'i don gyi dgongs pa 'grel bar byed pa'i shes rab kyi snang ba chen po thob pas na gzi brjid mchog ces bya'o //
translated: They are called “wise” because they have attained the great light of wisdom that explains the intended meaning of the profound.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pas na rgyal ba'i sras so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pas na rgyal ba'i sras so zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “sons of the victors” because they are born into the family of the tathāgatas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad pas bya ba la zhugs pas na rgyal ba'i gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad pas bya ba la zhugs pas na rgyal ba'i gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “bases of the victors” because they are engaged in the activity of perpetuating the lineage of the buddhas.

original: sku gsum 'bras bur gyur pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa @229a * //
analyzed: sku gsum 'bras bur gyur pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa @229a * //
translated: The three kayas are the fruition🔽.🔽

original: la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos 'dab ma lta bur gyur pa'i rgyu byed pas na rgyal ba'i myu gu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos 'dab ma lta bur gyur pa'i rgyu byed pas na rgyal ba'i myu gu zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the sprout of the Victor because it causes the fruit of the three bodies and the qualities of the Buddha such as the powers and fearlessnesses to grow.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa las rgyal bar byed pas na rnam par rgyal byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa las rgyal bar byed pas na rnam par rgyal byed ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the Victorious One because it conquers the afflictions in the mindstreams of self and others.

original: bdud bzhi 'joms par byed pa'i grogs med par dpa' bo gcig pu yin pas na mthu rtsal can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdud bzhi 'joms par byed pa'i grogs med par dpa' bo gcig pu yin pas na mthu rtsal can zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the Powerful One because it is a single hero without a companion in the conquest of the four demons.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyis ma rtogs pa'i chos ngo mtshar du bya ba don dam pa'i chos rtogs pas na ngo mtshar mchog ces bya'o //🔽'khor ba'i 'brog dgon par zhugs pa'i sems can gyi 'dron pa mang po rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer chen por phyin par byed pas na /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyis ma rtogs pa'i chos ngo mtshar du bya ba don dam pa'i chos rtogs pas na ngo mtshar mchog ces bya'o // 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon par zhugs pa'i sems can gyi 'dron pa mang po rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer chen por phyin par byed pas na /
translated: It is called the Supreme Wonder because it realizes the ultimate truth, the wondrous Dharma not realized by any worldly person.

original: ded dpon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ded dpon zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the Caravan Leader because it leads the great caravan of sentient beings who have entered the wilderness of cyclic existence to the great city of nirvana.

original: phyogs bcu thams cad du yon tan gyi dris khyab pas na /
analyzed: phyogs bcu thams cad du yon tan gyi dris khyab pas na /
translated: Since the ten directions are pervaded by the fragrance of good qualities,🔽

original: grags pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: grags pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called Greatly Renowned because his fame pervades all the ten directions.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po dang ldan pas na bsod nams che zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po dang ldan pas na bsod nams che zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called Great Merit because he possesses the great accumulation of merit from generosity and so forth.

original: sems can thams cad bsgrub pa'i thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas na snying rje can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bsgrub pa'i thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas na snying rje can zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called Compassionate because he possesses great compassion for accomplishing all sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i longs spyod chen po dang ldan pas na dbang phyug ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i longs spyod chen po dang ldan pas na dbang phyug ces bya'o //
translated: He is called Powerful because he possesses great supramundane enjoyment.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa dang ldan pas na chos ldan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa dang ldan pas na chos ldan zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called Righteous because he possesses blameless physical, verbal, and mental actions.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan bcu drug gi don so sor bstan nas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i don rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir de nyid legs rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan bcu drug gi don so sor bstan nas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i don rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir de nyid legs rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Having thus explained the meaning of each of the sixteen names of the bodhisattva, in order to extensively explain the meaning of the term bodhisattva, it says he who well realizes reality and so forth.

original: de la khyad par rnam pa lnga khong du chud cing rtogs pas na /
analyzed: de la khyad par rnam pa lnga khong du chud cing rtogs pas na /
translated: It is so called because it is the level on which one gains a full realization and understanding of five kinds of distinctive features.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is so called because he has understood and realized five kinds of special knowledge.

original: khyad par rnam pa lnga ni de nyid legs par rtogs pa dang / don chen po legs par rtogs pa dang / thams cad kyi don rtogs pa dang / rtag pa'i ngon rtogs pa dang / thabs rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par rnam pa lnga ni de nyid legs par rtogs pa dang / don chen po legs par rtogs pa dang / thams cad kyi don rtogs pa dang / rtag pa'i ngon rtogs pa dang / thabs rtogs pa ste /
translated: The five special knowledges are: the knowledge of reality, the knowledge of the great meaning, the knowledge of all things, the knowledge of the eternal meaning, and the knowledge of means.

original: de lnga rtogs pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lnga rtogs pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is so called because he has realized these five.

original: de la gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med par rtogs pas na de nyid legs rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med par rtogs pas na de nyid legs rtogs pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of reality is the realization of the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of things.

original: bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don 'grub par bya ba rtogs pas na don chen po legs par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don 'grub par bya ba rtogs pas na don chen po legs par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the great meaning is the realization of the accomplishment of one’s own and others’ goals.

original: 'dus byas dang @229b 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa la sogs pa'i chos ma lus par rtogs pas na thams cad kyi don rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang @229b 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa la sogs pa'i chos ma lus par rtogs pas na thams cad kyi don rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of all things is the realization of all things, compounded and uncompounded, with and without outflows, and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bar 'ga' shes pa dang / bar 'ga' shes pa dang mi ldan pas ma yin gyi phung po lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan pas 'das par zhugs kyang mkhyen pa zad pa med par rtogs pas na rtag pa rtogs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bar 'ga' shes pa dang / bar 'ga' shes pa dang mi ldan pas ma yin gyi phung po lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan pas 'das par zhugs kyang mkhyen pa zad pa med par rtogs pas na rtag pa rtogs so //
translated: Bodhisattvas are not sometimes knowing and sometimes not knowing, but they realize that their knowledge is never exhausted, even though they have entered into nirvana, in which all the remaining aggregates have been eliminated.

original: sems can gang la chos gang bstan pas 'dul bar 'gyur ba dang sku ci 'dra ba bstan nas 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i chos de bstan pa dang / sku de rtogs pa'i thabs rtogs pas na thabs rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gang la chos gang bstan pas 'dul bar 'gyur ba dang sku ci 'dra ba bstan nas 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i chos de bstan pa dang / sku de rtogs pa'i thabs rtogs pas na thabs rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They realize the means of realizing the teaching and the body that will be revealed, the teaching by which any sentient being will be disciplined and the body that will be revealed in order to discipline them.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis khyad par rnam pa bzhi rtogs pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis khyad par rnam pa bzhi rtogs pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In another enumeration, it is in order to demonstrate that they are bodhisattvas because they realize four kinds of special knowledge.

original: bdag gi rjes shes phra mo'i lta ba shes //
analyzed: bdag gi rjes shes phra mo'i lta ba shes //
translated: Knowledge of the view of subtle subsequent knowledge of the self,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs rnam rig shes pa dang // thams cad yang dag ma yin kun rtogs shes //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs rnam rig shes pa dang // thams cad yang dag ma yin kun rtogs shes //
translated: Knowledge of the various kinds of consciousness, knowledge of the realization that all is unreal,

original: de phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes kyang bya //
analyzed: de phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes kyang bya //
translated: Therefore, he is called a bodhisattva.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sems dang yid rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rang bzhin rtogs pa dang de gsum char yang dag pa ma yin par kun du rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yin par shes pas na /
analyzed: sems dang yid rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rang bzhin rtogs pa dang de gsum char yang dag pa ma yin par kun du rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yin par shes pas na /
translated: Because he realizes the nature of the three: mind, thought, and consciousness, and because he knows that all three are characterized by unreal imagination,

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: therefore he is called a bodhisattva.

original: de la sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de la sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bya ste /
translated: Here, mind refers to the store consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ji lta bu yin pa rtogs pas na /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ji lta bu yin pa rtogs pas na /
translated: Because he realizes the nature of the store consciousness,

original: bdag gi rjes shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gi rjes shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: he is said to have the knowledge of the self.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs nas bdag tu rtog pa 'jug pas na /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs nas bdag tu rtog pa 'jug pas na /
translated: Because the imagination of a self occurs when the store consciousness is objectified,

original: kun gzhi'i rang bzhin shes pa la bdag gi rjes shes pa'o zhes btags so //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rang bzhin shes pa la bdag gi rjes shes pa'o zhes btags so //
translated: the knowledge of the nature of the store consciousness is designated as the knowledge of the self.

original: de la ji ltar shes pa na kun gzhi rang bzhin shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar shes pa na kun gzhi rang bzhin shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one know the nature of the store consciousness?

original: sum cu pa'i rab tu byed pa las /
analyzed: sum cu pa'i rab tu byed pa las /
translated: The Triṃśikā states:

original: de la kun gzhi rnam shes ni //
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam shes ni //
translated: The store consciousness is the cause

original: rnam smin sa bon thams cad pa //
analyzed: rnam smin sa bon thams cad pa //
translated: It is the seed of all karmic maturation.

original: len pa dag dang de yi gnas //
analyzed: len pa dag dang de yi gnas //
translated: It is the appropriator and its abode.

original: rig pa rnam par mi rig pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa rnam par mi rig pa'o //
translated: It is the cognition that is not aware of itself.

original: rtag tu rig dang yid byed dang // rigs dang 'du shes sems par ldan //
analyzed: rtag tu rig dang yid byed dang // rigs dang 'du shes sems par ldan //
translated: It is always associated with the mental factors of contact, attention,

original: de ni tshor btang snyoms te //
analyzed: de ni tshor btang snyoms te //
translated: and the sensation of equanimity.

original: ma bsgribs lung ma bstan kyang de //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bur shes na kun gzhi rang bzhin shes @230a * //
analyzed: ma bsgribs lung ma bstan kyang de // zhes bshad pa lta bur shes na kun gzhi rang bzhin shes @230a * //
translated: It is unobscured and neutral.

original: pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin no //
translated: If one understands it in this way, one understands the nature of the foundation consciousness.

original: 'di ni nyon mongs pa'i yid la bya ste kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nga dang bdag gis dmigs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs pa'i yid la bya ste kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nga dang bdag gis dmigs pa byed pa'o //
translated: This is the defiled mind. The foundation consciousness is the object of observation of the view of the self and the view of “I.”

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid kyi rang bzhin shes pas na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid kyi rang bzhin shes pas na /
translated: By understanding the nature of the defiled mind,

original: phra mo'i lta ba shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phra mo'i lta ba shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: one is said to understand the subtle view.

original: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i yid kyi rang bzhin shes pa la phra mor lta ba shes zhes bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i yid kyi rang bzhin shes pa la phra mor lta ba shes zhes bya'o zhe na /
translated: Why is understanding the nature of the defiled mind called understanding the subtle view?

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba lung du ma bstan pa byed pa'i dus na yang nga'o snyam pa dang / bdag go snyam du sems pa rtag tu 'byung bas na /🔽blta dka' ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i yid shes pa la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba lung du ma bstan pa byed pa'i dus na yang nga'o snyam pa dang / bdag go snyam du sems pa rtag tu 'byung bas na / blta dka' ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i yid shes pa la /
translated: The afflicted mind is the thought “I am” and the thought “mine” that always occurs when one performs virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral actions.🔽Because it is difficult to see,

original: phra mo lta ba shes pa zhes btags so //
analyzed: phra mo lta ba shes pa zhes btags so //
translated: the consciousness of the afflicted mind is called “subtle view consciousness.”

original: ji ltar shes pa na nyon mongs pa'i yid shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa na nyon mongs pa'i yid shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how it is known that there is an afflicted mind,

original: sum cu pa'i rab tu dbye ba las /
analyzed: sum cu pa'i rab tu dbye ba las /
translated: it is known in the way that the Triṃśikā’s analysis explains:

original: de la gnas te rab 'jug cing //
analyzed: de la gnas te rab 'jug cing //
translated: Dwelling on that, it engages.

original: de la dmigs pas yid ces bya //
analyzed: de la dmigs pas yid ces bya //
translated: Because it focuses on that, it is called mind.

original: rnam shes ngar sems bdag nyid can //
analyzed: rnam shes ngar sems bdag nyid can //
translated: Consciousness is the nature of the thought “I am.”

original: nyon mongs bzhi dang 'grogs pa ste //
analyzed: nyon mongs bzhi dang 'grogs pa ste //
translated: It is accompanied by four afflictions.

original: rtag tu bsgribs la lung ma bstan //
analyzed: rtag tu bsgribs la lung ma bstan //
translated: It is always obscured and neutral.

original: ces bshad pa'i tshul du shes na nyon mongs pa'i yid kyi rang bzhin shes pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa'i tshul du shes na nyon mongs pa'i yid kyi rang bzhin shes pa yin no //
translated: If it is known in that way, the nature of the afflicted mind is known.

original: rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug la bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug la bya ste /
translated: Consciousness is the six consciousnesses, from eye consciousness to mind consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa drug gi rang bzhin shes pas na rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug gi rang bzhin shes pas na rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the cognition of the various aspects because it cognizes the nature of the six consciousnesses.

original: ji ltar shes na rnam par shes pa drug gi rang bzhin shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes na rnam par shes pa drug gi rang bzhin shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does it cognize the nature of the six consciousnesses?

original: sum cu pa'i rab tu dbye ba las //
analyzed: sum cu pa'i rab tu dbye ba las //
translated: The Thirty Verses says:

original: gsum ni rnam pa drug po la //
analyzed: gsum ni rnam pa drug po la //
translated: The three are the six aspects.

original: dmigs pa gang yin de dag ste //
analyzed: dmigs pa gang yin de dag ste //
translated: Whatever is the object of observation of those,

original: kun du 'gro dang bye brag gis //
analyzed: kun du 'gro dang bye brag gis //
translated: the universal and the particular,🔽the mental factors that arise with the mind,

original: sems la byung ba dge ba dang // de bzhin nyon mongs nye nyon mongs //
analyzed: sems la byung ba dge ba dang // de bzhin nyon mongs nye nyon mongs //
translated: the virtuous, the afflictions, and the secondary afflictions,

original: tshor ba gsum dang de ldan no //
analyzed: tshor ba gsum dang de ldan no //
translated: and the three feelings are possessed.

original: zhes bshad pa'i tshul du shes na rnam par shes pa drug gi rang bzhin shes pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i tshul du shes na rnam par shes pa drug gi rang bzhin shes pa yin no //
translated: If one knows in the manner explained, one knows the nature of the six consciousnesses.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad po de dag kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa lta bu rtog pa'i rang bzhin can yin par shes pa ni thams cad yang dag ma yin pa kun du rtog par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad po de dag kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa lta bu rtog pa'i rang bzhin can yin par shes pa ni thams cad yang dag ma yin pa kun du rtog par shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that those eight consciousnesses have the nature of conceptualization, in the aspect of subject and object, is the knowledge that all are unreal ideation.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis spyod par rnam pa lnga rtogs pas na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o zhes @230b bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis spyod par rnam pa lnga rtogs pas na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o zhes @230b bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In another enumeration, one is called a bodhisattva because one realizes five kinds of practice.

original: mi shes shes pa rjes su shes pa shes //
analyzed: mi shes shes pa rjes su shes pa shes //
translated: The knowledge of the unknown, the knowledge of the subsequent,

original: dngos po med shes rjes su 'byung bshes //
analyzed: dngos po med shes rjes su 'byung bshes //
translated: The knowledge of the non-existent, the knowledge of the subsequent occurrence,

original: mi shes shes pa so sor shes pas na //
analyzed: mi shes shes pa so sor shes pas na //
translated: The knowledge of the unknown, the knowledge of the individual,

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes kyang bya //🔽zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes kyang bya // zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, one is also called a bodhisattva.

original: rnam pa lnga shes pa ni mi shes pa shes pa so sor shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa so sor shes pa dang / dngos po med pa so sor shes pa dang / 'byung ba rjes su shes pa so sor shes pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga shes pa ni mi shes pa shes pa so sor shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa so sor shes pa dang / dngos po med pa so sor shes pa dang / 'byung ba rjes su shes pa so sor shes pa dang /
translated: The knowledge of the five kinds is the knowledge of the unknown, the knowledge of the individual, the knowledge of the subsequent, the knowledge of the non-existent, and the knowledge of the individual subsequent occurrence.

original: mi shes pa shes pa so sor shes pa ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa shes pa so sor shes pa ste /
translated: The understanding of the non-understanding of the non-understanding.

original: de ltar rnam pa lngas shes pas na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa lngas shes pas na /
translated: Because of understanding in these five ways,

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ;
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ;
translated: it is called the stage of the bodhisattva.

original: de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin ni chos thams cad nam mkha'i ngos lta bur dmigs pa yin no zhes shes pas na /🔽mi shes pa shes pa so sor zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin ni chos thams cad nam mkha'i ngos lta bur dmigs pa yin no zhes shes pas na / mi shes pa shes pa so sor zhes bya ste /
translated: The nature of non-conceptual intuition is the perception of all things as like the surface of space.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la gzung ba 'dzin pa lta bu'i shes pa med pas mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la gzung ba 'dzin pa lta bu'i shes pa med pas mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The understanding of the non-understanding is called the understanding of the non-understanding because, in non-conceptual intuition, there is no consciousness that is like the grasping of an object.

original: 'on kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: However, non-conceptual intuition is the nature of consciousness,🔽because in the sphere of that intuition, the sphere of objects of consciousness appears,

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor du gzugs brnyan brnyan snang ba lta bur ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor der yang /🔽shes bya'i dkyil 'khor thams cad snang bas shes pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor du gzugs brnyan brnyan snang ba lta bur ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor der yang /🔽shes bya'i dkyil 'khor thams cad snang bas shes pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: like a reflection in a mirror.

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis ni chos thams cad la sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang / rmi lam lta bur dmigs par byed pa yin par shes pas na /
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis ni chos thams cad la sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang / rmi lam lta bur dmigs par byed pa yin par shes pas na /
translated: The pure mundane wisdom perceives all phenomena as like an illusion, a mirage, and a dream.

original: rjes su shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called subsequent knowledge.

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes las byung bas rjes su shes pa zhes btags so //🔽yang na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed nas /🔽skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi la sogs pa rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba lugs bzhin pa dag ma rig pa las byung ba shes pa mi shes pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes las byung bas rjes su shes pa zhes btags so // yang na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed nas / skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi la sogs pa rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba lugs bzhin pa dag ma rig pa las byung ba shes pa mi shes pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Pure mundane wisdom is called subsequent knowledge because it arises subsequent to nonconceptual wisdom.🔽Alternatively, the knowledge that the dependent origination of the forward order, from the condition of ignorance, formations, and so on, up to the condition of birth, aging, and death, arises from ignorance is called knowledge of the unknown.

original: ma rig pa 'gags na 'du byed 'gag pa nas skye ba 'gags na rga shi 'gag pa'i bar du rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i rang bzhin shes pas na rjes su shes pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags na 'du byed 'gag pa nas skye ba 'gags na rga shi 'gag pa'i bar du rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i rang bzhin shes pas na rjes su shes pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the nature of dependent origination in the reverse order, from the cessation of aging and death through to the cessation of ignorance, is called subsequent knowledge.

original: kun btags kyi mtshan nyid thams cad ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du rang bzhin med par shes pas dngos po med pa shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽ji snyed kyi @231a * //
analyzed: kun btags kyi mtshan nyid thams cad ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du rang bzhin med par shes pas dngos po med pa shes pa zhes bya'o // ji snyed kyi @231a * //
translated: The characteristic of the imaginary is like the horn of a rabbit, and is known to be essenceless. Therefore, it is called the knowledge of non-entity.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa thams cad dang / sdug bsngal ba thams cad ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid las byung bar shes pas na 'byung ba rjes su shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni gzung 'dzin thams cad dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin par shes pas na mi shes pa shes pas so sor shes pa zhes bya ste yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la gzung 'dzin gyi shes pa med pas
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa thams cad dang / sdug bsngal ba thams cad ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid las byung bar shes pas na 'byung ba rjes su shes pa zhes bya'o // yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni gzung 'dzin thams cad dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin par shes pas na mi shes pa shes pas so sor shes pa zhes bya ste yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la gzung 'dzin gyi shes pa med pas
translated: The characteristic of the relative is known to be the source of all dualistic appearances of subject and object, and of all suffering. Therefore, it is called the knowledge of origin.🔽The characteristic of the perfect is known to be the nondual characteristic free from all subject-object duality. Therefore, it is called the knowledge of non-knowledge.

original: ni mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ni mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfect characteristic is called non-knowledge because there is no knowledge of subject and object.

original: ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pas na shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pas na shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called knowledge because it is the nature of wisdom.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyi shes bya'i khyad par rnam pa lnga shes pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan gyi shes bya'i khyad par rnam pa lnga shes pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, in order to demonstrate that a bodhisattva is so called because he knows five kinds of special objects of knowledge, he says:

original: don med shes shing don dam shes pa dang // thams cad shes dang ma lus don shes dang // shes bya shes gnas shes pa yongs shes pas //
analyzed: don med shes shing don dam shes pa dang // thams cad shes dang ma lus don shes dang // shes bya shes gnas shes pa yongs shes pas //
translated: He knows the unreal, he knows the ultimate, he knows everything, he knows the meaning of all, he knows the knower, the abode of knowledge, and complete knowledge.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes kyang zhes bya ba smos te /🔽shes bya'i khyad par rnam pa lnga shes pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid shes pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa dang / kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid shes pa dang / shes pa dang shes pa po thams cad rnam pa thams cad du shes pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes kyang zhes bya ba smos te / shes bya'i khyad par rnam pa lnga shes pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid shes pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa dang / kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid shes pa dang / shes pa dang shes pa po thams cad rnam pa thams cad du shes pa dang /
translated: Thus he is called a bodhisattva.

original: shes bya dang shes pa po dang / shes pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag par shes pa ste /
analyzed: shes bya dang shes pa po dang / shes pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag par shes pa ste /
translated: The five kinds of special objects of knowledge are: knowledge of the relative reality, knowledge of the perfect reality, knowledge of the imagined reality, knowledge of all knowledge and knowers in every way, and knowledge of the three cycles of knower, known, and knowing.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore he is called a bodhisattva.

original: de la don med par shes pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid shes pa ste /🔽khams gsum thams cad gzhan dbang tsam du zad kyi ;
analyzed: de la don med par shes pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid shes pa ste / khams gsum thams cad gzhan dbang tsam du zad kyi ;
translated: Knowledge of the absence of objects is knowledge of the other-dependent pattern.🔽One knows that the entire three-world universe is only the other-dependent pattern,

original: de las gzhan pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po'i don yod pa ma yin par shes pa dang / ji tsam du gzhan dbang gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par chags pa de tsam du don med pa'i ngo bo skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rgyun du 'byung bar shes so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po'i don yod pa ma yin par shes pa dang / ji tsam du gzhan dbang gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par chags pa de tsam du don med pa'i ngo bo skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rgyun du 'byung bar shes so //
translated: and that apart from that there is no object of a real external or internal entity.

original: don dam pa shes pa ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa shes pa ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa ste /
translated: Knowledge of the ultimate is knowledge of the reality pattern.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gzung 'dzin gnyis dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gzung 'dzin gnyis dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin par shes pa'o //
translated: One knows that the reality pattern is the nondual pattern, free of the duality of subject and object.

original: thams cad shes pa ni kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa ni kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa ste /
translated: Knowledge of everything is knowledge of the imagined pattern.

original: gzugs la sogs @231b pa'i gzung ba'i chos rnams dang / mig la sogs pa'i chos de gzung 'dzin du kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad ni ri bong gi rva bzhin dang mtshan nyid med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs @231b pa'i gzung ba'i chos rnams dang / mig la sogs pa'i chos de gzung 'dzin du kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad ni ri bong gi rva bzhin dang mtshan nyid med par shes pa'o //
translated: The phenomena of the apprehended, such as form, and the phenomena of the apprehender, such as the eyes, and all phenomena that are imagined to be the duality of apprehended and apprehender, are like the horns of a rabbit.

original: ma lus pa'i don shes pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa la sogs pa'i shes bya'i chos kun rdzob kyi bden pa thams cad shes pa ste /
analyzed: ma lus pa'i don shes pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa la sogs pa'i shes bya'i chos kun rdzob kyi bden pa thams cad shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the meaning in its entirety is the knowledge of all relative phenomena, which are objects of knowledge, such as the aggregates, elements, sense spheres, the contaminated and the uncontaminated, and so on.

original: ji snyed du kun rdzob kyi chos thams cad ni smra ba dang / bsam pa'i yul du myur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ji snyed du kun rdzob kyi chos thams cad ni smra ba dang / bsam pa'i yul du myur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should quickly know the extent of all relative phenomena, which are objects of speech and thought.

original: shes bya dang shes pa'i gnas dang / shes pa gsum shes pa ni shes bya dang shes pa po dang / shes pa gsum 'khor gsum yongs su dag par shes pa dang / don dam par na shes bya ste phyi'i yul dang / shes pa po ste gang zag dang /
analyzed: shes bya dang shes pa'i gnas dang / shes pa gsum shes pa ni shes bya dang shes pa po dang / shes pa gsum 'khor gsum yongs su dag par shes pa dang / don dam par na shes bya ste phyi'i yul dang / shes pa po ste gang zag dang /
translated: The knowledge of the three states of the object of knowledge, the knower, and the knowledge is the knowledge of the purity of the three spheres of the object of knowledge, the knower, and the knowledge.

original: shes bya ste shes rab gsum rang bzhin med par shes pa'o //🔽de la don med par shes pa dang / don dam par shes pa dang / thams cad shes pas ni mtshan nyid gsum shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: shes bya ste shes rab gsum rang bzhin med par shes pa'o // de la don med par shes pa dang / don dam par shes pa dang / thams cad shes pas ni mtshan nyid gsum shes pa bstan to //
translated: The three knowledges are the knowledge that the three realities, i.e. the knowable, are without own-being.🔽The knowledge that the object does not exist, the knowledge of the ultimate, and the knowledge of everything, demonstrate the knowledge of the three natures.

original: ma lus pa'i don rnam pa thams cad du shes pa dang / shes bya dang / shes pa po dang / shes pa gsum 'khor gsum yongs su dag par shes pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa shes pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa shes pa bstan to //🔽yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis rnam pa lnga shes pas na /
analyzed: ma lus pa'i don rnam pa thams cad du shes pa dang / shes bya dang / shes pa po dang / shes pa gsum 'khor gsum yongs su dag par shes pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa shes pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa shes pa bstan to // yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis rnam pa lnga shes pas na /
translated: The knowledge of the object in all its aspects without exception, and the knowledge of the three, i.e. the knowable, the knower and the knowledge, as completely pure in the three sectors, demonstrate the knowledge of the conventional and ultimate truths.🔽Moreover, in order to demonstrate that he is called a bodhisattva because he knows five categories,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he says:🔽The knowledge of perfection, the knowledge of the basis, the knowledge of the many, the knowledge of gradual teaching, and the knowledge of the removal of doubts,

original: rdzogs pa shes dang gnas kyang shes pa dang // mang shes rim gyis ston par shes pa dang // rab tu the tshom bsal ba shes pa dang / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa shes dang gnas kyang shes pa dang // mang shes rim gyis ston par shes pa dang // rab tu the tshom bsal ba shes pa dang / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: therefore he is called a bodhisattva.

original: zhes bya ba smos te de la rdzogs pa shes pa ni 'og min gyi pho brang du rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i skus mngon par sangs rgyas par bya ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te de la rdzogs pa shes pa ni 'og min gyi pho brang du rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i skus mngon par sangs rgyas par bya ba shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of perfection is the knowledge of the perfection of enlightenment in the palace of Akaniṣṭha by the body of perfect enjoyment.

original: yang na sangs rgyas kyi ye shes bzhi dang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa lnga thob nas /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas kyi ye shes bzhi dang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa lnga thob nas /
translated: Or else, having attained the four knowledges of the Buddha and the five pure aspects of the realm of Dharma,

original: shes bya thams cad rnam pa thams cad du ma lus par shes pa ni rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad rnam pa thams cad du ma lus par shes pa ni rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the knowledge of all objects in all their aspects without exception is called perfection.

original: gnas shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' gang gis dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs shing lha rnams la phan gdags par bya bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: gnas shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' gang gis dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs shing lha rnams la phan gdags par bya bar shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the abode is the knowledge of the Bodhisattva who abides in Tuṣita Heaven and knows how to benefit the gods.

original: @232a * // mang shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' gang gis yul gyi lhums su gshegs shing /
analyzed: @232a * // mang shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' gang gis yul gyi lhums su gshegs shing /
translated: The knowledge of the many is the knowledge of the Bodhisattva who enters the womb of a woman in a certain country

original: yum gyi lhums su sems can gyi don ji ltar mdzad par bya ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: yum gyi lhums su sems can gyi don ji ltar mdzad par bya ba shes pa'o //
translated: and knows how to benefit sentient beings in the mother’s womb.

original: rim gyis ston pa shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' gang gis lhums nas 'byung ba dang / pho brang slas lnga brgya'i nang na 'dod pa'i longs spyod la spyod pa dang / khab nas byung zhing rab tu 'byung ba dang / lo drug tu dka' ba spyad pa dang rdo rje gdan la sprul pa'i skus mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bstan pa shes pa'o //🔽rab tu the tshom sel ba shes pa ni sprul pa'i sku gang gis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas /
analyzed: rim gyis ston pa shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' gang gis lhums nas 'byung ba dang / pho brang slas lnga brgya'i nang na 'dod pa'i longs spyod la spyod pa dang / khab nas byung zhing rab tu 'byung ba dang / lo drug tu dka' ba spyad pa dang rdo rje gdan la sprul pa'i skus mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bstan pa shes pa'o // rab tu the tshom sel ba shes pa ni sprul pa'i sku gang gis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas /
translated: The knowledge of the gradual teaching is the knowledge of the Bodhisattva of the descent from the Tuṣita abode, of the entry into the womb, of the birth, of the enjoyment of desires in the midst of the harem with five hundred women, of the departure from home, of the renunciation, of the practice of austerities for six years, and of the demonstration of the complete enlightenment by the apparition-body on the Diamond Throne.

original: sems can gyi the tshom yongs su gcad par bya ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi the tshom yongs su gcad par bya ba shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the complete removal of doubts is the knowledge of the apparition-body by which the wheel of the Dharma is turned and the doubts of beings are completely removed.

original: rnam grangs gzhan du yang rnam pa bcu gcig shes pas ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan du yang rnam pa bcu gcig shes pas ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: In another way, it is said that one is called a Bodhisattva because of the knowledge of eleven things.

original: rnam pa bcu gcig gis ni 'das pa shes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa shes pa dang / da ltar byung ba shes pa dang / nang shes pa dang / phyi shes pa dang / rtsing ba shes pa dang / zhib pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gcig gis ni 'das pa shes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa shes pa dang / da ltar byung ba shes pa dang / nang shes pa dang / phyi shes pa dang / rtsing ba shes pa dang / zhib pa shes pa dang /
translated: The eleven aspects are: knowledge of the past, knowledge of the future, knowledge of the present, knowledge of the internal, knowledge of the external, knowledge of the gross, knowledge of the subtle,

original: tha ma shes pa dang / bzang po shes pa dang / nye ba shes pa dang / ring ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma shes pa dang / bzang po shes pa dang / nye ba shes pa dang / ring ba shes pa'o //
translated: knowledge of the inferior, knowledge of the superior, knowledge of the near, and knowledge of the distant.

original: rnyed dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnyed dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Regarding “gain” and so on,

original: 'das pa shes pa ni rnyed pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'das pa shes pa ni rnyed pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: knowledge of the past is called knowledge of gain.

original: 'das pa'i chos ni rgyus 'bras bu bskyed nas gnyi ga 'gags par shes so //
analyzed: 'das pa'i chos ni rgyus 'bras bu bskyed nas gnyi ga 'gags par shes so //
translated: One knows that past phenomena, having been produced by causes, have ceased.

original: ma rnyed ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ma rnyed ces bya ba la /
translated: Regarding “non-gain” and so on,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po shes pa ni ma rnyed pa shes pa zhes bya ste /🔽ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams ni rgyu yang ma skyes la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po shes pa ni ma rnyed pa shes pa zhes bya ste / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams ni rgyu yang ma skyes la /
translated: knowledge of future entities is called knowledge of non-gain.🔽One knows that future entities, their causes not yet arisen,

original: rgyu ma skyes pas rgyus 'bras bu da dung ma bskyed par shes so //
analyzed: rgyu ma skyes pas rgyus 'bras bu da dung ma bskyed par shes so //
translated: have not yet been produced by causes.

original: blo la rab tu gnas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: blo la rab tu gnas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Regarding “well-established in the mind” and so on,

original: da ltar gyi dngos po shes pa ni blo rab tu gnas pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dngos po shes pa ni blo rab tu gnas pa shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Knowledge of present things is called knowledge of the well-established mind.

original: da ltar gyi dngos po rnams ni rgyus 'bras bu bskyed nas /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dngos po rnams ni rgyus 'bras bu bskyed nas /
translated: Present things are produced by causes and

original: da dung ma 'gags pas na sems can gyi spyod yul du gyur par shes pa'o //
analyzed: da dung ma 'gags pas na sems can gyi spyod yul du gyur par shes pa'o //
translated: have not yet ceased, so they are known to be the domain of sentient beings.

original: shes pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for knowledge,

original: bdag nyid kyi blos chos rnams mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs par rtog pa ni shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi blos chos rnams mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs par rtog pa ni shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: the mind itself conceives of phenomena as impermanent, suffering, and so on, which is called knowledge.

original: 'dis ni nang shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nang shes pa bstan to //
translated: This shows inner knowledge.

original: rjes shes zhes bya ba la dge ba'i bshes gnyen @232b gyi chos bstan pa thob pa las chos rnams mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa shes pa ni rjes su shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rjes shes zhes bya ba la dge ba'i bshes gnyen @232b gyi chos bstan pa thob pa las chos rnams mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa shes pa ni rjes su shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: As for subsequent knowledge, from receiving the teachings on phenomena as impermanent, suffering, and so on from a spiritual friend, the knowledge that phenomena are impermanent, suffering, and so on is called subsequent knowledge.

original: 'dis ni phyi shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyi shes pa bstan to //
translated: This shows outer knowledge.

original: so sor ston pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so sor ston pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for teaching individually,

original: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gzhan la ston pa'i blo dang shes pa la /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gzhan la ston pa'i blo dang shes pa la /
translated: the mind and knowledge that teach others the specific and general characteristics of phenomena🔽are called teaching individually.

original: so sor ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “individual teaching. ”

original: gzhan la ston pa'i shes pas ni rtsing ba shes pa bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan la ston pa'i shes pas ni rtsing ba shes pa bstan te /
translated: The knowledge of teaching others shows the knowledge of the gross.

original: chos ston pa'i blo ni ming tshig la sogs pa rags pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos ston pa'i blo ni ming tshig la sogs pa rags pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind that teaches the Dharma has as its object the gross, such as names and phrases.

original: smra med blo dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smra med blo dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The knowledge of the absence of speech is called “the mind. ”

original: smra ba dang bshad pa thams cad spangs nas nang du bsam gtan du 'jog pa'i blo la smra med blo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: smra ba dang bshad pa thams cad spangs nas nang du bsam gtan du 'jog pa'i blo la smra med blo zhes bya ste /
translated: The mind that is set in inner concentration, having abandoned all speech and explanation, is called the mind of the absence of speech.

original: 'dis ni zhib pa shes pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni zhib pa shes pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the knowledge of the subtle.

original: bsam gtan gyi shes pa ni sgra dang tshig la sogs pa thams cad las 'das pa rtog pa med pa'i sems rtse gcig la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi shes pa ni sgra dang tshig la sogs pa thams cad las 'das pa rtog pa med pa'i sems rtse gcig la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge of concentration is the one-pointed mind that is free from discursive thought, because it transcends all sound, words, and so forth.

original: nga dang zhes bya ba la sa bdun pa man chad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i shes pa la nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nga dang zhes bya ba la sa bdun pa man chad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i shes pa la nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the “I” is called “the knowledge with pride. ”

original: 'dis ni tha ma shes pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni tha ma shes pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the knowledge of the last.

original: sa bdun pa man chad na nga rgyal phra mo yod pa dang / rtsol 'bad da dung yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bdun pa man chad na nga rgyal phra mo yod pa dang / rtsol 'bad da dung yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because on the seven stages and below, subtle pride exists and effort is still required.

original: nga rgyal bcom zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nga rgyal bcom zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for “pride is destroyed,”

original: sa brgyad pa dag ni shes pa'i nga rgyal bcom pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa dag ni shes pa'i nga rgyal bcom pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the consciousness of those on the eighth stage is called “consciousness in which pride is destroyed.”

original: 'dis ni shes pa bzang po bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni shes pa bzang po bstan te /
translated: This teaches the excellence of consciousness.

original: sa brgyad pa yan chad nga rgyal phra mo yang mi 'byung zhing brtsal 'bad spangs nas /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa yan chad nga rgyal phra mo yang mi 'byung zhing brtsal 'bad spangs nas /
translated: Because on the eighth stage and above, even subtle pride does not occur and effort is abandoned,

original: lhun gyis grub par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and one abides spontaneously.

original: yang na mos pa spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams kyi shes pa ni nga rgyal dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na mos pa spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams kyi shes pa ni nga rgyal dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, the consciousness of those abiding on the stage of action in faith is called “consciousness with pride,”

original: gzung 'dzin du rtog pa da dung ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin du rtog pa da dung ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the conception of object and subject has not yet been abandoned.

original: sa dang po yan chad kyi shes pa ni nga rgyal bcom pa'i shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa dang po yan chad kyi shes pa ni nga rgyal bcom pa'i shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The consciousness of those on the first stage and above is called “consciousness in which pride is destroyed,”

original: gzung 'dzin du chags pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin du chags pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because attachment to object and subject has been abandoned.

original: blo gros blo ldan zhes bya ba'i tshig ni shes pa bcu gcig po gnas dang sbyar te /
analyzed: blo gros blo ldan zhes bya ba'i tshig ni shes pa bcu gcig po gnas dang sbyar te /
translated: The words “intelligence, intelligent” are connected with the eleven knowledges and the stages.

original: rnyed pa shes pa'i blo gros kyi blo dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnyed pa shes pa'i blo gros kyi blo dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: “Endowed with the intelligence of the knowledge of attainment” and so on.

original: smin dang zhes bya ba la sa brgyad pa yan chad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i shes pa la /
analyzed: smin dang zhes bya ba la sa brgyad pa yan chad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i shes pa la /
translated: “Maturation” refers to the knowledge of bodhisattvas on the eighth and higher stages.

original: smin pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smin pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “knowledge of maturation.”

original: 'dis ni nye ba'i shes pa bstan te sa brgyad pa yan chad rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa sangs rgyas kyi @233a * //🔽sa dang nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni nye ba'i shes pa bstan te sa brgyad pa yan chad rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa sangs rgyas kyi @233a * // sa dang nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This shows the proximate knowledge. Because the eighth and higher stages are close to the buddha stage, which is nonconceptual and spontaneous.🔽“Nonmaturation” refers to the knowledge of bodhisattvas on the seventh stage and below.

original: ma smin pa zhes bya ba la sa bdun pa man chad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i shes pa la ma smin pa zhes bya'o //🔽'dis ni ring ba'i ma smin pa'i shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma smin pa zhes bya ba la sa bdun pa man chad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i shes pa la ma smin pa zhes bya'o // 'dis ni ring ba'i ma smin pa'i shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called “nonmaturation.”🔽This shows the distant nonmaturation knowledge.

original: 'dis ni ring ba'i shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ring ba'i shes pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the distant knowledge.

original: yang na mos pa spyod pa'i sa rnams kyi shes pa ni ma smin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na mos pa spyod pa'i sa rnams kyi shes pa ni ma smin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, the consciousness of the stages of devoted engagement is called unripened.

original: de'i tshe chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du ma gyur pa dang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang yang thag ring bas 'dis ni ring ba'i shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du ma gyur pa dang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang yang thag ring bas 'dis ni ring ba'i shes pa bstan to //
translated: At that time, the Dharma-element is not directly perceived and the stage of Buddhahood is far away. This shows distant consciousness.

original: sa dang po la zhugs pa yan chad kyi shes pa ni smin pa'i shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa dang po la zhugs pa yan chad kyi shes pa ni smin pa'i shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The consciousness of those who have entered the first stage and above is called ripened consciousness.

original: de la zhugs pa rnams kyis chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du byas pa dang / myur du 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de la zhugs pa rnams kyis chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du byas pa dang / myur du 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: Those who have entered it directly perceive the Dharma-element and will quickly become enlightened.

original: 'dis ni nye ba'i shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nye ba'i shes pa bstan to //
translated: This shows near consciousness.

original: yon tan gyi skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: yon tan gyi skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The section on the excellences is completed.🔽Two verses on the analysis of signs.

original: // / mtshan ma rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la de ltar gong du bshad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan yang /
analyzed: // / mtshan ma rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la de ltar gong du bshad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan yang /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who possesses the excellences explained above and is endowed with the excellence of excellences

original: dge ba sbed pa yin te /
analyzed: dge ba sbed pa yin te /
translated: conceals his virtue.

original: yon tan sgrogs su zin kyang gang na chu bya snang ba de na chu yod par mngon pa dang / gang na dud pa'i mtshan ma snang ba de na me yod par mngon par de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de dag la yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa lnga 'byung ste /
analyzed: yon tan sgrogs su zin kyang gang na chu bya snang ba de na chu yod par mngon pa dang / gang na dud pa'i mtshan ma snang ba de na me yod par mngon par de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de dag la yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa lnga 'byung ste /
translated: Even though their virtues are proclaimed, the presence of water is indicated by the presence of water birds, and the presence of fire is indicated by the presence of smoke. In the same way, five signs appear in the bodhisattvas that correspond to the six transcendences.

original: mtshan ma rnam pa lnga'i sgo nas 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes shes pas byang chub sems dpa'i grangs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma rnam pa lnga'i sgo nas 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes shes pas byang chub sems dpa'i grangs su 'gro ste /
translated: By means of these five signs, one can know that this is a bodhisattva, and so they are counted as bodhisattvas.

original: de'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by two verses.🔽Compassion, speaking well,

original: snying rje legs par smra ba dang // brtan pa lag brkyang ba dang // dgongs pa zab mo rnam par grol //
analyzed: snying rje legs par smra ba dang // brtan pa lag brkyang ba dang // dgongs pa zab mo rnam par grol //
translated: steadfastness, openhandedness,

original: mtshan ma 'di dag bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma 'di dag bstan pa'o //
translated: and profound intention are the five signs🔽of the bodhisattva.

original: zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' brtan pa rnams kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' brtan pa rnams kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The five aspects of the signs that are consistent with the six perfections are as follows:

original: snying rje dang ldan pa dang legs par smra ba dang ldan pa dang / brtan pa dang ldan pa dang / lag pa brkyang ba dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par 'grel ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pa dang legs par smra ba dang ldan pa dang / brtan pa dang ldan pa dang / lag pa brkyang ba dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par 'grel ba'o //
translated: the bodhisattva who is steadfast has compassion, speaks well, is courageous, is openhanded, and explains the profound intention.

original: chos de lnga yang rnam pa lngar bshad de /
analyzed: chos de lnga yang rnam pa lngar bshad de /
translated: These five qualities are explained in five ways:

original: rang bzhin dang rten dang 'bras bu'i rjes su bsngags pa dang / go rims dang bsdu bas @233b so ;
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rten dang 'bras bu'i rjes su bsngags pa dang / go rims dang bsdu bas @233b so ;
