original: de ltar 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye ba rnam pa bzhir bshad pa yang 'gro ba dang skye gnas tha dad pa dang / skyes pa rabs kyi sde'i bye brag gis skye ba mtha' yas pas te //
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye ba rnam pa bzhir bshad pa yang 'gro ba dang skye gnas tha dad pa dang / skyes pa rabs kyi sde'i bye brag gis skye ba mtha' yas pas te //
translated: Thus, although the four kinds of birth of the bodhisattvas have been explained, there are infinite kinds of birth, according to the different life-journeys and life-births, and according to the different kinds of Jataka tales.

original: skye ba de dag tshe na byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems dag pa chud du dang 'bring dang chen po la sogs pa'i rnam pas sems dag pa'i bye brag mang du 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye ba de dag tshe na byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems dag pa chud du dang 'bring dang chen po la sogs pa'i rnam pas sems dag pa'i bye brag mang du 'byung ste /
translated: In all those births, the bodhisattvas have many different kinds of pure thoughts, according to whether they are weak, middling, or strong, and so on.

original: de bas na skye ba'i rjes la sems rnam par dag pa dbye ba dus gnas pa'i sa ste sa bcu rnam par dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na skye ba'i rjes la sems rnam par dag pa dbye ba dus gnas pa'i sa ste sa bcu rnam par dbye ba bstan to //
translated: Therefore, after the discussion of birth, the text presents the classification of the stage of abiding, which is the purification of thought.

original: de la gnas pa nyid sa yin pas gnas pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pa nyid sa yin pas gnas pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is the very abode, it is called the abode stage.

original: dper na @240a * //
analyzed: dper na @240a * //
translated: For example,

original: sa'i steng na sems can dang sems can ma yin pa sna tshogs skye zhing gnas pa de bzhin du sems dag pa rab 'bring gi bye brag las kyang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad skye zhing 'byung bas na /
analyzed: sa'i steng na sems can dang sems can ma yin pa sna tshogs skye zhing gnas pa de bzhin du sems dag pa rab 'bring gi bye brag las kyang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad skye zhing 'byung bas na /
translated: just as various sentient and non-sentient beings are born and abide on the surface of the earth, likewise, due to the distinctions of superior, middling, and inferior mental purity, all mundane and supramundane qualities are born and arise.

original: sems dag pa'i khyad par nyid la sa bcu zhes bya bar zad do //
analyzed: sems dag pa'i khyad par nyid la sa bcu zhes bya bar zad do //
translated: Therefore, the distinctions of mental purity alone are simply called the ten stages.

original: sa bcu'i rnam par dbye ba yang mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa'i sgo rnam pa gnyis kyis bshad do //
analyzed: sa bcu'i rnam par dbye ba yang mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa'i sgo rnam pa gnyis kyis bshad do //
translated: The classification of the ten stages is explained in two ways: by brief indication and by extensive explanation.

original: de la mdor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: For the brief indication, it says:🔽The abode stage is just that,🔽due to the characteristics, persons, training,🔽aggregates, accomplishment, signs,

original: mtshan nyid gang zag bslab pa dang // phung po grub pa mtshan ma dang // nges pa'i tshig dang 'thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang zag bslab pa dang // phung po grub pa mtshan ma dang // nges pa'i tshig dang 'thob pa'i phyir /
translated: etymologies, and attainments.

original: gnas pa'i sa ni de nyid do //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /🔽gnas pa'i sa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa'i sa ni de nyid do //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /🔽gnas pa'i sa ste /
translated: The abode stage is just that.

original: sa bcu rnams ni don rnam par brgyad kyis bshad de /
analyzed: sa bcu rnams ni don rnam par brgyad kyis bshad de /
translated: The ten levels are explained by way of eight topics.

original: brgyad gang zhe na mtshan nyid dang / gang zag dang / bslab pa dang / phung po dang / grub pa dang / mtshan ma dang / nges pa'i tshig dang ; 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na mtshan nyid dang / gang zag dang / bslab pa dang / phung po dang / grub pa dang / mtshan ma dang / nges pa'i tshig dang ; 'thob pa ste /
translated: What are the eight? They are: characteristics, individuals, training, aggregates, accomplishment, signs, etymologies, and attainment.

original: don rnam pa brgyad po de nyid kyis sa bcu bstan cing bshad pa yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don rnam pa brgyad po de nyid kyis sa bcu bstan cing bshad pa yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The ten levels are taught and explained by way of just those eight topics.

original: mtshan nyid rnam par dbye ba las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa lnga'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par dbye ba las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa lnga'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five verses beginning with “The characteristics” are stated in terms of the analysis of the characteristics.

original: da 'di man chad zhib tu 'chad de /🔽dper na sa'i mtshan nyid sra ba dang / chu'i mtshan nyid gsher ba yin pa de bzhin du sa dang po'i mtshan nyid bstan pa nas /
analyzed: da 'di man chad zhib tu 'chad de / dper na sa'i mtshan nyid sra ba dang / chu'i mtshan nyid gsher ba yin pa de bzhin du sa dang po'i mtshan nyid bstan pa nas /
translated: Now, from here on, it is explained in detail.

original: sa bcu ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa phye ste bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa lnga rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa bcu ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa phye ste bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa lnga rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For example, just as solidity is the characteristic of earth and fluidity is the characteristic of water, in the same way, in order to teach the characteristics of the first level up to the characteristics of the tenth level, five verses are composed.

original: stong pa nyid mchog rtogs pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid mchog rtogs pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And the realization of the highest emptiness.

original: de las dang po'i mtshan nyid ni stong pa nyid mchog rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de las dang po'i mtshan nyid ni stong pa nyid mchog rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Here, the first stage is characterized by the realization of the highest emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid mchog ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid mchog ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'o //
translated: The highest emptiness is the selflessness of persons and things.

original: bdag med pa de gnyis sa dang po thob pa'i dus na rtogs pas na sa dang po ni stong pa nyid mchog rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhag go //
analyzed: bdag med pa de gnyis sa dang po thob pa'i dus na rtogs pas na sa dang po ni stong pa nyid mchog rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhag go //
translated: Since one realizes those two selflessnesses at the time of attaining the first stage, the first stage is posited as characterized by the realization of the highest emptiness.

original: de bas na sa dang po las kyang bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa rab tu brtan pa zhes gsungs pa dang / sems kyi stobs dang blo'i stobs kyis shin tu rnam par phye ba rnam par 'byed pa zhes gsungs pa dang / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa yin zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na sa dang po las kyang bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa rab tu brtan pa zhes gsungs pa dang / sems kyi stobs dang blo'i stobs kyis shin tu rnam par phye ba rnam par 'byed pa zhes gsungs pa dang / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa yin zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the first stage is also called the stage of firm thought and firm superior thought, the stage of thorough analysis and discernment by the power of mind and the power of intellect, and the stage of the realization of the equality of the three times.

original: de'i @240b don kyang gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pas bsam pa rab tu brtan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i @240b don kyang gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pas bsam pa rab tu brtan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of those is as follows: Since one realizes the selflessness of persons, it is called the stage of firm thought.

original: chos la bdag med par rtogs pas lhag pa'i bsam pa rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par rtogs pas lhag pa'i bsam pa rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And because of the realization of the selflessness of phenomena, it is called the realization of the highest intention.

original: yang gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'i shes pa dang ldan pas sems kyi stobs kyis shin tu rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'i shes pa dang ldan pas sems kyi stobs kyis shin tu rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, because of possessing the knowledge that realizes the selflessness of the person, it is called thoroughly discerning through the power of mind.

original: chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas blo'i stobs kyis shin tu rnam par phye ba rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas blo'i stobs kyis shin tu rnam par phye ba rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of possessing the wisdom that realizes the selflessness of phenomena, it is called thoroughly discerning through the power of intellect.

original: dus gsum gyi dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pas dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pas dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of realizing the three times to be equality, it is called the realization of the equality of the three times.

original: las rnams chud mi za bar gnas //
analyzed: las rnams chud mi za bar gnas //
translated: Karma does not perish.

original: zhes bya ba las gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid ni las rnams chud mi za bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhag ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba las gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid ni las rnams chud mi za bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhag ste /
translated: The defining characteristic of the second ground is that it is posited as the defining characteristic of karma not perishing.

original: ji ltar zhe nas sa gnyis pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe nas sa gnyis pa'i tshe /
translated: How is that?

original: las dge ba dang mi dag pa dang las de'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa las kyi rnam par smin pa yod par gzigs nas /
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dag pa dang las de'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa las kyi rnam par smin pa yod par gzigs nas /
translated: Having seen that there is the ripening of karma, that is, the happy and unhappy results of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma,

original: dus thams cad du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'ba' zhig la gnas kyi mi dge ba'i las kyi lam ni rmi lam na yang nye ba'i spyod do //
analyzed: dus thams cad du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'ba' zhig la gnas kyi mi dge ba'i las kyi lam ni rmi lam na yang nye ba'i spyod do //
translated: he always abides in the path of the ten virtues alone and does not engage in the path of nonvirtuous actions even in dreams.

original: de bas na sa gnyis pa ni las rnams kyis chud mi za ba'i mtshan nyid du gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas na sa gnyis pa ni las rnams kyis chud mi za ba'i mtshan nyid du gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the second ground is posited as the characteristic of the nonexpiration of karma.

original: de bas na sa gnyis pa la yang srog gcod pa las phyir ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sa gnyis pa la yang srog gcod pa las phyir ldog pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, on the second ground, he turns away from killing.

original: dbyig pa spangs mtshon cha spangs zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dbyig pa spangs mtshon cha spangs zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He abandons sticks, he abandons weapons, and so on.

original: de kun du rtog pa tsam gyis kyang /
analyzed: de kun du rtog pa tsam gyis kyang /
translated: Even with mere imagination,

original: sems can gzhan la 'tshe ba mi byed na /
analyzed: sems can gzhan la 'tshe ba mi byed na /
translated: he does not harm other sentient beings.

original: sems can gzhan dag la sems can du 'du shes shing ched du bsams shing lus kyi rnam pa 'tshe ba chen po bya ba lta ci smos zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / yang de ltar sems mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag la sems can du 'du shes shing ched du bsams shing lus kyi rnam pa 'tshe ba chen po bya ba lta ci smos zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / yang de ltar sems mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: And he accomplishes that thought in this way:

original: sems can rnams kyi ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang rnam par ltung ba yod pa gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang rnam par ltung ba yod pa gang yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever bad migrations, bad destinies, and falls there are for sentient beings,🔽all of them arise from the cause of taking up the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: de dag thams cad mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu las byung gi bdag gis ni 'di ltar bdag nyid yang dag par bsgrub pa la gnas te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu las byung gi bdag gis ni 'di ltar bdag nyid yang dag par bsgrub pa la gnas te /
translated: But I, having established myself in the practice of the perfections,

original: gzhan yang yang dag par bsgrub pa la dgod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //🔽mchog tu bde ba'i bsam gtan la //
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag par bsgrub pa la dgod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so // mchog tu bde ba'i bsam gtan la //
translated: will also establish others in the practice of the perfections.

original: bsgrubs nas @241a * //🔽de dag 'dod par skye //
analyzed: bsgrubs nas @241a * // de dag 'dod par skye //
translated: Having practiced the meditation of supreme bliss,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: they are born in the desire realm.

original: sa gsum pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i mchog tu bde ba'i bsam gtan bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: sa gsum pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i mchog tu bde ba'i bsam gtan bsgrubs nas /
translated: The third stage is characterized by the bodhisattva's attainment of the meditative concentration of supreme bliss,

original: bsam gtan de las kyang mnyam par bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan de las kyang mnyam par bya ste /
translated: and by his evenness in meditative concentration,

original: sems can gyi don du 'dod pa'i skye ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag go//
analyzed: sems can gyi don du 'dod pa'i skye ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag go//
translated: and by his taking birth in the desire realm for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de la mchog tu bde ba'i bsam gtan ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dag dang zag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: de la mchog tu bde ba'i bsam gtan ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dag dang zag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid la bya'o //
translated: Supreme bliss refers to the meditative concentrations of the form realm, the first, second, third, and fourth meditative concentrations, and to the undefiled meditative concentrations.

original: bsgrubs nas zhes bya ba ni de mngon sum du byas shing de thob par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrubs nas zhes bya ba ni de mngon sum du byas shing de thob par byas pa'o //
translated: Attainment means that he has actualized them and has attained them.

original: mnyam pa ni bsam gtan de dag med par ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa ni bsam gtan de dag med par ma gyur pa'o //
translated: Evenness means that he has not lost those meditative concentrations.

original: slar 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba ni sems can gyi don du 'dod pa'i khams kyi lus len pa'o //
analyzed: slar 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba ni sems can gyi don du 'dod pa'i khams kyi lus len pa'o //
translated: Taking birth in the desire realm means that he takes on a body in the desire realm for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de bas na sa gsum pa las kyang des de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes de ltar chad pa med pa yang dag par rjes su mthong ste /
analyzed: de bas na sa gsum pa las kyang des de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes de ltar chad pa med pa yang dag par rjes su mthong ste /
translated: Therefore, the third ground also says, “He sees that wisdom of the tathāgatas in that way without interruption.

original: 'du byed du gyur pa de ltar gnod pa mang po dang ldan pa yongs su rtogs pa na /
analyzed: 'du byed du gyur pa de ltar gnod pa mang po dang ldan pa yongs su rtogs pa na /
translated: When he realizes that compounded phenomena are like that, having many faults,

original: sems can rnams la de bas kyang shas cher sems kyi bsam pa bcu nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la de bas kyang shas cher sems kyi bsam pa bcu nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: he sets his mind on ten thoughts even more for sentient beings.

original: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the ten? They are as follows:

original: mgon med pa dang rten med pa'i sems can gyi bsam pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mgon med pa dang rten med pa'i sems can gyi bsam pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The thought of sentient beings who are without a protector and without a refuge, and so on, up to

original: chos de dag thos nas kyang rang gi sems la nges par rtogs nas gcig pu dben par song ste /
analyzed: chos de dag thos nas kyang rang gi sems la nges par rtogs nas gcig pu dben par song ste /
translated: having heard those dharmas, having realized them in his own mind, he goes to a solitary place

original: de ltar spyod do //
analyzed: de ltar spyod do //
translated: and practices in that way.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrubs pas /
translated: Having accomplished the dharma that accords with the dharma,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di dag khong du chud par bya ba'i tshig gi las yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin no snyam ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di dag khong du chud par bya ba'i tshig gi las yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin no snyam ste /
translated: he thinks, ‘I will not accomplish the realization of these buddhadharmas with just pure verbal activity alone.’

original: de chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa'i rgyur 'dod pa rnams las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: de chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa'i rgyur 'dod pa rnams las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: He is one who is detached from the unwholesome factors that are to be abandoned, who is endowed with investigation and analysis,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and who abides in the first meditative concentration that is accompanied by joy and pleasure which arises from detachment.

original: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par ldang ba gang du byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba mthong ba de ched du bsams te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par ldang ba gang du byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba mthong ba de ched du bsams te /
translated: He is one who sees the meditative absorption, the liberations, the concentrations, the attainments, and the emergence that will bring about the perfection of the factors for enlightenment.

original: smon lam btab pa'i dbang gis skye ba ma gtogs par de dag las kyi dbang gis mi skye'o zhes bya ba @241b gsungs so //
analyzed: smon lam btab pa'i dbang gis skye ba ma gtogs par de dag las kyi dbang gis mi skye'o zhes bya ba @241b gsungs so //
translated: Except for the case where he is reborn by the power of his aspirational prayers, he is not reborn by the power of his actions.

original: de nas byang chub phyogs rnams ni //
analyzed: de nas byang chub phyogs rnams ni //
translated: Then, with regard to the spiritual qualities that are conducive to enlightenment,

original: 'khor bar yongs su bsngo ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'khor bar yongs su bsngo ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: he dedicates them to samsara.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Then, the meaning of “after that” is “after the third stage has been accomplished.”

original: sa gsum pa bsgrub pa'i 'og tu sa bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes rab kyis byang chub kyi phyogs rnams mngon du byas la ;
analyzed: sa gsum pa bsgrub pa'i 'og tu sa bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes rab kyis byang chub kyi phyogs rnams mngon du byas la ;
translated: The characteristic of the fourth stage is that the bodhisattva, by means of his wisdom, realizes the factors of enlightenment,

original: snying rje chen po'i mtshan nyid kyis sems can gyi don du 'khor bar yongs su bsngo ba'i mtshan nyid du gzhag go //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i mtshan nyid kyis sems can gyi don du 'khor bar yongs su bsngo ba'i mtshan nyid du gzhag go //
translated: and by means of his great compassion, dedicates himself to the welfare of sentient beings in cyclic existence.

original: brgal ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs ni 'khor ba las 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu yin na /
analyzed: brgal ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs ni 'khor ba las 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu yin na /
translated: Objection: The factors of enlightenment are the cause of liberation from cyclic existence.

original: de nyid 'khor bar yongs su bsngo zhing 'khor ba'i rgyur ji ltar 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: de nyid 'khor bar yongs su bsngo zhing 'khor ba'i rgyur ji ltar 'gyur zhe na //
translated: How can they be the cause of cyclic existence, since they are dedicated to cyclic existence?

original: lan du dper na thabs kyis ma zin pa'i dug ni 'chi ba'i rgyur 'gyur la /
analyzed: lan du dper na thabs kyis ma zin pa'i dug ni 'chi ba'i rgyur 'gyur la /
translated: In response, it is just as poison becomes the cause of death when it is not treated with an antidote,🔽but becomes medicine when it is treated with an antidote.

original: thabs kyis zin pa'i dug ni sman du 'gyur ba de bzhin du thabs kyi mtshan nyid snying rje chen pos yongs su ma zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: thabs kyis zin pa'i dug ni sman du 'gyur ba de bzhin du thabs kyi mtshan nyid snying rje chen pos yongs su ma zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa ni /
translated: In the same way, the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment is not embraced by the characteristic of the method, great compassion.

original: 'khor ba las 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'khor ba las 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur la /
translated: It is the cause for emerging from cyclic existence.

original: snying rje chen po'i thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pa ni slar 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pa ni slar 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: But the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment, which are embraced by the method of great compassion, is the cause for being born again in cyclic existence.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' snying rje can 'khor ba la rgyab kyis lta ba de byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa yang snying rje'i dbang gis sems can gyi don bsgoms pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' snying rje can 'khor ba la rgyab kyis lta ba de byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa yang snying rje'i dbang gis sems can gyi don bsgoms pas /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who has compassion and turns his back on cyclic existence, by the power of compassion, cultivates the factors of enlightenment for the sake of sentient beings.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs de dag 'khor ba la rgyab kyis lta bar mi byed kyi 'khor ba la mngon du lta ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas 'khor bar yongs su bsngos pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs de dag 'khor ba la rgyab kyis lta bar mi byed kyi 'khor ba la mngon du lta ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas 'khor bar yongs su bsngos pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Since those factors of enlightenment do not turn their back on cyclic existence, they become the cause for facing cyclic existence. Therefore, they are explained as being dedicated to cyclic existence.

original: de bas na sa bzhi pa las kyang kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od 'phro ba can 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni kun du sbyor ba dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan par gyur nas /
analyzed: de bas na sa bzhi pa las kyang kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od 'phro ba can 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni kun du sbyor ba dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan par gyur nas /
translated: Therefore, the fourth ground also says, “O children of the victors! The bodhisattva who is on this bodhisattva ground, the Luminous, is endowed with the fetters, is watchful, and is endowed with mindfulness.

original: 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par spangs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par spangs te /
translated: He has abandoned worldly attachment and unhappiness.

original: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba can la gnas so zhes bya ba nas yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dben pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba can la gnas so zhes bya ba nas yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dben pa la gnas pa /
translated: He abides in observing the internal body and so on up to he meditates on right concentration, which is based on solitude,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa /
translated: based on detachment,

original: 'gog pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: 'gog pa la gnas pa /
translated: based on cessation,

original: rnam par byang bas yongs su bsgrubs pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: rnam par byang bas yongs su bsgrubs pa bsgom mo //
translated: and is accomplished by means of purification.

original: de dag kyang sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pas sngon smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pas nye bar brtan pa /
analyzed: de dag kyang sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pas sngon smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pas nye bar brtan pa /
translated: And since he has compassion for all sentient beings, he is firmly established in his previous aspirational prayers.

original: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba byams pa chen po dang ldan pa zhes @242a * //
analyzed: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba byams pa chen po dang ldan pa zhes @242a * //
translated: It is said, Having great compassion as a prerequisite, endowed with great love.

original: bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And also:

original: sems la nyon mongs med par yang //
analyzed: sems la nyon mongs med par yang //
translated: Even without afflictions in the mind,

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed //
translated: one ripens sentient beings.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: sa lnga pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems la nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: sa lnga pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems la nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: the characteristic of the fifth ground is established as the characteristic of a bodhisattva ripening sentient beings without afflictions in the mind.

original: sems la nyon mongs pa med pa ni sa de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgom zhing gnas pa med pas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas sems la mi gos pa'i phyir sems la nyon mongs pa med
analyzed: sems la nyon mongs pa med pa ni sa de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgom zhing gnas pa med pas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas sems la mi gos pa'i phyir sems la nyon mongs pa med
translated: Without afflictions in the mind means that on this ground, by cultivating and abiding in the four noble truths, one possesses the antidotes to the afflictions, so one's mind is not tainted by afflictions such as attachment, and thus there are no afflictions in the mind.

original: do // gtsug lag dang bzo'i las rnam pa sna tshogs la mkhas te /
analyzed: do // gtsug lag dang bzo'i las rnam pa sna tshogs la mkhas te /
translated: One is skilled in various arts and crafts.

original: de bas na mkhas pa des theg pa gsum gyi rigs can gyi sems can yongs su smin par yang gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas na mkhas pa des theg pa gsum gyi rigs can gyi sems can yongs su smin par yang gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the wise one also establishes sentient beings who have the lineage of the three vehicles in complete maturity.🔽Therefore, the fifth ground also says:

original: de bas na sa lnga pa las kyang de dran pa dang blo gros dang / rtogs pa'i blo'i stobs bskyed pas yid la bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na sa lnga pa las kyang de dran pa dang blo gros dang / rtogs pa'i blo'i stobs bskyed pas yid la bya ba'i phyir /
translated: By generating the power of mindfulness, intelligence, and the mind of realization,

original: mi ldog par gyur nas /
analyzed: mi ldog par gyur nas /
translated: having become irreversible,

original: des 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: des 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: he knows just as it is: this is the truth of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / khyad par can gyi chos yongs su btsal ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / khyad par can gyi chos yongs su btsal ba la /
translated: And so forth, and in the investigation of the special Dharma,

original: mngon par brtson pas de gang 'di'i 'jig rten na yi ge dang gtsug lag dang rtsis dang khrims thabs la sogs pa yod pa de dag mngon par bsgrub po //
analyzed: mngon par brtson pas de gang 'di'i 'jig rten na yi ge dang gtsug lag dang rtsis dang khrims thabs la sogs pa yod pa de dag mngon par bsgrub po //
translated: By being diligent, he accomplishes whatever exists in the world, such as letters, scriptures, mathematics, and legal procedures.

original: 'byung khung gi dpyad dang / gso ba'i dpyad dang / skem pa dang brjed byed dang 'byung po'i gdon bsal ba dang / dug dang ro langs kyi sbyor ba bsal ba dang / sngags dang / gar dang / gtam dang / rol mo dang sgrung gtam gyis rab tu dga' bar bya ba zhes bya ba nas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba yod par gyur pa de dag snying rje dang ldan pas mthar gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir mngon par🔽sgrub pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'byung khung gi dpyad dang / gso ba'i dpyad dang / skem pa dang brjed byed dang 'byung po'i gdon bsal ba dang / dug dang ro langs kyi sbyor ba bsal ba dang / sngags dang / gar dang / gtam dang / rol mo dang sgrung gtam gyis rab tu dga' bar bya ba zhes bya ba nas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba yod par gyur pa de dag snying rje dang ldan pas mthar gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir mngon par sgrub pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: He accomplishes whatever is beneficial and pleasant for all sentient beings, such as the analysis of elements, the analysis of medicine, the removal of epilepsy and forgetfulness, the removal of poison and zombie spells, mantras, dance, conversation, music, and storytelling, in order to gradually establish them in the Buddha's teachings out of compassion.

original: bsams bzhin du ni skye ba dang // kun nas nyon mongs rjes su srung //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du ni skye ba dang // kun nas nyon mongs rjes su srung //
translated: He is born intentionally, and protects those who are afflicted.

original: @242b zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @242b zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa drag pa'i mtshan nyid ni bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rjes su srung ba'i mtshan nyid du gzhag ste /🔽sa drug pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gyi don du khams gsum du skye ba nas las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis rang dbang med par skye ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa drag pa'i mtshan nyid ni bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rjes su srung ba'i mtshan nyid du gzhag ste / sa drug pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gyi don du khams gsum du skye ba nas las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis rang dbang med par skye ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The sixth level is called the “manifest” because it is the level on which the bodhisattva manifests the attributes of a universal monarch.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen pos zin pas /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen pos zin pas /
translated: The seventh level is called the “far-reaching” because it is the level on which the bodhisattva reaches the far shore of the perfection of transcendent wisdom.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin ma nyams par gang nas gang du skye ba de dang der /🔽'di dang 'dir skye bar bya'o zhes shes bzhin du skye bas na /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin ma nyams par gang nas gang du skye ba de dang der / 'di dang 'dir skye bar bya'o zhes shes bzhin du skye bas na /
translated: The eighth level is called the “immovable” because it is the level on which the bodhisattva is unmoved by the two extremes.

original: bsams bzhin du skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The ninth level is called the “excellent wisdom” because it is the level on which the bodhisattva’s wisdom becomes preeminent.🔽The tenth level is called the “cloud of Dharma” because it is the level on which the bodhisattva’s gnosis pervades the sky of the Great Vehicle’s teachings and covers the entire earth of the disciples to be trained.🔽The bodhisattva levels are presented as ten in number because they are the foundation for the ten transcendent perfections.

original: de ltar bsams bzhin du skye ba na yang rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bsgom pa na mang du gnas pas nyon mongs pas mi gos pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa rjes su srung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsams bzhin du skye ba na yang rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bsgom pa na mang du gnas pas nyon mongs pas mi gos pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa rjes su srung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: And when he is born in accordance with his intention, he is called “one who protects the afflictions” because he remains for a long time in order to meditate on dependent origination and is not sullied by the afflictions.

original: de bas na sa drug pa las kyang ;
analyzed: de bas na sa drug pa las kyang ;
translated: Thus, the sixth ground is called “The Manifest,”

original: de chos thams cad la rang gzhan de ltar rtog pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de chos thams cad la rang gzhan de ltar rtog pa'i tshe /
translated: because when he thus investigates all phenomena,🔽he is motivated by great compassion,

original: de bas kyang snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba dang / snying rje chen po'i dbang bsgyur ba dang / snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas kyang snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba dang / snying rje chen po'i dbang bsgyur ba dang / snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: he is governed by great compassion, and he is intent on perfecting great compassion.

original: 'jig rten 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la rnam par lta'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la rnam par lta'o //
translated: He sees the world arising and passing away.

original: 'jig rten 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la lta ba'i tshe 'di snyam ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la lta ba'i tshe 'di snyam ste /
translated: When he sees the world arising and passing away, he thinks:

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad skye ba ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad skye ba ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung ste /
translated: “All the worldly conventions of arising that exist arise from the manifest clinging to a self.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang bral na 'byung ba gang yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang bral na 'byung ba gang yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is free from the manifest clinging to a self, then no origination will occur.

original: byis pa'i blo can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa mi shes pa'i rab rib kyis bsgribs pa yod pa dang med pa la mngon par mos pa /
analyzed: byis pa'i blo can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa mi shes pa'i rab rib kyis bsgribs pa yod pa dang med pa la mngon par mos pa /
translated: Those who have the mind of a child, who are obscured by the cataract of ignorance, who are attached to existence and non-existence,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung ba /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung ba /
translated: who have arisen from improper mental attention,

original: yang dag pa ma yin par rab tu zhugs pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par rab tu zhugs pa /
translated: who have entered into what is not real,

original: log pa'i rjes su 'brang ba de dag ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed nye bar sogs te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: log pa'i rjes su 'brang ba de dag ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed nye bar sogs te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: who follow what is false, they accumulate meritorious, non-meritorious, and unshakable actions, and so on.

original: 'du byed dang rgyu rkyen ldan pa 'di dag rgyun gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed dang rgyu rkyen ldan pa 'di dag rgyun gcad par bya'o //
translated: They should cut off these actions and their causes and conditions.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'du byed rnams shin tu zhi ba yang mngon du mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //🔽mtshan ma med pa phyogs @243a * //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'du byed rnams shin tu zhi ba yang mngon du mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so // mtshan ma med pa phyogs @243a * //
translated: But in order to ripen sentient beings, they should not manifest the pacification of actions.🔽The signless is the one-sided path,

original: gcig lam / bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang 'brel //
analyzed: gcig lam / bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang 'brel //
translated: connected with the path of one practice.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bdun pa'i mtshan nyid ni bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang 'brel zhing mtshan ma med pa la phyogs gcig gi lam gyi mtshan nyid du bzhag go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bdun pa'i mtshan nyid ni bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang 'brel zhing mtshan ma med pa la phyogs gcig gi lam gyi mtshan nyid du bzhag go //
translated: The seventh stage of the bodhisattva is connected with the path of single progress and is posited as the path of single aspect with regard to signlessness.

original: de la 'grod pa gcig pa ni sa brgyad pa la bya ste /🔽sa brgyad pa'i dus na bar 'ga' brtsal 'bad dang bcas /
analyzed: de la 'grod pa gcig pa ni sa brgyad pa la bya ste / sa brgyad pa'i dus na bar 'ga' brtsal 'bad dang bcas /
translated: The path of single progress is to be understood as the eighth stage.

original: bar 'ga' brtsal 'bad med par gnas pa ma yin gyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la lhun gyis grub pa 'ba' zhig tu gnas pas na /
analyzed: bar 'ga' brtsal 'bad med par gnas pa ma yin gyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la lhun gyis grub pa 'ba' zhig tu gnas pas na /
translated: At the time of the eighth stage, one does not abide sometimes with exertion and sometimes without exertion, but abides only spontaneously in nonconceptual concentration.

original: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the path of single progress.

original: sa bdun pa ni sa brgyad pa lta bur gnas te /
analyzed: sa bdun pa ni sa brgyad pa lta bur gnas te /
translated: The seventh stage is like the eighth stage.

original: sa bdun pa'i rjes las brgyad pa thob pas na /
analyzed: sa bdun pa'i rjes las brgyad pa thob pas na /
translated: After the seventh stage, the eighth is attained.

original: sa bdun pa de bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang 'brel pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bdun pa de bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang 'brel pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the seventh stage is said to be connected with the path of single progress.

original: sa bdun pa'i dus na mdo la sogs pa'i chos mang po la mtshan ma tha dad par mi byed de /
analyzed: sa bdun pa'i dus na mdo la sogs pa'i chos mang po la mtshan ma tha dad par mi byed de /
translated: At the time of the seventh stage, one does not make different signs of many dharmas such as sūtras.

original: mdo sde thams cad kyi don kyang mtshan nyid gcig pa yin pa kho nar rtag tu dmigs pas na sa bdun pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i phyogs gcig pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde thams cad kyi don kyang mtshan nyid gcig pa yin pa kho nar rtag tu dmigs pas na sa bdun pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i phyogs gcig pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: And since the meaning of all the sūtras is always observed to be of one characteristic, the seventh bhūmi is called the path of the one-pointed aspect of signlessness.

original: de la bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang 'brel pa'i don kyang sa bdun pa nyid las /
analyzed: de la bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang 'brel pa'i don kyang sa bdun pa nyid las /
translated: The meaning of being connected to the path of single progress is also from the same text, the Sūtra of the Ten Stages:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
translated: O son of the victors! It is like this.

original: dper na kun nas nyon mongs shing rnam par dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / shin tu dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar ni smon lam dang thabs dang shes rab dang mngon par shes pa'i stobs dang /🔽shugs chen po ma gtogs par 'dod 'dod brgal bar mi nus so //
analyzed: dper na kun nas nyon mongs shing rnam par dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / shin tu dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar ni smon lam dang thabs dang shes rab dang mngon par shes pa'i stobs dang / shugs chen po ma gtogs par 'dod 'dod brgal bar mi nus so //
translated: For example, between the world system of complete affliction and the world system of complete purification, it is impossible to cross from one to the other except by the power of great aspiration, method, wisdom, and superknowledge.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'dres pa dang yongs su dag pa'i bar yang /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'dres pa dang yongs su dag pa'i bar yang /
translated: O son of the victors! In the same way, between the mixed and completely pure bodhisattva conduct, it is impossible to cross from one to the other except by the power of great aspiration, method, wisdom, and superknowledge.

original: smon lam dang / thabs dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes kyi stobs dang / shugs chen po ma gtogs par 'dod 'dod brgal bar mi nus so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: smon lam dang / thabs dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes kyi stobs dang / shugs chen po ma gtogs par 'dod 'dod brgal bar mi nus so zhes gsungs so //
translated: except for the power of great speed of aspiration, method, wisdom, superknowledge, and gnosis.

original: mtshan ma med pa la phyogs gcig pa'i don kyang sa bdun pa nyid las /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la phyogs gcig pa'i don kyang sa bdun pa nyid las /
translated: The meaning of the one-sided signlessness is also taught in the seventh ground itself:

original: de ltar sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: Thus, when abiding in the seventh ground,

original: lus kyi las tshad med pa mtshan ma @243b dang bral bar rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lus kyi las tshad med pa mtshan ma @243b dang bral bar rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: immeasurable physical actions free from signs arise.

original: ngag gi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral bar rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ngag gi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral bar rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: Immeasurable verbal actions free from signs arise.

original: yid kyi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral ba shin tu rnam par sbyangs pa mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pas snang bar gyur pa tshad med pa rab tu 'byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yid kyi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral ba shin tu rnam par sbyangs pa mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pas snang bar gyur pa tshad med pa rab tu 'byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Immeasurable mental actions free from signs, purified, illuminated by the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena, arise.

original: mtshan med lhun gyis grub pa ni //
analyzed: mtshan med lhun gyis grub pa ni //
translated: Spontaneously present signlessness

original: zhing yang rnam par sbyong ba ste //
analyzed: zhing yang rnam par sbyong ba ste //
translated: is the purification of the buddha realm.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma med pa la yang lhun gyis grub ste mngon par 'du bya ba med par mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma med pa la yang lhun gyis grub ste mngon par 'du bya ba med par mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is defined as the purification of the buddha field.

original: de la sa brgyad pa'i dus na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin lhun gyis grub pa la gnas te /
analyzed: de la sa brgyad pa'i dus na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin lhun gyis grub pa la gnas te /
translated: At the time of the eighth stage, one remains in the spontaneous presence of nonconceptual concentration.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: When one remains in nonconceptual concentration,

original: brtsal 'bad kyi bag cung zad kyang mi 'byung bas na /
analyzed: brtsal 'bad kyi bag cung zad kyang mi 'byung bas na /
translated: not the slightest trace of effort occurs.

original: mtshan ma med pa la lhun gyis grub cing mngon par 'du bya ba med par mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la lhun gyis grub cing mngon par 'du bya ba med par mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one is spontaneously present in the absence of attributes and remains in the absence of attributes without any deliberate effort.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gser dang shel la sogs pa'i kha dog lta bur snang bar sbyong bas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gser dang shel la sogs pa'i kha dog lta bur snang bar sbyong bas na /
translated: Since one purifies the buddha field so that it appears as the color of gold, crystal, and so forth,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is also called the purification of the buddha-field.

original: de bas na sa brgyad pa nyid las kyang mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa'i don kyang /
analyzed: de bas na sa brgyad pa nyid las kyang mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa'i don kyang /
translated: Therefore, in the eighth ground itself, the meaning of effortless signlessness is also taught.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de lta bu'i bzod pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba thob ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa'i gnas zab mo shes par dka' ba ma 'dres pa mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de lta bu'i bzod pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba thob ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa'i gnas zab mo shes par dka' ba ma 'dres pa mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba
translated: O sons of the Victorious Ones, a bodhisattva who possesses such acceptance, as soon as he attains the bodhisattva ground Immovable, will attain the profound abode of the bodhisattva, which is difficult to know, unshared, free from all signs,🔽turned away from all grasping at discriminations,

original: / 'du shes kyi 'dzin pa thams cad las phyir log pa tshad med pa /
analyzed: / 'du shes kyi 'dzin pa thams cad las phyir log pa tshad med pa /
translated: incalculable,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa dben pa /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa dben pa /
translated: unshakable by all hearers and solitary realizers, isolated,

original: dben pa thams cad mngon du gyur pa thob pa yin te /
analyzed: dben pa thams cad mngon du gyur pa thob pa yin te /
translated: and he will attain the actualization of all isolations.🔽O sons of the Victorious Ones, it is like this.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: For example,

original: dge slong rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dge slong rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa /
translated: a monk who possesses miraculous powers

original: sems can thams cad la dbang thob pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la dbang thob pa /
translated: and has attained mastery over all sentient beings

original: mthar gyis 'gog pa'i bar du mnyam par gzhag pa ni rgyu ba dang sems pa dang / g-yo ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / 'du shes thams cad dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: mthar gyis 'gog pa'i bar du mnyam par gzhag pa ni rgyu ba dang sems pa dang / g-yo ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / 'du shes thams cad dang bral ba yin no //
translated: And from the first concentration up to the cessation of discriminations and feelings, he is free from all movement, thought, and discrimination.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang /🔽byang @244a * //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang / byang @244a * //
translated: “O sons of the conquerors, in the same way, the bodhisattva,🔽as soon as he has attained this eighth bodhisattva stage,

original: chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa 'di thob ma thag tu ched du bya ba thams cad dang bral te /
analyzed: chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa 'di thob ma thag tu ched du bya ba thams cad dang bral te /
translated: is free from all deliberate effort.

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i chos nyid thob cing lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rtsol ba thams cad dang bral te /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i chos nyid thob cing lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rtsol ba thams cad dang bral te /
translated: He has attained the spontaneous stage and is free from all effort of body, speech, and mind.

original: rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid la gnas pa yin /
translated: He abides in the stage of the maturation of the Dharma.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
translated: “O sons of the conquerors, it is as follows:

original: mi la la zhig gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam du /🔽bdag chu klung chen pos khyer ba snyam byed la /
analyzed: mi la la zhig gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam du / bdag chu klung chen pos khyer ba snyam byed la /
translated: Suppose a man, while asleep and dreaming,🔽were to dream that he was carried away by a great river.

original: de de nas ci phyir snyam du 'bad cing rtsol ba chen po rtsom pa las /
analyzed: de de nas ci phyir snyam du 'bad cing rtsol ba chen po rtsom pa las /
translated: And he would think, ‘Why is this happening to me?’ and would make great efforts and struggle.

original: de 'bad cing rtsol ba chen po de nyid kyis sad par gyur na /
analyzed: de 'bad cing rtsol ba chen po de nyid kyis sad par gyur na /
translated: When he is awakened by that very great effort and exertion,

original: de sad ma thag tu 'bad cing rtsol ba thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sad ma thag tu 'bad cing rtsol ba thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: immediately upon awakening he is free from all effort and exertion.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang nyon mongs pa'i chu klung chen po bzhir sems can mang po drang bar sems nas /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang nyon mongs pa'i chu klung chen po bzhir sems can mang po drang bar sems nas /
translated: “O sons of the victors, in the same way, bodhisattvas, in order to lead many sentient beings across the four great rivers of the afflictions,

original: 'bad cing rtsol ba yongs su rtsom mo //
analyzed: 'bad cing rtsol ba yongs su rtsom mo //
translated: strive and exert themselves.

original: de brtson 'grus chen po dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba thob ma thag tu ched du bya ba thams cad dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: de brtson 'grus chen po dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba thob ma thag tu ched du bya ba thams cad dang bral ba yin te /
translated: Endowed with great diligence, as soon as they attain the bodhisattva ground Immovable, they are free from all deliberate actions.

original: de gnyis po rgyu ba'am mtshan ma'i rgyu ba dag kyang thams cad kyi thams cad du mi snang bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de gnyis po rgyu ba'am mtshan ma'i rgyu ba dag kyang thams cad kyi thams cad du mi snang bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Both the movement of the two and the movement of signs do not appear at all.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'i don kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'i don kyang /
translated: With regard to the meaning of purifying a buddhafield,

original: sa brgyad pa nyid las skye ba mngon par bsgrub pa tshad med pa dang / zhing yongs su sbyong ba tshad med pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba tshad med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa nyid las skye ba mngon par bsgrub pa tshad med pa dang / zhing yongs su sbyong ba tshad med pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba tshad med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The eighth level itself is described as the accomplishment of immeasurable births, the purification of immeasurable realms, the maturation of immeasurable sentient beings, and so on.

original: sems can smin par 'grub pa yang //🔽de dag phan chad skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can smin par 'grub pa yang // de dag phan chad skye bar 'gyur //
translated: The accomplishment of the maturation of sentient beings

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: arises beyond that.

original: de dag phan chad ces bya ba ni sa brgyad pa phan chad ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de dag phan chad ces bya ba ni sa brgyad pa phan chad ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: Beyond that means beyond the eighth level.

original: sa brgyad pa phan chad /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa phan chad /
translated: Beyond the eighth level,

original: sa brgyad pa 'das nas sa dgu pa'i mtshan nyid ni sems can yongs su smin pa 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhag ste /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa 'das nas sa dgu pa'i mtshan nyid ni sems can yongs su smin pa 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhag ste /
translated: the characteristic of the ninth level is posited as the characteristic of the accomplishment of the maturation of sentient beings.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sa dgu pa thob pa na chos dang don dang nges pa'i chig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pas /
analyzed: sa dgu pa thob pa na chos dang don dang nges pa'i chig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pas /
translated: When one attains the ninth level, one obtains the four correct and discerning awarenesses of phenomena, meaning, etymological definition and confidence.

original: chos bshad pa la thogs pa med pa'i phyir sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i mthu dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos bshad pa la thogs pa med pa'i phyir sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i mthu dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Because he is unimpeded in teaching the Dharma, he has the power to bring beings to full maturity.

original: de bas na dgu pa nyid las kyang byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros can 'di la gnas pa'i @244b byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni chos smra ba chen po byed cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mdzod srung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na dgu pa nyid las kyang byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros can 'di la gnas pa'i @244b byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni chos smra ba chen po byed cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mdzod srung ngo //
translated: Therefore, in the ninth stage itself, the bodhisattva who is on this stage, Excellent Wisdom, is a great Dharma teacher and guardian of the Tathagata's treasury of the Dharma.

original: de chos smra ba'i tshul dang ldan pas ye shes la mkhas pa tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de chos smra ba'i tshul dang ldan pas ye shes la mkhas pa tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he is endowed with the method of a Dharma teacher and with immeasurable skill in wisdom,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshigs so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis mngon par bsgrubs pas chos ston to //🔽de chos so so yang dag par rig pas chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshigs so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis mngon par bsgrubs pas chos ston to // de chos so so yang dag par rig pas chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: he teaches the Dharma by means of the four kinds of perfect knowledge of the bodhisattva.🔽By means of the perfect knowledge of the Dharma, he knows the individual characteristics of phenomena.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pas chos rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba rab tu shes so //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pas chos rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba rab tu shes so //
translated: By means of the perfect knowledge of meaning, he knows the classification of phenomena.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pas chos rnams ma 'dres par bstan pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pas chos rnams ma 'dres par bstan pa rab tu shes so //
translated: Through the correct understanding of the etymologies, one knows how to teach the Dharmas without confusing them.

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pas chos rnams kyi mthun pa'i rgyun mi 'chad pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //🔽ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pas chos rnams kyi mthun pa'i rgyun mi 'chad pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so // ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Through the correct understanding of eloquence, one knows how to teach the Dharmas in a continuous manner.🔽The ten bodhisattva stages are characterized by the doors of meditative concentration and the doors of mnemonic spells.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa'i mtshan nyid ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhag go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa'i mtshan nyid ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhag go //
translated: The ten bodhisattva stages are characterized by the doors of meditative concentration and the doors of mnemonic spells.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dri ma med pa zhes bya ba dang / theg pa chen po snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dri ma med pa zhes bya ba dang / theg pa chen po snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Meditative concentration is such as the bodhisattva’s meditative concentration called “stainless” and “illuminating the great vehicle.”

original: ting nge 'dzin de dag kyang mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan mang po 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pas na sgo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de dag kyang mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan mang po 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pas na sgo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: These meditative concentrations are called “doors” because they are the cause for the arising of many qualities such as the superknowledges.

original: gzungs ni mi zad pa'i za ma tog dang / sgo mtha' yas kyi gzungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzungs ni mi zad pa'i za ma tog dang / sgo mtha' yas kyi gzungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The dhāraṇīs are called the inexhaustible casket and the dhāraṇī of infinite doors.

original: gzungs de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bshad pa'i don dang tshig mi brjed par 'dzin pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / sems can la chos rnam pa sna tshogs ston pa'i rgyur gyur pas na sgo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzungs de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bshad pa'i don dang tshig mi brjed par 'dzin pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / sems can la chos rnam pa sna tshogs ston pa'i rgyur gyur pas na sgo zhes bya ste /
translated: These dhāraṇīs are called doors because they are the cause for the tathāgatas to retain without forgetting the meaning and words of the Dharma they have explained and because they are the cause for them to teach various aspects of the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: sa dang po'i dus na ting nge 'dzin dag pa dang gzungs dag pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhag go //
analyzed: sa dang po'i dus na ting nge 'dzin dag pa dang gzungs dag pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhag go //
translated: They are posited as the characteristics of attaining the purity of samādhi and the purity of dhāraṇī at the time of the first bhūmi.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin dag pa thob pa yang /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin dag pa thob pa yang /
translated: Attaining the purity of samādhi.

original: sa bcu pa nyid las ;
analyzed: sa bcu pa nyid las ;
translated: The Ten Grounds itself says:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa' ye shes de lta bu dang ldan zhing dbang bskur ba thob pa de la byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dri ma med pa zhes bya ba mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa' ye shes de lta bu dang ldan zhing dbang bskur ba thob pa de la byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dri ma med pa zhes bya ba mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “O children of the Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva who possesses such wisdom and has attained the consecration will actualize the bodhisattva’s samādhi called stainless.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin da ltar byung ba'i sangs @245a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin da ltar byung ba'i sangs @245a * //
translated: The bodhisattva meditative stabilization called “the present buddhas standing in front” becomes manifest.

original: rgyas mngon sum du bzhugs pa zhes bya ba mngon du 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyas mngon sum du bzhugs pa zhes bya ba mngon du 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: gzungs kyi sgo dag pa thob pa yang sa bcu ba nyid las /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo dag pa thob pa yang sa bcu ba nyid las /
translated: The attainment of the purity of the dhāraṇī-gate is also on the tenth stage itself.

original: sa bcu pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo de dag la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo brgya stong grangs med pa dpag tu med par rab tu 'thob po //
analyzed: sa bcu pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo de dag la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo brgya stong grangs med pa dpag tu med par rab tu 'thob po //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this tenth stage attains countless hundreds of thousands of gates of liberation, such as these gates of bodhisattva liberation.

original: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin brgya stong dang / gzungs brgya stong 'thob po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin brgya stong dang / gzungs brgya stong 'thob po zhes gsungs so //
translated: And so on. He attains hundreds of thousands of meditative stabilizations and hundreds of thousands of dhāraṇīs.

original: byang chub nyid kyang rnam par dag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub nyid kyang rnam par dag / ces bya ba la /
translated: And enlightenment itself is pure.

original: sa bcu gcig pa ste sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni byang chub rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sa bcu gcig pa ste sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni byang chub rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: On the eleventh stage, the Buddha stage, enlightenment is established as having the characteristic of purity.

original: de la zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes la byang chub ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes la byang chub ces bya ste /
translated: Enlightenment is the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag la nyal phra mo tshun chad kyang dag pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag la nyal phra mo tshun chad kyang dag pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: At the time of the Buddha stage, it is defined as the purification of the subtle latent states of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de bas na 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the noble Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang pos zhus pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang pos zhus pa /
translated: The noble Avalokitêśvara asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das gnas ngan len rab tu spangs pa dus bag la nyal ba 'di dag rab tu phye //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gnas ngan len rab tu spangs pa dus bag la nyal ba 'di dag rab tu phye //
translated: “Bhagavan, how many types of latent states of negative tendencies are there?”

original: spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po rnam pa gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po rnam pa gnyis kyis te /
translated: “Avalokitêśvara, there are two types:

original: shun pa la yod pa'i gnas ngan len spangs nas dang po dang gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: shun pa la yod pa'i gnas ngan len spangs nas dang po dang gnyis pa'o //
translated: those that are eliminated by the first and second stages, the latent states of negative tendencies that exist in the bark;

original: srid la yod pas ni gsum pa yan chad do //
analyzed: srid la yod pas ni gsum pa yan chad do //
translated: those that exist in the sapwood are eliminated on the third stage and above.

original: snying po la yong ba'i gnas ngan len rab tu spangs pa de ni bag la nyal thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: snying po la yong ba'i gnas ngan len rab tu spangs pa de ni bag la nyal thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa'i gnas te /
translated: The elimination of the latent states of negative tendencies that exist in the heartwood is the state of the complete absence of all latent states.

original: ngas sangs rgyas kyi sar bshad do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ngas sangs rgyas kyi sar bshad do zhes gsungs so //
translated: I explain it as the level of buddhahood.

original: rnam par gzhag pa de dag las //🔽sa yi mtshan nyid shes par bya //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa de dag las // sa yi mtshan nyid shes par bya //
translated: From among those presentations,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: one should know the characteristics of the levels.

original: gong du sa dang po ni stong pa nyid mchog rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag pa nas /
analyzed: gong du sa dang po ni stong pa nyid mchog rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag pa nas /
translated: In the above, the first level is presented as having the characteristic of realizing the supreme emptiness,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni byang chub nyid rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni byang chub nyid rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: and the level of buddhahood is presented as having the characteristic of the purity of enlightenment itself.

original: rnam par gzhag pa de dag las /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa de dag las /
translated: From among those presentations,

original: sa bcu'i mtshan nyid de 'dra bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa bcu'i mtshan nyid de 'dra bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one should know that the characteristics of the ten levels are like that.🔽One should know that actions do not disappear,

original: las rnams chung mi za bar gzhag ste zhes bya ba la sa gnyis pa'i tshe las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / de'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal @245b ba la sogs pa ji ltar smin cing skye ba yang thugs su chud la /
analyzed: las rnams chung mi za bar gzhag ste zhes bya ba la sa gnyis pa'i tshe las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / de'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal @245b ba la sogs pa ji ltar smin cing skye ba yang thugs su chud la /
translated: at the time of the second level, one understands how virtuous and nonvirtuous actions and their results, such as happiness and suffering, ripen and arise.

original: de ltar thugs su chud pas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'ba' zhig na gnas kyi /
analyzed: de ltar thugs su chud pas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'ba' zhig na gnas kyi /
translated: And by understanding that, one abides only in the path of the ten virtues.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las cung zad kyang mi 'dzad pas na las rnams chud mi za bar gzhag go //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las cung zad kyang mi 'dzad pas na las rnams chud mi za bar gzhag go //
translated: Since even the slightest of the ten nonvirtuous actions is not exhausted, karma should be posited as not wasted.

original: yongs su mi 'bri bar zhes bya ba la gzugs kyi bsam gtan thob pa las ma nyams par byas nas bsam gtan thob pa'i 'bras bu gzugs kyi khams su skye bar mi byed kyi sems can gyi don du slar 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su mi 'bri bar zhes bya ba la gzugs kyi bsam gtan thob pa las ma nyams par byas nas bsam gtan thob pa'i 'bras bu gzugs kyi khams su skye bar mi byed kyi sems can gyi don du slar 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'o //
translated: Not diminishing means that having attained the dhyanas of form and not degenerating them, one does not take birth in the form realm as a result of attaining dhyana but instead takes birth in the desire realm for the sake of sentient beings.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams 'khor bar yongs su bsngo ba'o zhes bya ba la //🔽snying rje chen pos zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa ni 'khor ba las 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams 'khor bar yongs su bsngo ba'o zhes bya ba la // snying rje chen pos zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa ni 'khor ba las 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur gyi /
translated: The perfection of the factors of enlightenment is the dedication of samsara.🔽The cultivation of the factors of enlightenment that are embraced by great compassion becomes the cause for emerging from samsara.

original: snying rje chen pos yongs su zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig gi rgyur 'gyur bar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: snying rje chen pos yongs su zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig gi rgyur 'gyur bar ma zad kyi /
translated: The cultivation of the factors of enlightenment that are embraced by great compassion is not only the cause for mere nirvana.

original: 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyur yang 'gyur bas na 'khor bar yongs su bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyur yang 'gyur bas na 'khor bar yongs su bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “dedication to samsara” because it becomes the cause for birth in samsara.

original: bdag nyid kyi sems kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sems kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “One’s mind is completely free from defilement” means

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsam pa ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin te /🔽sa lnga pa'i dus na yang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgom pa la mang du gnas pas na sems can gyi don du 'khor ba na gnas kyang nyon mongs pas gos par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsam pa ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin te / sa lnga pa'i dus na yang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgom pa la mang du gnas pas na sems can gyi don du 'khor ba na gnas kyang nyon mongs pas gos par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: that the contemplation of the four noble truths is the antidote to the afflictions.

original: bdag nyid kyi sems kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sems kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one dwells a great deal in the contemplation of the four noble truths even at the time of the fifth ground, one’s mind is completely free from defilement because one dwells in samsara for the sake of sentient beings but is not sullied by the afflictions.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed cing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed cing zhes bya ba la /
translated: “One brings sentient beings to full maturity” means

original: sa lnga pa la gtsug lag dang bzo sna tshogs la mkhas pas /
analyzed: sa lnga pa la gtsug lag dang bzo sna tshogs la mkhas pas /
translated: that, on the fifth ground, one is skilled in the various arts and crafts.

original: de'i sgo nas sems can drangs te /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas sems can drangs te /
translated: Through that, one attracts sentient beings

original: theg pa gsum la 'god par byed pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum la 'god par byed pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and establishes them in the three vehicles. Therefore, it is called “bringing sentient beings to full maturity.”

original: de na nyon mongs pa rjes su srung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de na nyon mongs pa rjes su srung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: There, he protects against the afflictions.

original: sa drug pa'i tshe rten cing 'brel te 'byung bsgom pa la mang du gnas pas /
analyzed: sa drug pa'i tshe rten cing 'brel te 'byung bsgom pa la mang du gnas pas /
translated: At the time of the sixth stage, he dwells much in the cultivation of dependent origination.

original: rten 'brel sgom pa ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba na sems can gyi don byed kyang sems can nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur bas nyon mongs pa rjes su srung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rten 'brel sgom pa ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba na sems can gyi don byed kyang sems can nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur bas nyon mongs pa rjes su srung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the cultivation of dependent origination is the antidote to the afflictions, he protects against the afflictions, because he acts for the sake of sentient beings in cyclic existence, but he is not affected by the afflictions.

original: bdun pa la ni 'dres shing nye bar 'dre bas /
analyzed: bdun pa la ni 'dres shing nye bar 'dre bas /
translated: On the seventh, he is mixed and closely mixed.

original: bgrod pa gcig gi lam la gnas pa brgyad pa dang 'brel @246a * //🔽pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bgrod pa gcig gi lam la gnas pa brgyad pa dang 'brel @246a * // pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is connected to the eighth stage, which is the abode of the single path.

original: sa brgyad pa'i dus na rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa la gnas pas sa brgyad pa ni bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa'i dus na rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa la gnas pas sa brgyad pa ni bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At the time of the eighth stage, he is in the abode of the single path, because he is in the spontaneous, nonconceptual state.

original: de la sa bdun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: de la sa bdun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa /
translated: On the seventh stage, the bodhisattvas are in the abode of signlessness.

original: sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang rang bzhin gcig tu gyur pas na 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang rang bzhin gcig tu gyur pas na 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they become of one nature with the bodhisattvas who abide on the seventh stage, they are called “mixed”.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i lam thob pas sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang nye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i lam thob pas sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang nye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because they attain the path without activity, they approach the bodhisattvas who abide on the eighth stage.

original: sa brgyad pa thob pa'i rgyur gyur pas na /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa thob pa'i rgyur gyur pas na /
translated: Because they become the cause for attaining the eighth stage,

original: nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya ste /
translated: they are called “approaching”.

original: de'i phyir sa brgyad pa dang 'dres pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa brgyad pa dang 'dres pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that they are “mixed with the eighth stage”.

original: brgal ba / sa bdun pa la gnas pa rnams kyis sa brgyad pa ma thob na ji ltar nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya bar 'gyur zhe na /
