analyzed: brgal ba / sa bdun pa la gnas pa rnams kyis sa brgyad pa ma thob na ji ltar nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Objection: If those who abide on the seventh stage do not attain the eighth stage, how can they be called “mixed”?

original: lan du nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni dngos su thob pa la mi bya'o //
analyzed: lan du nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni dngos su thob pa la mi bya'o //
translated: In response, this expression “mixed” should not be taken to mean actual attainment.

original: sa de dang nye bar 'gyur ba la bya ste /
analyzed: sa de dang nye bar 'gyur ba la bya ste /
translated: It means approaching that stage.

original: dper na skas kyi mgor phyin pas khang pa'i steng na nye ba bzhin du sa bdun pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa de ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa thams cad mthar phyin te /
analyzed: dper na skas kyi mgor phyin pas khang pa'i steng na nye ba bzhin du sa bdun pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa de ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa thams cad mthar phyin te /
translated: For example, just as one who has reached the top of a ladder is close to the top of the building, so those on the seventh bodhisattva level, who are in the absence of attributes, have completed all the paths that are associated with exertion.🔽They are close to the eighth level, which is without exertion,

original: rtsol 'bad can gyi sa'i rtse mo la gnas pas mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i sa brgyad pa dang nye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtsol 'bad can gyi sa'i rtse mo la gnas pas mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i sa brgyad pa dang nye bar 'gyur te /
translated: because they are on the peak of the level that requires effort.

original: de ma thag tu sa brgyad pa 'thob pas na nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ma thag tu sa brgyad pa 'thob pas na nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “close” because they are about to attain the eighth level.

original: yang na mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i lam sa bdun pa nyid thob par gyur ba'i phyir 'dres pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i lam sa bdun pa nyid thob par gyur ba'i phyir 'dres pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, they are called “close” because they have attained the seventh bodhisattva level, which is the path that is associated with exertion.

original: de ma thag tu sa brgyad pa la 'jug pas /
analyzed: de ma thag tu sa brgyad pa la 'jug pas /
translated: They are called “connected to the eighth” because they are about to enter the eighth level.

original: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam la gnas pa brgyad pa dang 'brel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam la gnas pa brgyad pa dang 'brel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “abiding in the path of a single progress” because they are connected to the eighth level.

original: mtshan ma med pa la phyogs gcig pa'i lam mo zhes bya ba la sa bdun pa'i dus na bar 'ga' mtshan ma med par gnas pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la phyogs gcig pa'i lam mo zhes bya ba la sa bdun pa'i dus na bar 'ga' mtshan ma med par gnas pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: On the seventh level, bodhisattvas are not sometimes abiding in signlessness,

original: rtag tu brtsal 'bad dang bcas pa'i sgo nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la gnas pas na mtshan ma med pa la phyogs gcig pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu brtsal 'bad dang bcas pa'i sgo nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la gnas pas na mtshan ma med pa la phyogs gcig pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: but they are constantly abiding in nonconceptual gnosis, although with effort, so it is called the path of partial realization of signlessness.

original: brgyad pa la mtshan ma med pa la lhun gyis grub ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brgyad pa la mtshan ma med pa la lhun gyis grub ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: On the eighth, signlessness is spontaneous.

original: sa brgyad pa'i dus na brtsal 'bad thams cad dang bral te /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa'i dus na brtsal 'bad thams cad dang bral te /
translated: On the eighth level, bodhisattvas are free of all effort

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin lhun gyis grub pa la gnas pas na mtshan @246b ma med pa yang lhun gyis grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin lhun gyis grub pa la gnas pas na mtshan @246b ma med pa yang lhun gyis grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and abide in spontaneous nonconceptual concentration, so it is called spontaneous signlessness.

original: de ltar na mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ltar na mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: So there are two kinds of abidance in signlessness.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas shing brtsal ba dang bcas pas mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang mngon par 'du byad pa med cing brtsal ba med par mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas shing brtsal ba dang bcas pas mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang mngon par 'du byad pa med cing brtsal ba med par mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in the absence of attributes with exertion and with application and abiding in the absence of attributes without exertion and without application.

original: de la sa bdun pa'i dus na mtshan ma med pa la gnas su zin kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las shin tu rgyal bar ma gyur pas na brtsal 'bad dang bcas pa'i sgo nas mtshan ma med pa la sgom pas na sa bdun pa la ni 'bad pa
analyzed: de la sa bdun pa'i dus na mtshan ma med pa la gnas su zin kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las shin tu rgyal bar ma gyur pas na brtsal 'bad dang bcas pa'i sgo nas mtshan ma med pa la sgom pas na sa bdun pa la ni 'bad pa
translated: At the time of the seventh level, although one abides in the absence of attributes, since one has not completely conquered the opposing side, one meditates on the absence of attributes with exertion and with effort.

original: dang bcas brtsal ba dang bcas pas mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang bcas brtsal ba dang bcas pas mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the seventh level is called the one with exertion and with effort, abiding in the absence of attributes.

original: sa brgyad pa la ni mtshan ma med pa nge nyid la bsgom pa dang / mang du byas pas brtsal 'bang med par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la ni mtshan ma med pa nge nyid la bsgom pa dang / mang du byas pas brtsal 'bang med par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: On the eighth level, since one meditates on the absence of attributes itself and has done so extensively, one abides in the nonconceptual samadhi without exertion and spontaneously.

original: 'bad pa med pa dang brtsal ba med par mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa med pa dang brtsal ba med par mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “abiding in the signless without effort and without exertion.”

original: de bas na sa brgyad pa nyid las /
analyzed: de bas na sa brgyad pa nyid las /
translated: Therefore, the eighth bhumi itself says,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
translated: “O children of the Victorious Ones, it is like this.

original: dper na rgya mtsho chen por 'gro ba'i gru ni rgya mtsho chen por ma phyin gyi bar du ched du bskyod cing 'gro bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dper na rgya mtsho chen por 'gro ba'i gru ni rgya mtsho chen por ma phyin gyi bar du ched du bskyod cing 'gro bar bya ba yin te /
translated: A boat that is going out to the great ocean must be deliberately propelled until it reaches the great ocean.

original: rgya mtsho chen po la zhen ma thag tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis bsdu bas ched du bskyod mi dgos pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po la zhen ma thag tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis bsdu bas ched du bskyod mi dgos pa ma yin la /
translated: As soon as it reaches the great ocean, it is gathered by the circle of wind and does not need to be deliberately propelled.

original: des rgya mtsho chen po nyid gcig gis ci chor pa de ni sngon chad du bskyod cing 'gro bas lo brgyar yang de ltar tshad med par phyin par mi nus so //
analyzed: des rgya mtsho chen po nyid gcig gis ci chor pa de ni sngon chad du bskyod cing 'gro bas lo brgyar yang de ltar tshad med par phyin par mi nus so //
translated: And the distance it travels in a single day by being gathered by the circle of wind is a distance that could not be traveled by being deliberately propelled for many hundreds of years.”

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po'i tshogs yang dag par bsags pa'i theg pa chen po'i grur zhugs pa yang /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya mtshor phyin nas yud tsam gcig tu lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ci tsam yang dag par gnon pa de ni sngon gyi ched du bya ba'i las kyis bskal pa brgya stong du yang yang
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po'i tshogs yang dag par bsags pa'i theg pa chen po'i grur zhugs pa yang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya mtshor phyin nas yud tsam gcig tu lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ci tsam yang dag par gnon pa de ni sngon gyi ched du bya ba'i las kyis bskal pa brgya stong du yang yang
translated: O children of the Victorious Ones, in the same way, the bodhisattva great beings who have entered the ship of the Great Vehicle, which is the accumulation of the great collection of roots of virtue,🔽even though they have reached the ocean of bodhisattva conduct, cannot be overcome by the previous intentional actions that would have to be overcome for hundreds of thousands of eons in a single instant with the wisdom of spontaneous accomplishment, let alone with the wisdom of omniscience.🔽In the second half of the second verse, it is said that the bodhisattvas who have entered the Great Vehicle, the ship of the collection of roots of virtue, cannot be overcome by the previous intentional actions that would have to be overcome for hundreds of thousands of eons in a single instant with the wisdom of spontaneous accomplishment, let alone with the wisdom of omniscience.

original: dag par non par mi nus so zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽sa nyid la gang zag rnam par dbye ba las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la /🔽sa dang po yan chad sa bcu pa man chad la nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: dag par non par mi nus so zhes bya ba gsungs so // sa nyid la gang zag rnam par dbye ba las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la / sa dang po yan chad sa bcu pa man chad la nyid ces bya ste /
translated: In the second half of the second verse, it is said that the bodhisattvas who have entered the Great Vehicle, the ship of the collection of roots of virtue, cannot be overcome by the previous intentional actions that would have to be overcome for hundreds of thousands of eons in a single instant with the wisdom of spontaneous accomplishment, let alone with the wisdom of omniscience.🔽In the second half of the second verse, it is said that the bodhisattvas who have entered the Great Vehicle, the ship of the collection of roots of virtue, cannot be overcome by the previous intentional actions that would have to be overcome for hundreds of thousands of eons in a single instant with the wisdom of spontaneous accomplishment, let alone with the wisdom of omniscience.

original: sa de @247a * //
analyzed: sa de @247a * //
translated: In the second half of the second verse, it is said that the bodhisattvas who have entered the Great Vehicle, the ship of the collection of roots of virtue, cannot be overcome by the previous intentional actions that would have to be overcome for hundreds of thousands of eons in a single instant with the wisdom of spontaneous accomplishment, let alone with the wisdom of omniscience.🔽In the second half of the second verse, it is said that the bodhisattvas who have entered the Great Vehicle, the ship of the collection of roots of virtue, cannot be overcome by the previous intentional actions that would have to be overcome for hundreds of thousands of eons in a single instant with the wisdom of spontaneous accomplishment, let alone with the wisdom of omniscience.

original: dag na sa 'di la gnas pa'i gang zag la ming du 'di skad ces bya /
analyzed: dag na sa 'di la gnas pa'i gang zag la ming du 'di skad ces bya /
translated: In the second half of the second verse, it is said that the bodhisattvas who have entered the Great Vehicle,

original: sa 'di la gnas pa'i gang zag la ni ming du 'di skad ces bya zhes phye ste bstan pa ni sa nyid la gang zag rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa 'di la gnas pa'i gang zag la ni ming du 'di skad ces bya zhes phye ste bstan pa ni sa nyid la gang zag rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The person who is on this stage is called by the name “one who has purified view.”

original: de tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is taught in two verses.

original: lta ba rnam dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: lta ba rnam dag ces bya ba la /
translated: One who has purified view

original: sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni ming du lta ba rnam par dag pa'i gang zag ces bya ste /
analyzed: sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni ming du lta ba rnam par dag pa'i gang zag ces bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the first stage is called by the name “one who has purified view.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sa dang po thob pa'i dus na gang zag la yod par lta ba dang / chos la yod par lta ba'i gnyen por gyur pa /
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa'i dus na gang zag la yod par lta ba dang / chos la yod par lta ba'i gnyen por gyur pa /
translated: At the time of attaining the first stage, as the antidote to the view that the person exists and the view that things exist,

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med par chud pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rnyed pa'i phyir lta ba rnam par dag pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med par chud pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rnyed pa'i phyir lta ba rnam par dag pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: he obtains the nonconceptual intuition that penetrates the selflessness of the person and things. Therefore he is called “one who has purified view.”

original: de bas na sa dang po nyid las kyang sems kyi stobs dang blo'i stobs kyis shin tu rnam par phye ba rnam par 'byed pa yin zhes gsungs pa dang / dus mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na sa dang po nyid las kyang sems kyi stobs dang blo'i stobs kyis shin tu rnam par phye ba rnam par 'byed pa yin zhes gsungs pa dang / dus mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: And it is said that “one comes to a realization of their simultaneity.”

original: tshul khrims shin tu dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul khrims shin tu dag ces bya ba la /
translated: With regard to the phrase “his discipline is utterly pure,”

original: sa gnyis pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ming du tshul khrims shin tu dag pa'i gang zag ces bya ste /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ming du tshul khrims shin tu dag pa'i gang zag ces bya ste /
translated: a bodhisattva who is on the second ground is called a person whose discipline is utterly pure.

original: sa gnyis pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ltung ba chen po mi 'byung ba bzhin du ltung ba'i 'khrul pa phra mo yang 'byung ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ltung ba chen po mi 'byung ba bzhin du ltung ba'i 'khrul pa phra mo yang 'byung ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because for bodhisattvas on the second ground, not only do the great downfalls not occur, but even the subtle errors that are downfalls do not occur.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i gang zag tu gzhag go //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i gang zag tu gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, he is posited as a person whose discipline is completely pure.

original: de bas na sa gnyis pa nyid las kyang srog gcod pa las phyir log pa'i skabs su yang srog gcod pa las phyir log pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sa gnyis pa nyid las kyang srog gcod pa las phyir log pa'i skabs su yang srog gcod pa las phyir log pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said in the same text that “on the second ground, in the context of turning away from killing, one turns away from killing.”

original: dbyig pa spangs mtshon cha spangs zhes bya ba nas de kun du rtog pa tsam gyis kyang srog chags la 'tshe ba mi byed na sems can gzhan la sems can du 'du shes shing ched du bsams shing lus kyi rnam par 'tshe ba chen po bya ba lta🔽ci smos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dbyig pa spangs mtshon cha spangs zhes bya ba nas de kun du rtog pa tsam gyis kyang srog chags la 'tshe ba mi byed na sems can gzhan la sems can du 'du shes shing ched du bsams shing lus kyi rnam par 'tshe ba chen po bya ba lta ci smos zhes gsungs so //
translated: How much less would one do so intentionally, with the full awareness that the other is a living being?

original: ma byin par len pa'i skabs su yang bdag gi longs spyod kyis chog shes pas gzhan gyi longs spyod la bag med pa yin te tha na rtsva dang lo ma yang ma byin par len pa 'tsho ba'i yo byad gzhan dag lta ci smos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i skabs su yang bdag gi longs spyod kyis chog shes pas gzhan gyi longs spyod la bag med pa yin te tha na rtsva dang lo ma yang ma byin par len pa 'tsho ba'i yo byad gzhan dag lta ci smos zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the context of not taking what is not given, one is content with one’s own wealth and is not heedless with regard to the wealth of others. One does not take even grass or leaves that are not given, let alone other things that are needed for one’s livelihood.

original: 'dod pas log par spyod pa'i skabs su yang bdag gi @247b chung mas chog shes pas gzhan gyi chung ma la mi 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pas log par spyod pa'i skabs su yang bdag gi @247b chung mas chog shes pas gzhan gyi chung ma la mi 'dod pa yin te /
translated: In the context of avoiding sexual misconduct, one is content with one’s own spouse and has no desire for the spouse of another.

original: gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba'i bud med gzhan gyi chung ma rus dang mtshan dang chos kyis bsrungs pa rnams la chags pa yang mi skyed na gnyis kyis gnyis sprod pa lta ci smos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
analyzed: gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba'i bud med gzhan gyi chung ma rus dang mtshan dang chos kyis bsrungs pa rnams la chags pa yang mi skyed na gnyis kyis gnyis sprod pa lta ci smos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
translated: He does not even arouse desire for other women who are the wives of others, protected by their parents, relatives, or clan, much less for a woman to be protected in this way by the Dharma.

original: / mnyam par gzhag dang zhes bya ba la sa gsum pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni ming du mnyam par gzhag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: / mnyam par gzhag dang zhes bya ba la sa gsum pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni ming du mnyam par gzhag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: The one who is equipoised refers to the bodhisattva who is on the third ground, who is called the bodhisattva who is equipoised.

original: tshe rabs gar skyes te shi 'phos kyang /
analyzed: tshe rabs gar skyes te shi 'phos kyang /
translated: Wherever he is born in his future lives,

original: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa thob pas na mnyam par gzhag pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa thob pas na mnyam par gzhag pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: he attains the meditative stabilization of the bodhisattvas called the one who is equipoised.

original: de bas na sa gsum pa las kyang de rnam pa de lta bu'i brtson 'grus rtsom pas na /
analyzed: de bas na sa gsum pa las kyang de rnam pa de lta bu'i brtson 'grus rtsom pas na /
translated: Therefore, on the third ground, he is one who is equipoised because he is engaged in that kind of effort.

original: chos yongs su tshol zhing chos de dag thos nas kyang /
analyzed: chos yongs su tshol zhing chos de dag thos nas kyang /
translated: He seeks the Dharma and having heard the Dharma,

original: rang rang gi sems la nges par rtogs pas gcig tu dben par song ste /
analyzed: rang rang gi sems la nges par rtogs pas gcig tu dben par song ste /
translated: Having understood this in their own minds, they go to a solitary place.

original: 'di ltar dpyod do //🔽chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dpyod do // chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrubs pas /
translated: They analyze it in this way:🔽“These qualities of the Buddha are not realized by merely accomplishing the teachings in a way that accords with the teachings,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di dag khong du chud par bya ba'i tshig gi las yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin no snyam ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di dag khong du chud par bya ba'i tshig gi las yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin no snyam ste /
translated: by merely the purity of verbal action.”

original: de chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa'i rgyu 'dod pa rnams las dben pa /
analyzed: de chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa'i rgyu 'dod pa rnams las dben pa /
translated: Thus, they desire the causes for accomplishing the teachings in a way that accords with the teachings: “They are isolated from desire,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dpen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dpen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: isolated from evil, unwholesome states,” and so on.

original: chos la nga rgyal spangs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos la nga rgyal spangs zhes bya ba la /
translated: “They abandon pride with regard to the teachings.”

original: sa bzhi pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni ming du chos la nga rgyal spangs pa'i gang zag ces bya ste /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni ming du chos la nga rgyal spangs pa'i gang zag ces bya ste /
translated: On the fourth ground, the bodhisattvas are called individuals who have abandoned pride with regard to the teachings.

original: 'di ltar sa gsum pa'i tshe na chos la bla mar byed cing chos la gus pa mang ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa gsum pa'i tshe na chos la bla mar byed cing chos la gus pa mang ste /
translated: Thus, on the third ground, they respect the teachings and have great devotion to the teachings.

original: chos brtsal ba la gcig tu spro ba gang yin pa de sa bzhi pa'i tshe na sems de las kyang log go //
analyzed: chos brtsal ba la gcig tu spro ba gang yin pa de sa bzhi pa'i tshe na sems de las kyang log go //
translated: The delight in seeking the Dharma that was present on the fourth ground is now surpassed.

original: sa gsum pa la chos la bla mar byed cing /
analyzed: sa gsum pa la chos la bla mar byed cing /
translated: On the third ground, the bodhisattva respects the Dharma

original: chos brtsams pa la gcig tu spro ba yang /
analyzed: chos brtsams pa la gcig tu spro ba yang /
translated: and delights in practicing the Dharma.

original: sa gsum pa nyid las de de ltar shin tu brtags pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas /
analyzed: sa gsum pa nyid las de de ltar shin tu brtags pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas /
translated: On the third ground, the bodhisattva is endowed with the wisdom that thoroughly investigates the Dharma.

original: de bas kyang shas cher dam pa'i chos yongs su tshol ba la mngon par brtson par gnas te /
analyzed: de bas kyang shas cher dam pa'i chos yongs su tshol ba la mngon par brtson par gnas te /
translated: Therefore, he is even more diligent in seeking the sacred Dharma.

original: nyin mtshan du chos nyan pa don du gnyer /
analyzed: nyin mtshan du chos nyan pa don du gnyer /
translated: He is intent on listening to the Dharma day and night.

original: chos 'dod / chos la dga'/
analyzed: chos 'dod / chos la dga'/
translated: He desires the Dharma, delights in the Dharma,

original: chos la brten /🔽chos la gzhol /🔽chos la 'bab /
analyzed: chos la brten / chos la gzhol / chos la 'bab /
translated: relies on the Dharma,🔽is devoted to the Dharma,🔽is absorbed in the Dharma,🔽is inclined toward the Dharma,

original: chos la phyogs /🔽@248a * // chos la gnas tshol /
analyzed: chos la phyogs / @248a * // chos la gnas tshol /
translated: seeks the Dharma,🔽and seeks refuge in the Dharma.

original: chos la skyabs tshol zhing chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos spyod do //
analyzed: chos la skyabs tshol zhing chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos spyod do //
translated: He practices the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su tshol ba la mngon par brtson pa de ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su tshol ba la mngon par brtson pa de ni /
translated: He is diligent in seeking the Buddha’s Dharma.

original: rdzas kyi rnam pa'am /
analyzed: rdzas kyi rnam pa'am /
translated: He is not attached to material things,

original: nor dang 'bru dang mdzod dang bang ba'i rnam pa yongs su mi gtong ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: nor dang 'bru dang mdzod dang bang ba'i rnam pa yongs su mi gtong ba gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that he would not give away, whether it be wealth, grain, treasuries, or granaries.

original: de la bya dka' bar 'du shes pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la bya dka' bar 'du shes pa ma yin gyi /
translated: He does not think of it as difficult to do.

original: gzhan du chos smra ba'i gang zag de la bya dka' ba'i 'du shes su gyur pa ni ma gtogs so //🔽phyi rol gyi dngos po nye bar gzung ba yongs su mi gtong ba de gang cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: gzhan du chos smra ba'i gang zag de la bya dka' ba'i 'du shes su gyur pa ni ma gtogs so // phyi rol gyi dngos po nye bar gzung ba yongs su mi gtong ba de gang cung zad kyang med do //
translated: He thinks of it as difficult to do only in the case of a Dharma teacher.🔽There is nothing that he would not give away, whether it be external things or his own body.

original: nang gi dngos po yongs su mi gtong ba de gang cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: nang gi dngos po yongs su mi gtong ba de gang cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is nothing that he would not give away, whether it be external things or his own body.

original: bla ma'i yongs su spyod pa dang rim gro bya ba nyams su mi len pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: bla ma'i yongs su spyod pa dang rim gro bya ba nyams su mi len pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is nothing that he would not do in the way of service to his gurus.

original: nga rgyal gyi sems las kyang nga rgyal spangs te /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi sems las kyang nga rgyal spangs te /
translated: He has abandoned pride and the attitude of pride.

original: nga rgyal med pa nye bar spyad par bya ba ji lta bu ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa nye bar spyad par bya ba ji lta bu ste /
translated: He has no pride in the way of attending to those who are worthy of being attended to.

original: nyams su mi len pa de gang yang med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: nyams su mi len pa de gang yang med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: There is nothing that he would not do.

original: gal te la la zhig de la 'di skad ces zer te /
analyzed: gal te la la zhig de la 'di skad ces zer te /
translated: If someone were to say to him,

original: gal te khyod kyis me'i 'obs chen po kun du 'bar ba /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis me'i 'obs chen po kun du 'bar ba /
translated: If you were to throw yourself into a great pit of fire,

original: kun du rab tu 'bar ba /
analyzed: kun du rab tu 'bar ba /
translated: blazing,

original: me lce gcig tu gyur pa'i nang du bdag por te /
analyzed: me lce gcig tu gyur pa'i nang du bdag por te /
translated: a single tongue of flame,

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba chen po rang gi lus kyis nyams su blang ba lta na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba chen po rang gi lus kyis nyams su blang ba lta na /
translated: and experience with your own body the great suffering of pain,

original: ngas khyod la chos kyi tshig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyong ba 'di bshad par bya'o zhe na yang /
analyzed: ngas khyod la chos kyi tshig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyong ba 'di bshad par bya'o zhe na yang /
translated: I would explain to you the words of the Dharma taught by the perfect Buddha, this training in the bodhisattva deeds.

original: de 'di snyam ste /
analyzed: de 'di snyam ste /
translated: But you should think,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su spyod pa'i chos kyi tshig gcig gi don du yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes gang bar tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas bdag nyid dor bar
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su spyod pa'i chos kyi tshig gcig gi don du yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes gang bar tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas bdag nyid dor bar
translated: ‘For the sake of a single word of Dharma from the teachings of the perfect Buddha, for the sake of training in the bodhisattva deeds, I would throw myself from the Brahma world into a great billionfold world filled with fire,

original: mos na / me'i 'obs tha mal bar bdag dor ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: mos na / me'i 'obs tha mal bar bdag dor ba lta ci smos /
translated: let alone into an ordinary pit of fire.’

original: sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad nyams su bab kyang bdag gis chos btsal bar bya na me'i sdug bsngal dang 'grogs pa lta ci smos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad nyams su bab kyang bdag gis chos btsal bar bya na me'i sdug bsngal dang 'grogs pa lta ci smos zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even if all the sufferings of the hells were to descend on me, I would seek the Dharma, let alone the suffering of fire.

original: de ltar sa gsum pa la chos la gcig tu gus pa'i bsam pa de'ang sa bzhi pa'i tshe na ldog ste /
analyzed: de ltar sa gsum pa la chos la gcig tu gus pa'i bsam pa de'ang sa bzhi pa'i tshe na ldog ste /
translated: Thus, the attitude of exclusive devotion to the Dharma on the third ground is reversed on the fourth ground.

original: ji ltar ldog ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar ldog ce na /
translated: How is it reversed?

original: 'di ltar gang gcig tu chos tshol ba 'di'ang /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gcig tu chos tshol ba 'di'ang /
translated: In this way, this exclusive search for the Dharma🔽distracts the mind and makes it proud.

original: sems g-yengs pa dang / sems @248b nga rgyal can du byed pa yin no zhes tshol ba de spangs nas /
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa dang / sems @248b nga rgyal can du byed pa yin no zhes tshol ba de spangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned this search,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor bar byed do //
translated: he applies himself to cultivating the elements leading to enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir sa bzhi pa nyid las kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od 'phro ba can 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni kun sbyong ba dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan par gyur nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bzhi pa nyid las kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od 'phro ba can 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni kun sbyong ba dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan par gyur nas /
translated: Therefore, in the fourth ground alone, it says, “O sons of the victors, the bodhisattva who is on this Bodhisattvabhūmi of Glowing Light, having become one who is thoroughly purified, one who is vigilant, and one who is mindful,

original: snying rjes 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par spangs te /
analyzed: snying rjes 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par spangs te /
translated: Through compassion, one abandons the world's attachment and anxiety.

original: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba can du gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba can du gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: One dwells as one who observes the body in the internal body.

original: rgyud dang nyon mongs rnam dag bye brag la //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyud dang nyon mongs rnam dag bye brag la // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The pride of the distinctions of the continuum and of affliction.

original: rgyud bye brag med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bye brag la nga rgyal med pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyud bye brag med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bye brag la nga rgyal med pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The pride of the distinctions of the continuum and of affliction should be understood as the pride of the distinctions of the continuum and of affliction.

original: de la sa lnga pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni ming du rgyud kyi bye brag las nga rgyal med pa'i gang zag ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la sa lnga pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni ming du rgyud kyi bye brag las nga rgyal med pa'i gang zag ces bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas who abide in the fifth stage are called individuals who are without pride in the distinctions of the continuum.

original: de'i tshe sems kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa ma nyam pa nyid sa bcu thob pas dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rgyud dang / dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rnams dang sa lnga pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyi rgyud dang /
analyzed: de'i tshe sems kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa ma nyam pa nyid sa bcu thob pas dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rgyud dang / dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rnams dang sa lnga pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyi rgyud dang /
translated: At that time, by attaining the ten grounds, the bodhisattvas' mental states are completely pure and equal.🔽They understand that there is no difference between the continuums of the tathagatas of the three times and the dharmas of the tathagatas of the three times and the continuums of the minds of the bodhisattvas abiding on the fifth ground and their dharmas.

original: chos rnams su rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du tha dad pa med par khong du chung pas na /
analyzed: chos rnams su rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du tha dad pa med par khong du chung pas na /
translated: They understand that they are the same in being characterized by purity.

original: rgyud kyi bye brag la nga rgyal med pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud kyi bye brag la nga rgyal med pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called individuals who are free of pride with regard to the distinctions of continuums.

original: de la sems kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid bcu ni sa lnga pa nyid las /🔽kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa la /
analyzed: de la sems kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid bcu ni sa lnga pa nyid las / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa la /
translated: The ten mental states of purity and equality are mentioned in the same text:

original: sa'i lam yongs su rdzogs par byas pa de byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: sa'i lam yongs su rdzogs par byas pa de byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la 'jug ste /
translated: O sons of the conquerors, the bodhisattvas who have completed the path of the fourth ground enter the fifth bodhisattva ground, the Hard to Conquer.

original: rnam par dag pa la sems kyi mnyam pa nyid bcus 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa la sems kyi mnyam pa nyid bcus 'jug go //
translated: They enter it with ten mental states of purity and equality.

original: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: They are the purity of the intention of the Dharma of the buddhas of the past, the purity of the intention of the Dharma of the buddhas of the future, and the purity of the intention of the Dharma of the buddhas of the present;🔽the purity of the intention of discipline;

original: tshul khrims kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sems kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa @249a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sems kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa @249a * //
translated: the purity of the intention of mind;

original: mnyam pa nyid dang / lta ba dang / nem nur dang / dogs pa bsal bas bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lam dang lam ma yin par shes pas bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / nan tan spong bar shes pas bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid dang / lta ba dang / nem nur dang / dogs pa bsal bas bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lam dang lam ma yin par shes pas bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / nan tan spong bar shes pas bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: the purity of the intention of eliminating views, doubt, and uncertainty; the purity of the intention of knowing the path and what is not the path; the purity of the intention of knowing the practice of elimination;

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad du gong nas gong du rnam par bsgom pa dang / bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can yongs su smin par byas pas bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid de zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad du gong nas gong du rnam par bsgom pa dang / bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can yongs su smin par byas pas bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid de zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: and the complete cultivation of all the elements of enlightenment, and the sameness of pure intention, and the sameness of pure intention through the maturation of sentient beings.

original: de'i don kyang ji ltar 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag par gyur pa /
analyzed: de'i don kyang ji ltar 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag par gyur pa /
translated: The meaning of that is that just as the Bhagavat Buddhas of the past purified the qualities of the Buddha,

original: de bzhin du sa lnga pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang bdag cag gis kyang de dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ring po mi thogs par sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag dag par 'gyur ro zhes de lta bu'i bsam pa thob po //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa lnga pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang bdag cag gis kyang de dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ring po mi thogs par sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag dag par 'gyur ro zhes de lta bu'i bsam pa thob po //
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattvas who have attained the fifth ground think, “We will also purify those qualities of the Buddha without delay.” They attain that kind of intention.

original: sa drug pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni ming du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bye brag la nga rgyal med pa'i gang zag ces bya ste /
analyzed: sa drug pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni ming du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bye brag la nga rgyal med pa'i gang zag ces bya ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas on the sixth level are called individuals without pride in the specific aspects of defilement and purity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sa de la gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sa de la gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: When they are on that level,🔽they acquire ten kinds of evenness with regard to phenomena and so they realize the emptiness of dependent arising.

original: chos mnyam pa nyid bcu thob pas rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir stong pa nyid la ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa nag po'i phyogs su gzhag pa dang / ma rig pa 'gags pa la sogs pa dkar po'i phyogs su gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid bcu thob pas rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir stong pa nyid la ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa nag po'i phyogs su gzhag pa dang / ma rig pa 'gags pa la sogs pa dkar po'i phyogs su gzhag pa ste /
translated: They understand that emptiness is not to be posited in two ways, as the dark side, with ignorance as a condition for the formative factors and so on, and as the bright side, with the cessation of ignorance and so on.

original: rnam pa gnyis su gzhag tu med kyi thams cad kyang ma skyes ma byung zhing stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du ro gcig par khong du chud pas na /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su gzhag tu med kyi thams cad kyang ma skyes ma byung zhing stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du ro gcig par khong du chud pas na /
translated: Everything is unborn, unoriginated and of one taste in the nature of emptiness.

original: de'i tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la nga rgyal med pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la nga rgyal med pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: At that time, one is called a person who is free from pride with regard to defilement and purification.

original: de bas na sa drug pa nyid las /
analyzed: de bas na sa drug pa nyid las /
translated: Therefore, the Six Points of Yogic Practice itself says:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag sa lnga pa la sa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag sa lnga pa la sa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la 'jug go //
translated: “O children of the Victorious Ones, by perfecting the path of the fifth ground, one enters the sixth bodhisattva ground.

original: de la chos mnyam pa nyid bcus 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la chos mnyam pa nyid bcus 'jug ste /
translated: One enters it through ten kinds of sameness of phenomena.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are these ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos @249b thams cad mi skye ba mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad ma byung ba mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad dben pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad snga nas rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos @249b thams cad mi skye ba mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad ma byung ba mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad dben pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad snga nas rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: the sameness of all phenomena in being without characteristics, the sameness of all phenomena in being unborn, the sameness of all phenomena in being unarisen, the sameness of all phenomena in being void, the sameness of all phenomena in being primordially pure,

original: chos thams cad spros pa med pa mnyam pa nyid dang // chos thams cad blang ba med pa dang dor ba med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang mig yor dang sgra brnyan dang chu zla dang gzugs brnyan dang sprul pa dang mtshungs pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad spros pa med pa mnyam pa nyid dang // chos thams cad blang ba med pa dang dor ba med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang mig yor dang sgra brnyan dang chu zla dang gzugs brnyan dang sprul pa dang mtshungs pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: all phenomena are the same in being like illusions, dreams, optical illusions, echoes, moons in water, reflections, emanations,🔽all phenomena are the same in being neither existent things nor nonexistent things nor both,

original: chos thams cad dngos po yod pa dang dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po yod pa dang dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and so on up to:

original: rgyu rkyen dang ldan pas ni 'du byed 'phal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen dang ldan pas ni 'du byed 'phal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When there are causes and conditions, formations increase.

original: rgyu rkyen dang mi ldan pas ni 'phel ba med pa zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen dang mi ldan pas ni 'phel ba med pa zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: When there are no causes and conditions, they do not increase.

original: skad cig gcig thob blo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skad cig gcig thob blo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who have the cognition of attaining in a single moment

original: sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni skad cig ma gcig la thob pa'i blo dang ldan pa'i gang zag ces bya ste /
analyzed: sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni skad cig ma gcig la thob pa'i blo dang ldan pa'i gang zag ces bya ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas who are on the seventh level are called individuals who have the cognition of attaining in a single moment.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sa drug pa la gnas pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas par gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skyed par byed pa'i rgyu byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams skad cig ma re re la yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir skad cig
analyzed: sa drug pa la gnas pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas par gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skyed par byed pa'i rgyu byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams skad cig ma re re la yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir skad cig
translated: Because the bodhisattva who is abiding in the sixth bhūmi, who is abiding in signless samādhi, is perfecting in every instant the factors of awakening that are the causes for generating all the qualities of the buddhas.

original: ma la thob pa'i blo dang ldan pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: ma la thob pa'i blo dang ldan pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the person who has the intelligence that is attained in an instant.

original: de bas na sa bdun pa nyid las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na sa bdun pa nyid las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Saptasatikā Prajñāpāramitā says:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa ring du song ba 'di la  la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po de dag de ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa ring du song ba 'di la  la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po de dag de ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: “O children of the victors! In that way, the ten perfections of the bodhisattva who is abiding in this bodhisattva bhūmi Gone Far are completely perfected.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The four means of gathering are also completely perfected.

original: gnas bzhi dang byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / mdor bsdu na byang chub kyi yan lag gi chos thams cad skad cig tu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnas bzhi dang byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / mdor bsdu na byang chub kyi yan lag gi chos thams cad skad cig tu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: In an instant, the four bases of supernormal powers, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the three doors of liberation, and in short, all the factors of enlightenment are perfected.

original: btang snyoms pa dang zhing yang rnam par spyod //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni btang snyoms @250a * //
analyzed: btang snyoms pa dang zhing yang rnam par spyod // zhes bya ba la / sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni btang snyoms @250a * //
translated: They are impartial and purify their fields.

original: dang zhing rnam par sbyong ba'i gang zag ces bya ste /
analyzed: dang zhing rnam par sbyong ba'i gang zag ces bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas on the eighth level are called “impartial” and “purifiers of their fields.”

original: lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma med pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas btang snyoms pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma med pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas btang snyoms pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are impartial because they spontaneously abide in signlessness and nonconceptuality.🔽The example of their spontaneous abiding is given in the following passage:

original: lhun gyis grub par gnas pa'i dpe yang kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par gnas pa'i dpe yang kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
translated: O children of the buddhas! It is like this.

original: dper na rgya mtsho chen por 'gro ba'i gru ni rgya mtsho chen por ma phyin gyi bar du ched du bskyod cing 'gro bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dper na rgya mtsho chen por 'gro ba'i gru ni rgya mtsho chen por ma phyin gyi bar du ched du bskyod cing 'gro bar bya ba yin te /
translated: For example, a ship that is going to the great ocean is something that is to be propelled and moved until it reaches the great ocean.

original: rgya mtsho chen po la zhen ma thag tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis bsu bas ched du bskyod mi dgos pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs su gsungs so //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po la zhen ma thag tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis bsu bas ched du bskyod mi dgos pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs su gsungs so //
translated: But as soon as it reaches the great ocean, it is propelled by the circle of the wind and does not need to be propelled.

original: sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi zhing rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan pa lta bur byin gyis rlob cing ston pas na zhing yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi zhing rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan pa lta bur byin gyis rlob cing ston pas na zhing yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: When one is on the eighth stage, one is able to transform and show a buddha-land adorned with the seven precious stones. Therefore, it is called the stage of the purification of the buddha-land.

original: de yang sa brgyad pa nyid las /
analyzed: de yang sa brgyad pa nyid las /
translated: Moreover, the Astasahasrikaprajñāpāramitā says,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyan du mas rab tu brgyan cing shin tu grubs  pa'i byin gyi rlabs yang dag par bstan pa'i yo byad kyi dbang rab tu thob po zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyan du mas rab tu brgyan cing shin tu grubs  pa'i byin gyi rlabs yang dag par bstan pa'i yo byad kyi dbang rab tu thob po zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: “One obtains the power of the means of demonstrating the transformation and perfection of all world-realms adorned with many ornaments.”

original: sems can smin par mkhas pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can smin par mkhas pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And skilled in ripening beings.

original: sa dgu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba la mkhas pa'i gang zag ces bya ste /
analyzed: sa dgu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba la mkhas pa'i gang zag ces bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the ninth stage is called the person who is skilled in ripening beings.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sa dgu pa thob pa'i tshe so so yang dag par rig pa shin tu rnam par dag pa thob pa'i blo dang ldan pas rnam pa thams cad du sems can gyi don byed nus pa'i phyir sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la mkhas pa'i gang zag
analyzed: sa dgu pa thob pa'i tshe so so yang dag par rig pa shin tu rnam par dag pa thob pa'i blo dang ldan pas rnam pa thams cad du sems can gyi don byed nus pa'i phyir sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la mkhas pa'i gang zag
translated: Because when he has attained the ninth stage, he is endowed with the intelligence that has attained the very pure analytical knowledges and is thus able to work for the welfare of beings in every way.

original: ces bya'o // de bas na sa dgu pa nyid las kyang /
analyzed: ces bya'o // de bas na sa dgu pa nyid las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the same text, the Sutra of the Ten Stages, says of the ninth stage itself:

original: sa dge ba'i blo gros la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos smra ba chen po'i go 'phang la gnas shing de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mdzod yongs su bsrungs pa yin /
analyzed: sa dge ba'i blo gros la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos smra ba chen po'i go 'phang la gnas shing de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mdzod yongs su bsrungs pa yin /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the stage of Good Intelligence is established in the state of a great Dharma teacher and is the protector of the Tathagata's treasure of the Dharma.

original: de chos smra ba'i tshul dang ldan pas ye shes la mkhas pa tshad med pa rjes su song zhing so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gis chos ston te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de chos smra ba'i tshul dang ldan pas ye shes la mkhas pa tshad med pa rjes su song zhing so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gis chos ston te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: He teaches the Dharma with the speech of a bodhisattva who is endowed with the method of expounding the Dharma, who has attained immeasurable expertise in wisdom, and who has accomplished the four right discriminations.

original: rdzu 'phrul che lus kyang kun rdzob ston par nus te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul che lus kyang kun rdzob ston par nus te /
translated: He is able to display a great magical body and a conventional body.

original: dbang bskur byang chub sems dpar 'gyur //
analyzed: dbang bskur byang chub sems dpar 'gyur //
translated: He becomes a bodhisattva who has received empowerment.

original: @250b zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @250b zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni ming du rdzu 'phrul che ba dang lus kun rdzob ston par nus pa dang dbang bskur ba thob pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni ming du rdzu 'phrul che ba dang lus kun rdzob ston par nus pa dang dbang bskur ba thob pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva who is on the tenth stage is called “one who has great magical power,” “one who is able to display a conventional body,” and “one who has received empowerment.”

original: de la sa bcu pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams rdzu 'phrul chen por rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la sa bcu pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams rdzu 'phrul chen por rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: On the tenth stage, the bodhisattvas are considered to have great magical power.

original: sa de la gnas pa'i tshe thogs pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa chen po thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa de la gnas pa'i tshe thogs pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa chen po thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that time, when they are on that stage, they have attained the great, unobstructed, higher knowledges.

original: de bas na sa bcu pa nyid las kyang mngon par shes pas mngon par bsgrub pas brgya stong rab tu 'thob po zhes gsungs pa dang 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams dog pa yangs par byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: de bas na sa bcu pa nyid las kyang mngon par shes pas mngon par bsgrub pas brgya stong rab tu 'thob po zhes gsungs pa dang 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams dog pa yangs par byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: And: “If one wishes, one can bless a narrow world-system to be vast,🔽and a vast world-system to be just right.”

original: 'jig rten gyi khams yangs pa yang dag par byin gyis rlob bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams yangs pa yang dag par byin gyis rlob bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: sa bcu pa la chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs par yang rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: sa bcu pa la chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs par yang rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The perfection of the Dharma body is also presented on the tenth level.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos kyi sku thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang gzungs kyi sgo tshad med pa thob pas byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi sgo ni sa bcur rdzogs so /
analyzed: chos kyi sku thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang gzungs kyi sgo tshad med pa thob pas byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi sgo ni sa bcur rdzogs so /
translated: Because the bodhisattva has perfected the Dharma door on the ten levels by attaining the immeasurable doors of samādhi and dhāraṇī, which are the causes for attaining the Dharma body.

original: // / de bas na sa bcu pa las kye rgyal ba'i sras de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo bcu po de dag la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo brgya🔽stong grangs med pa rab tu 'thob po //
analyzed: // / de bas na sa bcu pa las kye rgyal ba'i sras de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo bcu po de dag la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo brgya stong grangs med pa rab tu 'thob po //
translated: such as these ten doors of liberation of the bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin brgya stong dang gzugs brgya stong 'thob po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin brgya stong dang gzugs brgya stong 'thob po zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the same way, he attains hundreds of thousands of samadhis and hundreds of thousands of forms.

original: sa bcu pa la lung bstan par yang rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: sa bcu pa la lung bstan par yang rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: And it is also established that he is prophesied on the tenth stage,

original: sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i tshe dga' ldan gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa dang yum gyi lhums su gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sprul pa'i lus rnam pa sna tshogs ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i tshe dga' ldan gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa dang yum gyi lhums su gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sprul pa'i lus rnam pa sna tshogs ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when he is on the tenth stage, he displays various emanation bodies, such as dwelling in the palace of Tusita and entering the womb of his mother.

original: de lta bas na sa bcu pa nyid las kyang /
analyzed: de lta bas na sa bcu pa nyid las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Dasabhumika itself says:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na /
translated: O son of the victors, the bodhisattva who is on this bodhisattva bhūmi Cloud of Dharma, in one world

original: dga' ldan gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa nas bzung ste /
translated: from the time he is in the Tuṣita Palace

original: 'pho ba dang gshegs pa dang / lhums na zhugs pa dang / bltams pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / bskul ba @251a * //
analyzed: 'pho ba dang gshegs pa dang / lhums na zhugs pa dang / bltams pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / bskul ba @251a * //
translated: up to his passing away, his descent into his mother’s womb, his birth, his departure from home, his enlightenment,

original: dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i sa zhes bya ba'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa thams cad sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba dang 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du byin gyis rlob bo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i sa zhes bya ba'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa thams cad sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba dang 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du byin gyis rlob bo zhes gsungs so //
translated: his entreaty to turn the wheel of Dharma, and his great parinirvāṇa, he empowers all the deeds of the tathāgatas in accordance with the thoughts and the discipline of sentient beings.

original: sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i tshe sangs rgyas su dbang bskur ba thob pa zhes kyang rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i tshe sangs rgyas su dbang bskur ba thob pa zhes kyang rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: When he is on the tenth bhūmi, he is also posited as having attained the empowerment of a buddha.

original: sa de thob ma thag tu phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'od zer gyis chos kyi rgyal po'i rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa de thob ma thag tu phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'od zer gyis chos kyi rgyal po'i rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As soon as they attain this level, all the tathagatas of the ten directions confer empowerment on them with their light rays, empowering them as regents of the Dharma king.

original: de bas na sa bcu pa nyid las /
analyzed: de bas na sa bcu pa nyid las /
translated: Thus, the Ten Spiritual Levels itself says:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de sa dgu pa'i bar du shes par bya ba tshad med pa yongs su brtags pa'i blos rnam par phye ba /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de sa dgu pa'i bar du shes par bya ba tshad med pa yongs su brtags pa'i blos rnam par phye ba /
translated: O children of the buddhas, in this way, up to the ninth bodhisattva level, the bodhisattvas have investigated immeasurable objects of knowledge with their intellect,

original: shin tu rnam par phye ba /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par phye ba /
translated: have analyzed them

original: chos dkar po shin tu rdzogs pa /
analyzed: chos dkar po shin tu rdzogs pa /
translated: and have perfected the positive qualities.

original: bsags par bya ba'i tshogs mtha' yas pa shin tu bsags pa /
analyzed: bsags par bya ba'i tshogs mtha' yas pa shin tu bsags pa /
translated: They have accumulated the infinite accumulations that are to be gathered

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su zin pa /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su zin pa /
translated: and are supported by the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: snying rje chen po shin tu yangs pa thob pa /
analyzed: snying rje chen po shin tu yangs pa thob pa /
translated: They have attained the vast expanse of great compassion.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par phye ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par phye ba /
translated: They have analyzed the worlds

original: rnam pa tha dad pa la mkhas la sems can gyi khams thibs pos nye bar spyod pa la rab tu bzhugs pa /
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa la mkhas la sems can gyi khams thibs pos nye bar spyod pa la rab tu bzhugs pa /
translated: and are skilled in their different aspects, yet they remain in the experience of the dense array of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul la 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i 'du shes dang yid la byed pa can stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos la lhag par dmigs pa'i rjes su song ba ni rnam pa thams cad du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul la 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i 'du shes dang yid la byed pa can stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos la lhag par dmigs pa'i rjes su song ba ni rnam pa thams cad du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes
translated: Those who have the perception and attention that engages the domain of the tathagatas, who have attained the power of the fearlessnesses and the special focus on the qualities of the Buddha, who have attained the gnosis of omniscience in all ways,🔽are said to have attained the level of empowerment into omniscience.

original: su dbang bskur ba'i sa thob pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang de mngon du gyur ma thag tu stong gsum brgya stong phrag bcu'i tha gru dang mnyam pa'i rin po che'i padmo chen po'i rgyal po las byung ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: su dbang bskur ba'i sa thob pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang de mngon du gyur ma thag tu stong gsum brgya stong phrag bcu'i tha gru dang mnyam pa'i rin po che'i padmo chen po'i rgyal po las byung ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: And as soon as they have attained that, they are born from a great king of lotuses made of jewels, with a size equal to that of a billion three-thousandfold world systems, up to...

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i bu thu bo //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i bu thu bo //
translated: O children of the Victorious One, it is like this. For example, the eldest son of a universal monarch,

original: gzhon nu btsun mo dam pa las btsas pa rgyal po'i mtshan dang ldan pa de 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pos lha rdzas kyi glang po rin po che gser gyi khri dam pa la gzhag ste /
analyzed: gzhon nu btsun mo dam pa las btsas pa rgyal po'i mtshan dang ldan pa de 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pos lha rdzas kyi glang po rin po che gser gyi khri dam pa la gzhag ste /
translated: The son born from the excellent queen, who bears the marks of a king, is placed by the universal monarch on a precious, excellent golden throne.

original: steng nas bla re bre zhing gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang / rol mo brdung ba dang / dkrol ba dang / glu'i dbyangs la @251b sogs pa rgya chen po ste /
analyzed: steng nas bla re bre zhing gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang / rol mo brdung ba dang / dkrol ba dang / glu'i dbyangs la @251b sogs pa rgya chen po ste /
translated: Above him, a canopy is spread, and he is presented with a parasol, a victory banner, musical instruments, songs, and so on, on a vast scale.

original: rgya mtsho chen po bzhi las chu blangs pa gser gyi bum pas bcus te /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po bzhi las chu blangs pa gser gyi bum pas bcus te /
translated: Water is taken from the four great oceans, and it is poured into a golden vase.

original: chu des gzhon nu de'i spyi bo nas mngon par dbang bskur na /
analyzed: chu des gzhon nu de'i spyi bo nas mngon par dbang bskur na /
translated: With that water, the prince is consecrated on his head.

original: dbang bskur ma thag tu de ni rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ma thag tu de ni rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
translated: Immediately after the consecration, he is counted as a king who is a member of the ruling class and has been consecrated on the crown of his head.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs nas ni 'khor los sgyur bar bgrang ba rab tu 'thob po //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs nas ni 'khor los sgyur bar bgrang ba rab tu 'thob po //
translated: After completing the path of the ten virtuous actions, he attains the status of a universal monarch.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis dbang bskur ma thag tu ye shes kyi dbang mngon par bskur bas dbang bskur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis dbang bskur ma thag tu ye shes kyi dbang mngon par bskur bas dbang bskur zhes bya'o //
translated: O sons of the victors, in the same way, as soon as the bodhisattvas are consecrated by those buddha bhagavans, they are said to be consecrated by the consecration of the consecration of exalted pristine awareness.

original: stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs nas ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi grangs su 'gro'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs nas ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi grangs su 'gro'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Having perfected the ten powers, they enter the category of perfect buddhas.

original: sa bcu rnams la /
analyzed: sa bcu rnams la /
translated: On the ten grounds,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams su rnam par gzhag ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams su rnam par gzhag ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: the bodhisattvas are posited.

original: sa 'di thob pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: sa 'di thob pa'i tshe na /
translated: When they attain this ground,

original: sa thob pa'i gang zag de'i ming 'di skad ces bya'o zhes rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: sa thob pa'i gang zag de'i ming 'di skad ces bya'o zhes rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: the person who has attained the ground is called by this name.

original: sa bcu rnams la byang chub sems dpa' rnams su rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bcu rnams la byang chub sems dpa' rnams su rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The positing of the bodhisattvas on the ten grounds is called the positing of the bodhisattvas on the ten grounds.

original: gang zag dang chos su lta ba'i gnyen po'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos su lta ba'i gnyen po'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they attain the pristine awareness that is the antidote to the views of the person and phenomena.

original: gang zag dang chos su lta ba'i gnyen po'i ye shes ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos su lta ba'i gnyen po'i ye shes ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
translated: The wisdom that is the antidote to the views of the person and phenomena is the nonconceptual wisdom.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob ces bya ba'i don to //🔽bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sa gsum pa thob phan chad /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob ces bya ba'i don to // bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sa gsum pa thob phan chad /
translated: The meaning of “attains nonconceptual wisdom” is that.🔽Because he attains the absence of loss of meditative stabilization and concentration.

original: tshe brjes kyang bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin thob pa las nyams pa mi 'byung bas na /
analyzed: tshe brjes kyang bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin thob pa las nyams pa mi 'byung bas na /
translated: From the time he attains the third ground, even if he changes lives, he does not lose the meditative stabilization and concentration he has attained.

original: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the absence of loss of meditative stabilization and concentration.

original: mdo la la sogs pa sna tshogs pa nga rgyal spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo la la sogs pa sna tshogs pa nga rgyal spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because he abandons pride in various things such as sutras.

original: sa gsum pa'i dus na tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi phyir yang /
analyzed: sa gsum pa'i dus na tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi phyir yang /
translated: At the time of the third ground, even for the sake of a single verse of Dharma,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams me ma mur gyis gang ba'i nang du tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas bdag nyid dor bar spro ba'i sems de lta bu yang sa bzhi pa thob pa na /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams me ma mur gyis gang ba'i nang du tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas bdag nyid dor bar spro ba'i sems de lta bu yang sa bzhi pa thob pa na /
translated: He is eager to throw himself from the Brahma world into a great trichiliocosm filled with fire.

original: sems de yang g-yeng ba dang nga rgyal can du byed pa yin no zhes /🔽sa bzhi ba'i dus na de yang spangs nas byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa la @252a * //
analyzed: sems de yang g-yeng ba dang nga rgyal can du byed pa yin no zhes / sa bzhi ba'i dus na de yang spangs nas byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa la @252a * //
translated: Such a thought is also a distraction and a form of pride.

original: sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: sbyor bar byed do //
translated: When he attains the fourth stage, he abandons that thought and applies himself to the practice of the factors of enlightenment.

original: lnga pa la rgyud kyi bye brag med pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lnga pa la rgyud kyi bye brag med pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: On the fifth stage, there is no longer any difference in their spiritual genes.

original: sa lnga pa thob pa'i dus na sems kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa bcu rnyed pas dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang bdag tu sems kyi rgyud gcig par mthong bas na rgyud kyi bye brag la nga rgyal med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa lnga pa thob pa'i dus na sems kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa bcu rnyed pas dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang bdag tu sems kyi rgyud gcig par mthong bas na rgyud kyi bye brag la nga rgyal med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When he attains the fifth stage, he obtains ten pure attitudes of mind, and he sees the gene of his own mind as identical with the gene of the Tathagatas of the three times. Therefore, there is no longer any difference in their spiritual genes.

original: drug pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bye brag la nga rgyal med pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: drug pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bye brag la nga rgyal med pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: On the sixth, he is free of pride with regard to the distinctions of complete afflictions and complete purification.

original: sa drug pa thob pa na /🔽ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sa drug pa thob pa na / ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa la /
translated: When he attains the sixth bhumi,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su mi sems /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su mi sems /
translated: he does not think in terms of the side of complete afflictions, such as “Conditioned by ignorance, there are karmic actions,”

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa la sogs pa /
translated: and he does not think in terms of the side of complete purification, such as “When ignorance is stopped, karmic action is stopped.”

original: dkar po'i phyogs su mi sems pas na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la nga rgyal med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs su mi sems pas na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la nga rgyal med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore he is said to be free of pride with regard to the side of complete afflictions and complete purification.🔽Why is he free of pride?

original: ci'i phyir nga rgyal med ce na de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid la gnas pa mang bas rang bzhin rnam par dag pa la brten te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nga rgyal med ce na de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid la gnas pa mang bas rang bzhin rnam par dag pa la brten te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “Because he is often abiding in the suchness of dependent origination, he is based on natural purity,” and so on.

original: sa drug pa thob pa'i dus na /
analyzed: sa drug pa thob pa'i dus na /
translated: When he attains the sixth bhumi,

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i stong pa nyid skye 'gag med pa'i don la sgom zhing gnas pa mang bas stong pa nyid la ni dkar po'i phyogs dang / nag po'i phyogs zhes rnam pa gnyis su gzhag tu med kyi /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i stong pa nyid skye 'gag med pa'i don la sgom zhing gnas pa mang bas stong pa nyid la ni dkar po'i phyogs dang / nag po'i phyogs zhes rnam pa gnyis su gzhag tu med kyi /
translated: Since they meditate and dwell a lot on the meaning of emptiness, the emptiness of dependent origination, as being without arising and ceasing, emptiness is not posited as having two aspects, a white aspect and a black aspect.

original: stong pa nyid ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin pas rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i chos la ni ma rig pa sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs ni nag po'i phyogs su ma mthong la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin pas rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i chos la ni ma rig pa sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs ni nag po'i phyogs su ma mthong la /
translated: Since emptiness is pure by nature, in a phenomenon that is pure by nature, the aspect of thorough affliction, such as ignorance, is not seen as a black aspect.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la ni dkar po'i phyogs su ma mthong ba na /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la ni dkar po'i phyogs su ma mthong ba na /
translated: And in the aspect of complete purification, such as the cessation of compositional activity due to the cessation of ignorance, and so on, a white aspect is not seen.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bye brag la nga rgyal med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bye brag la nga rgyal med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “absence of pride with regard to the distinctions of complete affliction and complete purification.”

original: btang snyoms dang ni zhing rnam par sbyong ba ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms dang ni zhing rnam par sbyong ba ste /
translated: Equanimity and the purification of realms.

original: mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the spontaneous accomplishment of signlessness is stabilized.

original: sa brgyad pa thob pa'i dus na btang snyoms sbyong ba dang zhing rnam par sbyong bar gzhag ste de'i tshe rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir btang snyoms sbyong bar gzhag go //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa thob pa'i dus na btang snyoms sbyong ba dang zhing rnam par sbyong bar gzhag ste de'i tshe rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir btang snyoms sbyong bar gzhag go //
