translated: When the eighth stage is attained, one is established in the purification of equanimity and the purification of the realm. At that time, one is established in the purification of equanimity because one attains the spontaneous concentration of nonconceptuality.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan pa kun du @252b ston pa'i phyir zhing rnam par sbyong bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan pa kun du @252b ston pa'i phyir zhing rnam par sbyong bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: One is established in the purification of the realm because one displays the entire world-system as adorned with the seven precious substances.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'dres shing nye bar 'dres par sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'dres shing nye bar 'dres par sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because one is mixed and thoroughly mixed with the bodhisattvas who have entered the stage of nonregression.

original: sa brgyad pa thob nas brgyad pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang rang bzhin gcig cing phrin las gcig par gyur pas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'dres shing nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa thob nas brgyad pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang rang bzhin gcig cing phrin las gcig par gyur pas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'dres shing nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having attained the eighth level, they are of the same nature and have the same activity as the bodhisattvas who have entered the eighth level, so they are said to be mingled and fully mingled with the bodhisattvas who have entered the irreversible levels.

original: gong du sa bdun pa la yang 'dres shing nye bar 'dres pa zhes bshad pa dang / 'dir sa brgyad pa'i skabs su 'dres shing nye bar 'dres pa zhes bshad pa gnyis la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gong du sa bdun pa la yang 'dres shing nye bar 'dres pa zhes bshad pa dang / 'dir sa brgyad pa'i skabs su 'dres shing nye bar 'dres pa zhes bshad pa gnyis la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the mingling and full mingling explained above in the section on the seventh level and the mingling and full mingling explained here in the section on the eighth level?

original: bye brag yod de gong du sa bdun pa'i tshe na sa brgyad pa dang 'brel pas 'dres shing nye bar 'dres pa zhes bshad la /
analyzed: bye brag yod de gong du sa bdun pa'i tshe na sa brgyad pa dang 'brel pas 'dres shing nye bar 'dres pa zhes bshad la /
translated: There is a difference. Previously, on the seventh level, they were explained as mingling and fully mingling because they were connected with the eighth level.

original: 'dir ni sa brgyad pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni sa brgyad pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: Here, however, the bodhisattvas have attained the eighth level.

original: sa brgyad pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang bzhin gcig cing phrin las gcig tu gyur pas na 'dres pa dang rab tu 'dres pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang bzhin gcig cing phrin las gcig tu gyur pas na 'dres pa dang rab tu 'dres pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the bodhisattvas who have attained the eighth level are mixed and thoroughly mixed with the buddhas because they have the same nature and the same activity.

original: sa dgu pa la ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la mkhas pa snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa dgu pa la ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la mkhas pa snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: On the ninth level, they are skilled in bringing sentient beings to full maturity, as before.

original: sa dgu pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la mkhas pa'i gang zag ces gzhag ste /
analyzed: sa dgu pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la mkhas pa'i gang zag ces gzhag ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas who have attained the ninth level are called individuals who are skilled in bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: de'i don yang sngar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pas na sems can du smin par byed pa'i mthu yod do zhes bshad pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de'i don yang sngar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pas na sems can du smin par byed pa'i mthu yod do zhes bshad pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The meaning of that is like what was explained earlier, namely, that because they have attained the four detailed and thorough knowledges, they have the power to bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: mngon par shes pa chen po thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa chen po thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they have attained the great superknowledges.

original: sa bcu pa'i tshe rdul phra mo gcig tsam yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tsam du cher spro bar byed pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tsam yang rdul phra mo gcig tsam du chud du sdud cing mngon par shes pa thob pas na /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i tshe rdul phra mo gcig tsam yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tsam du cher spro bar byed pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tsam yang rdul phra mo gcig tsam du chud du sdud cing mngon par shes pa thob pas na /
translated: At the time of the tenth stage, they can expand even a single atom to the size of a great trichiliocosm, and they can cause even a great trichiliocosm to enter into a single atom.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen por rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen por rnam par gzhag go //
translated: They have attained the superknowledges, and so they are classified as having great miraculous powers.

original: chos kyi sku kun du rdzogs pa dang zhes bya ba la /🔽sa bcu pa'i tshe chos kyi sku'i rgyu ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dpag tu med pa dang gzungs kyi sgo dpag tu med pa thob pas na byang chub sems @253a * //
analyzed: chos kyi sku kun du rdzogs pa dang zhes bya ba la / sa bcu pa'i tshe chos kyi sku'i rgyu ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dpag tu med pa dang gzungs kyi sgo dpag tu med pa thob pas na byang chub sems @253a * //
translated: The complete dharmakāya

original: dpa'i chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: dpa'i chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba rnam par gzhag go //
translated: At the time of the tenth stage, they have attained the countless doors of meditative absorption and the countless doors of dhāraṇī that are the causes of the dharmakāya, and so they are classified as having the complete dharmakāya of the bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas su dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The empowerment of buddhahood

original: sa bcu pa'i tshe phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'od zer gyis /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i tshe phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'od zer gyis /
translated: At the time of the tenth stage, all the tathāgatas of the ten directions confer the empowerment of the great vajra.

original: chos kyi rgyal po'i rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur bar mdzad pas na sangs rgyas su dbang bskur ba zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po'i rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur bar mdzad pas na sangs rgyas su dbang bskur ba zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is called “empowerment into buddhahood” because he is empowered as the regent of the king of the Dharma.

original: bslab pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa lnga'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bslab pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa lnga'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Five verses on the topic of the arrangement of the trainings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa ni gsum ste /
translated: The bodhisattva’s training is threefold:

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: the training in the higher morality, the training in the higher mind, and the training in the higher wisdom.

original: de la sa bcu pa thams cad na yang bslab pa 'di gsum la slob ste /
analyzed: de la sa bcu pa thams cad na yang bslab pa 'di gsum la slob ste /
translated: On all ten stages, he trains in these three trainings.

original: de bas na sa gang la bslab pa gang slob pa'i dbang du byas nas tshigs su bcad pa lnga ston to //🔽chos nyid rab tu rtogs nas 'dir //
analyzed: de bas na sa gang la bslab pa gang slob pa'i dbang du byas nas tshigs su bcad pa lnga ston to // chos nyid rab tu rtogs nas 'dir //
translated: Therefore, five verses are taught with reference to the stage and the training.🔽Having realized reality, he trains here

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims rjes su slob//🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims rjes su slob//🔽ces bya ba la /
translated: in the higher morality.

original: sa dang por gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'i chos nyid rab tu rtogs nas /
analyzed: sa dang por gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'i chos nyid rab tu rtogs nas /
translated: Having fully realized the reality of the no self of persons and the no self of phenomena on the first ground,

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sa gnyis pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sa gnyis pa dang sbyar te /
translated: here, which is connected to the second ground,

original: de nas sa gnyis par lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa slob po zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽'di ltar sa dang po la yang lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yod mod kyi de'i tshe na ma bsams ma brtags par ltung ba dang nyes pa pho mo dag 'byung bas tshul khrims rnams par dag pa ma yin gyi sa gnyis pa la ni gnyid kyis
analyzed: de nas sa gnyis par lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa slob po zhes bya ba'i don to // 'di ltar sa dang po la yang lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yod mod kyi de'i tshe na ma bsams ma brtags par ltung ba dang nyes pa pho mo dag 'byung bas tshul khrims rnams par dag pa ma yin gyi sa gnyis pa la ni gnyid kyis
translated: one then trains in the higher training of superior discipline.

original: log pa'i rmi lam du 'di kha na ma tho ba'i las la 'jug pa mi rmi bas /
analyzed: log pa'i rmi lam du 'di kha na ma tho ba'i las la 'jug pa mi rmi bas /
translated: Thus, although the higher training of superior discipline exists on the first ground, at that time, downfalls and faults occur without being thought out or examined, so discipline is not completely pure. But on the second ground, even in dreams, one does not engage in downfalls.

original: de'i tshe bslab pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la rjes su slob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe bslab pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la rjes su slob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, at that time, because the training is completely pure, it is called the training in the higher discipline.

original: lhag sems zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag sems zhes bya ba la /
translated: Superior mind.

original: sa gsum thob pa'i dus na bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa thob pas lhag pa'i sems la rjes su slob pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sa gsum thob pa'i dus na bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa thob pas lhag pa'i sems la rjes su slob pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: When one has attained the third stage, one is said to be training in superior mind, because one has attained the meditative concentrations and meditative attainments without degeneration.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab la zhes bya ba la sa bzhi pa dang lnga pa dang drug pa la ni lhag pa'i shes rab la slob par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab la zhes bya ba la sa bzhi pa dang lnga pa dang drug pa la ni lhag pa'i shes rab la slob par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: One is said to be training in superior wisdom on the fourth, fifth, and sixth stages.

original: ji ltar zhe na sa bzhi pa'i dus na ni byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa gsum gyis zin cing byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas lhag @253b pa'i shes rab la slob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na sa bzhi pa'i dus na ni byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa gsum gyis zin cing byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas lhag @253b pa'i shes rab la slob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: How so? At the time of the fourth stage, one is said to be training in superior wisdom, because one is endowed with the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment and the wisdom of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: sa lnga pa dang drug pa la ji ltar lhag pa'i shes rab la slob pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa lnga pa dang drug pa la ji ltar lhag pa'i shes rab la slob pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how one trains in superior wisdom on the fifth and sixth stages, it says:

original: shes rab spyod yul rnam gnyis te //
analyzed: shes rab spyod yul rnam gnyis te //
translated: The domain of wisdom is twofold:

original: chos kyi de mi shes pa dang / shes pas ldog pa de bzhin te //
analyzed: chos kyi de mi shes pa dang / shes pas ldog pa de bzhin te //
translated: The non-understanding of phenomena and the understanding of non-understanding.

original: shes rab spyod yul de yi phyir //
analyzed: shes rab spyod yul de yi phyir //
translated: Because of that, the domain of wisdom

original: sa gnyis la de rnam gzhag go //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sa gnyis la de rnam gzhag go // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The second stage is their arrangement.

original: de ltar sa lnga pa dang drug pa la lhag pa'i shes rab la slob pa yang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi spyod yul rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ltar sa lnga pa dang drug pa la lhag pa'i shes rab la slob pa yang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi spyod yul rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Thus, on the fifth and sixth stages, the bodhisattva trains in higher wisdom. The domain of higher wisdom is twofold:

original: chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste de gnyis spyod yul rnam pa gcig go //🔽mi shes pas 'jug pa dang shes pas ldog pa ste rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba lugs bzhin dang lugs las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste de gnyis spyod yul rnam pa gcig go // mi shes pas 'jug pa dang shes pas ldog pa ste rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba lugs bzhin dang lugs las bzlog pa ste /
translated: the reality of phenomena and the four noble truths.

original: shes rab kyi spyod yul rnam pa gnyis po de chos kyi de bzhin nyid ni chos rnams kyi mnyam pa stong pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi spyod yul rnam pa gnyis po de chos kyi de bzhin nyid ni chos rnams kyi mnyam pa stong pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: The reality of phenomena is the equality of phenomena, which is emptiness.

original: bden pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam la bya ste /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam la bya ste /
translated: The four noble truths are suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: sa lnga pa'i dus na sems kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid thob pa dang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la gnas shing bsgom pas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la slob par bshad do //
analyzed: sa lnga pa'i dus na sems kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid thob pa dang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la gnas shing bsgom pas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la slob par bshad do //
translated: At the time of the fifth bhumi, one obtains the sameness of the completely pure attitude and one trains in the higher training of wisdom by abiding in and cultivating the four noble truths.

original: mi shes pas 'jug pa ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba lugs las 'byung ba dang / shes pas ldog pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs las bzlog pa la bya ste /
analyzed: mi shes pas 'jug pa ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba lugs las 'byung ba dang / shes pas ldog pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs las bzlog pa la bya ste /
translated: Engaging through ignorance refers to the forward progression of dependent origination, from the condition of ignorance, the karmic process and so on, and reversing through knowledge refers to the reverse progression of dependent origination.

original: sa drug pa'i dus na yang rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba lugs bzhin dang lugs las bzlog pa la /
analyzed: sa drug pa'i dus na yang rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba lugs bzhin dang lugs las bzlog pa la /
translated: At the time of the sixth bhumi, one abides in and cultivates dependent origination in its forward and reverse progressions.

original: mang du gnas shing bsgoms pas na lhag pa'i shes rab la slob pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: mang du gnas shing bsgoms pas na lhag pa'i shes rab la slob pa zhes bshad de /
translated: Therefore it is explained that one trains in the higher training of wisdom.

original: 'di ltar lhag pa'i shes rab kyi spyod yul rnam pa gnyis las sa lnga pa'i dus na ni lhag pa'i shes rab des chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang bden pa bzhi la dmigs /
analyzed: 'di ltar lhag pa'i shes rab kyi spyod yul rnam pa gnyis las sa lnga pa'i dus na ni lhag pa'i shes rab des chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang bden pa bzhi la dmigs /
translated: Thus, in terms of the two objects of the perfection of wisdom, on the fifth ground, the bodhisattva focuses on the suchness of phenomena and the four noble truths with the perfection of wisdom.

original: sa drug pa'i dus na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba lugs bzhin dang lugs las bzlog pa la dmigs pas nas lnga pa dang drug pa gnyis la yang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la slob par gzhag go //🔽bslab pa rnams dang bsgom pa yi //
analyzed: sa drug pa'i dus na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba lugs bzhin dang lugs las bzlog pa la dmigs pas nas lnga pa dang drug pa gnyis la yang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la slob par gzhag go // bslab pa rnams dang bsgom pa yi //
translated: On the sixth ground, he focuses on dependent origination in forward and reverse progressions. Thus, the bodhisattva is said to train in the training of the perfection of wisdom on both the fifth and sixth grounds.🔽The other results of training and meditation

original: 'bras bu gzhan ni rnam pa bzhi //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan ni rnam pa bzhi // zhes bya ba la /
translated: are the four kinds of thorough cognition.

original: gzhan @254a * //
analyzed: gzhan @254a * //
translated: The other

original: gyi sgra ni sa bdun pa dang brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu ba la bya bar snyegs te /
analyzed: gyi sgra ni sa bdun pa dang brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu ba la bya bar snyegs te /
translated: refers to the seventh, eighth, ninth, and tenth grounds.

original: sa de bzhi la bslab pa gsum la bslab pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi thob par rig par bya ba'i don to //🔽mtshan ma med dang 'du byed bcas //
analyzed: sa de bzhi la bslab pa gsum la bslab pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi thob par rig par bya ba'i don to // mtshan ma med dang 'du byed bcas //
translated: The meaning is that on these four grounds, the bodhisattva attains the four kinds of results of training in the three trainings.

original: gnas pa 'bras bu dang po'o //
analyzed: gnas pa 'bras bu dang po'o //
translated: The first result is the state of🔽nonconceptuality and the state of effortless accomplishment.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: 'bras bu bzhi las 'bras bu dang po ni mtshan ma med pa 'du byed dang bcas par gnas te /
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi las 'bras bu dang po ni mtshan ma med pa 'du byed dang bcas par gnas te /
translated: from among the four results, the first result is abiding in signlessness with effort.

original: sa bdun pa'i dus na 'bad pa dang brtsal bar bcas pas /
analyzed: sa bdun pa'i dus na 'bad pa dang brtsal bar bcas pas /
translated: At the time of the seventh ground, because of cultivating nonconceptual samādhi with effort and exertion,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsgom pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa la 'du byed pa dang bcas par gnas pa zhes bya ba ste 'di ni 'bras bu rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsgom pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa la 'du byed pa dang bcas par gnas pa zhes bya ba ste 'di ni 'bras bu rnam pa gcig go //
translated: it is called “abiding in signlessness with effort.” This is the first result.

original: de nyid 'du byed med pa'i 'bras bu gnyis su 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'du byed med pa'i 'bras bu gnyis su 'dod pa'o //
translated: That itself is asserted as the second result, which is without effort.

original: de nyid kyi sgras mtshan ma med pa la snyegs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi sgras mtshan ma med pa la snyegs te /
translated: The word “that” refers to signlessness.

original: sa brgyad pa'i dus na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la brtsal 'bad med par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du gnas shing bsgom ste /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa'i dus na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la brtsal 'bad med par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du gnas shing bsgom ste /
translated: At the time of the eighth ground, nonconceptual samādhi is cultivated without effort and exertion, and it is spontaneously accomplished.

original: de ni 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: That is the second result.

original: zhing dag cing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhing dag cing zhes bya ba la /
translated: The line “fields are purified” is the third result.

original: sa brgyad pa'i dus na mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa 'ba' zhig tu gnas par mi zad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par yang byed de de yang 'bras bu gnyis pa'i nang du bsdu'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa'i dus na mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa 'ba' zhig tu gnas par mi zad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par yang byed de de yang 'bras bu gnyis pa'i nang du bsdu'o //
translated: At the time of the eighth stage, one does not just remain in the spontaneous non-conceptuality, but also purifies the Buddha-fields. That is included in the second result.

original: sems can rnams smin pas 'grub pa nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can rnams smin pas 'grub pa nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: And also the accomplishment of bringing beings to maturity.

original: sa dgu pa'i dus na so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba grub ste /
analyzed: sa dgu pa'i dus na so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba grub ste /
translated: At the time of the ninth stage, one accomplishes the bringing of beings to maturity by attaining the four discriminations.

original: de ni 'bras bu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu gsum pa'o //
translated: That is the third result.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang gzugs rnams kyang //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang gzugs rnams kyang //
translated: And also the accomplishment of meditative stabilizations and Dharanis

original: 'grub pa 'bras bu mchog yin no //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'grub pa 'bras bu mchog yin no // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is the supreme result.

original: sa bcu pa la ting nge 'dzin mchog dang gzungs mchog rnams kyi 'bras bu 'grub ste /
analyzed: sa bcu pa la ting nge 'dzin mchog dang gzungs mchog rnams kyi 'bras bu 'grub ste /
translated: At the tenth stage, one accomplishes the supreme meditative stabilizations and the supreme Dharanis.

original: de ni 'bras bu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu bzhi pa'o //
translated: That is the fourth result.

original: 'bras bu bzhi po 'di dag ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi po 'di dag ni //
translated: These four results

original: sa bzhi dag la shin tu gnas //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa bzhi dag la shin tu gnas //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: are well-established in the four stages.

original: bslab pa gsum gyi 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi po dag ni sa bzhi dag gi dus na rim bzhin du thob pas na sa bzhi dag la rim bzhin du gnas ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum gyi 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi po dag ni sa bzhi dag gi dus na rim bzhin du thob pas na sa bzhi dag la rim bzhin du gnas ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The four results of the three trainings are obtained in order on the four stages, so they are called the four abodes in order.

original: de yang sa bdun pa la ni mtshan ma med pa la 'du byed pa dang bcas par gnas pa'i 'bras bu 'thob po //
analyzed: de yang sa bdun pa la ni mtshan ma med pa la 'du byed pa dang bcas par gnas pa'i 'bras bu 'thob po //
translated: Moreover, on the seventh stage, one obtains the result of abiding in the absence of attributes with application.

original: sa brgyad pa la @254b ni mtshan ma med pa la 'du byed pa med pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu 'thob po //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la @254b ni mtshan ma med pa la 'du byed pa med pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu 'thob po //
translated: On the eighth stage, one obtains the result of abiding in the absence of attributes without application.

original: sa dgu pa la ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i 'bras bu 'thob po //
analyzed: sa dgu pa la ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i 'bras bu 'thob po //
translated: On the ninth stage, one obtains the result of bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: sa bcu pa la ni gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin mchog mngon du 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu 'thob po //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la ni gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin mchog mngon du 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu 'thob po //
translated: On the tenth stage, one obtains the result of manifesting the supreme dhāraṇīs and concentrations.

original: sa bzhi pa la ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi yang dag par zin pa'i shes rab po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa la ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi yang dag par zin pa'i shes rab po zhes bya ba la /
translated: On the fourth stage, there is the wisdom of fully embracing the factors of enlightenment.

original: sa bzhi pa'i dus na byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun la sgom par byed pas /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa'i dus na byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun la sgom par byed pas /
translated: On the fourth stage, one cultivates the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab la slob par bshad do //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab la slob par bshad do //
translated: and the explanation of the training in higher wisdom.

original: sa gnyis la yang spyod yul gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa gnyis la yang spyod yul gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two domains of the two stages are the two domains of the two higher trainings.

original: sa lnga pa dang drug pa gnyis pa lhag pa'i shes rab de spyod yul rnam pa gnyis la dmigs te /
analyzed: sa lnga pa dang drug pa gnyis pa lhag pa'i shes rab de spyod yul rnam pa gnyis la dmigs te /
translated: The two stages are the fifth and sixth stages. The higher training in wisdom focuses on two domains.

original: sa lnga pa'i tshe na ni chos kyi de kho na nyid dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bzhi la dmigs so //
analyzed: sa lnga pa'i tshe na ni chos kyi de kho na nyid dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bzhi la dmigs so //
translated: At the time of the fifth stage, it focuses on the reality of phenomena and the four truths such as suffering.

original: sa drug pa'i tshe na ni mi shes pa ste rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs bzhin pa dang / shes pa ste rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs las bzlog pa la dmigs so //
analyzed: sa drug pa'i tshe na ni mi shes pa ste rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs bzhin pa dang / shes pa ste rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs las bzlog pa la dmigs so //
translated: At the time of the sixth stage, it focuses on ignorance, that is, dependent arising in forward order, and on knowledge, that is, dependent arising in reverse order.

original: 'di yan chad bslab pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di yan chad bslab pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: From here on, the four results of the trainings.

original: sa bdun pa dang / brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa man chad bslabs pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi rim bzhin 'thob ste /
analyzed: sa bdun pa dang / brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa man chad bslabs pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi rim bzhin 'thob ste /
translated: From the seventh stage up to the tenth stage, the four results of the trainings are obtained in order.

original: sa bdun pa la ni mtshan ma med pa la mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par gnas pa'i 'bras bu 'thob bo //
analyzed: sa bdun pa la ni mtshan ma med pa la mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par gnas pa'i 'bras bu 'thob bo //
translated: On the seventh stage, one obtains the result of dwelling in the signless with effort.

original: de la 'bras bu gnyis pa ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa ni /🔽de nyid mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang zhing yongs su dag par bya'o zhes bya ba las sa brgyad pa la 'bras bu gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu gnyis pa ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa ni / de nyid mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang zhing yongs su dag par bya'o zhes bya ba las sa brgyad pa la 'bras bu gnyis pa ste /
translated: The second result is the result of dwelling in the signless without effort.

original: mtshan ma med pa la mngon par 'du mi byed par gnas pa dang zhing yongs su dag pa'i 'bras bu 'thob po //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la mngon par 'du mi byed par gnas pa dang zhing yongs su dag pa'i 'bras bu 'thob po //
translated: The second result is on the eighth stage, because one obtains the result of dwelling in the signless without effort and the purification of the field.

original: sa dgu pa la ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i 'bras bu 'thob po //
analyzed: sa dgu pa la ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i 'bras bu 'thob po //
translated: On the ninth stage, one obtains the result of bringing sentient beings to maturity through the four right discriminations.

original: sa bcu pa la ni gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa'i 'bras bu 'thob po //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la ni gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa'i 'bras bu 'thob po //
translated: On the tenth stage, one obtains the result of immeasurable powers of mental retention and concentration.

original: phung po rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams te tshims su bcad pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phung po rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams te tshims su bcad pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two sections beginning with the presentation of the aggregates are the second and third chapters.

original: rnam par grol ba'i phung po lnga rnam pa lnga ste /🔽tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes @255a * //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phung po lnga rnam pa lnga ste / tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes @255a * //
translated: The five aggregates of liberation are fivefold.

original: rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'o //🔽de la sa bcu dang sangs rgyas kyi sa ste /
analyzed: rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'o // de la sa bcu dang sangs rgyas kyi sa ste /
translated: The aggregate of morality, the aggregate of meditative concentration, the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of liberation, and the aggregate of the vision and cognition of liberation.

original: sa bcu gcig pa rnams la /
analyzed: sa bcu gcig pa rnams la /
translated: The eleven stages are the ten stages and the stage of the Buddhas.🔽The five aggregates of liberation are to be known as existing on the eleven stages.

original: sa gang la phung po gang thob par bstan pa ni phung po rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams te zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa gang la phung po gang thob par bstan pa ni phung po rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams te zhes bya ste /
translated: The explanation of which aggregate is obtained on which stage is begun with the presentation of the aggregates.

original: de tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is indicated by the two verses.

original: chos nyid rab tu rtogs na 'dir //
analyzed: chos nyid rab tu rtogs na 'dir //
translated: When one realizes reality,

original: tshul khrims kyi ni phung po sbyong //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi ni phung po sbyong //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: one purifies the aggregate of morality here.🔽The aggregate of morality is purified on the first stage, the Joyous, because one obtains the morality of the vow.

original: sa dang por gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos nyid rab tu rtogs nas sa gnyis pa 'dir tshul khrims kyi phung po rab tu sbyong ste /
analyzed: sa dang por gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos nyid rab tu rtogs nas sa gnyis pa 'dir tshul khrims kyi phung po rab tu sbyong ste /
translated: Having fully realized the reality characterized by the no self of the individual and of phenomena on the first level, on this second level bodhisattvas train in the aggregate of discipline.

original: sa dang po la tshul khrims kyi phung po thob pa yod mod kyi ma bsams par nyes pa phra mo dag 'byung bas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sa dang po la tshul khrims kyi phung po thob pa yod mod kyi ma bsams par nyes pa phra mo dag 'byung bas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Although they have acquired the aggregate of discipline on the first level, since they still commit subtle misdeeds unintentionally, their discipline is not completely pure.

original: sa gnyis pa'i dus na ni rmi lam du yang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i las byed pa mi rmi bas tshul khrims kyi phung po rnam par sbyong bar bshad do //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa'i dus na ni rmi lam du yang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i las byed pa mi rmi bas tshul khrims kyi phung po rnam par sbyong bar bshad do //
translated: But on the second level, they do not dream of committing misdeeds, even in their dreams, and so it is said that they train in the aggregate of discipline.

original: ting 'dzin shes rab phung po ni //
analyzed: ting 'dzin shes rab phung po ni //
translated: The aggregates of concentration and wisdom

original: de dag phan chad rnam sbyong ngo //
analyzed: de dag phan chad rnam sbyong ngo //
translated: are purified on the levels above that.

original: zhes bya ba la de dag phan chad ces bya ba ni sa dang po dang gnyis pa phan chad sa gsum pa dang bzhi pa dang ldan pa dang drug pa rnams la ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po gnyis rnam par sbyong ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de dag phan chad ces bya ba ni sa dang po dang gnyis pa phan chad sa gsum pa dang bzhi pa dang ldan pa dang drug pa rnams la ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po gnyis rnam par sbyong ngo //
translated: The phrase “from the third on up” means that on the third, fourth, and sixth spiritual levels, one purifies both the aggregate of meditative absorption and the aggregate of wisdom.

original: de la yang sa gsum pa la ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po rnam par sbyong ste /
analyzed: de la yang sa gsum pa la ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po rnam par sbyong ste /
translated: On the third spiritual level, one purifies the aggregate of meditative absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pas thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pas thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one attains the meditative absorption of the bodhisattvas that is free of the degeneration of meditative absorption and the degeneration of wisdom.

original: sa bzhi pa dang lnga pa dang drug pa la ni shes rab kyi phung po rnam par spyong ste /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa dang lnga pa dang drug pa la ni shes rab kyi phung po rnam par spyong ste /
translated: On the fourth, fifth, and sixth spiritual levels, one purifies the aggregate of wisdom.

original: sa bzhi pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa dang / sa lnga pa la ni bden pa bzhi bsgom pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa dang / sa drug pa la rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba lugs bzhin pa dang lugs las bzlog pa'i de bzhin nyid la bsgom pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bzhi pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa dang / sa lnga pa la ni bden pa bzhi bsgom pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa dang / sa drug pa la rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba lugs bzhin pa dang lugs las bzlog pa'i de bzhin nyid la bsgom pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fourth level is endowed with the wisdom of cultivating the factors of enlightenment. The fifth level is endowed with the wisdom of cultivating the four noble truths. The sixth level is endowed with the wisdom of cultivating the suchness of dependent origination in forward and reverse progressions.

original: rnam grol rnam grol ye shes kyang //
analyzed: rnam grol rnam grol ye shes kyang //
translated: Liberation and the wisdom of liberation

original: de las gzhan du rnam par sbyong //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las gzhan du rnam par sbyong // zhes bya ba la /
translated: are purified on the other levels.

original: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, “the other levels”

original: gong du bshad pa'i las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i las gzhan pa ste /
translated: are the other activities explained above.

original: sa bdun pa dang brgyad @255b pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa dang sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po gnyis rnam par sbyong ngo //
analyzed: sa bdun pa dang brgyad @255b pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa dang sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po gnyis rnam par sbyong ngo //
translated: On the seventh, eighth, ninth, and tenth levels and the level of buddhahood, the aggregate of liberation and the aggregate of the wisdom of seeing liberation are purified.

original: de la yang sa bdun pa dang brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa la ni rnam par grol ba'i phung po rnam par sbyong ngo //
analyzed: de la yang sa bdun pa dang brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa la ni rnam par grol ba'i phung po rnam par sbyong ngo //
translated: Moreover, on the seventh, eighth, ninth, and tenth spiritual levels, one purifies the aggregate of liberation.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po sbyong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po sbyong ngo //
translated: On the Buddha level, one purifies the aggregate of the vision of the awareness of liberation.

original: de la sa bcun pa dang brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa la ji ltar rnam par grol ba'i phung po sbyong la /
analyzed: de la sa bcun pa dang brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa la ji ltar rnam par grol ba'i phung po sbyong la /
translated: How is it that on the seventh, eighth, ninth, and tenth spiritual levels, one purifies the aggregate of liberation?

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ji ltar rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po rnam par sbyong zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ji ltar rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po rnam par sbyong zhe na /
translated: And how is it that on the Buddha level, one purifies the aggregate of the vision of the awareness of liberation?🔽Therefore he says:

original: de'i phyir sgrib pa rnam par gzhil ba dang / thogs pa'i sgrib pa las kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrib pa rnam par gzhil ba dang / thogs pa'i sgrib pa las kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because of the removal of obscuration and also because of the removal of the obscuration that consists in the impediment to the four kinds of correct knowledge.

original: 'di ltar sa bdun pa dang brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa la ni 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi thob par bya ba la sgrib pa rnam bzhi dag las rnam par grol ba'i phung por rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bdun pa dang brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa la ni 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi thob par bya ba la sgrib pa rnam bzhi dag las rnam par grol ba'i phung por rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, on the seventh, eighth, ninth and tenth spiritual levels, one is established in the aggregate of liberation because of liberation from the four obscurations that are to be relinquished in the attainment of the four kinds of correct knowledge.

original: de la 'bras bu bzhi ni gong du bshad ma thag pa rnams te /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu bzhi ni gong du bshad ma thag pa rnams te /
translated: The four results are as just explained above.

original: sa bdun pa la mtshan ma med pa la mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / sa brgyad pa la mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa'i 'bras bu 'thob cing yongs su sbyong ba dang / sa dgu ba la sems can yongs su smin pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang /
analyzed: sa bdun pa la mtshan ma med pa la mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / sa brgyad pa la mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa'i 'bras bu 'thob cing yongs su sbyong ba dang / sa dgu ba la sems can yongs su smin pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang /
translated: On the seventh ground, one obtains the result of the signless with application. On the eighth ground, one obtains the result of the effortless signless and one perfects it. On the ninth ground, one obtains the result of bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: sa bcu pa la gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa'i 'bras bu 'thob bo //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa'i 'bras bu 'thob bo //
translated: On the tenth ground, one obtains the result of the immeasurability of powers of retention and concentration.

original: 'bras bu de bzhi'i sgrib pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu de bzhi'i sgrib pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are also four kinds of obscurations to these four results.

original: mtshan ma phra mo kun du rgyu bar byed pa dang mtshan ma med pa nyid la mngon par 'du byed pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang chos thams cad la dbang ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma phra mo kun du rgyu bar byed pa dang mtshan ma med pa nyid la mngon par 'du byed pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang chos thams cad la dbang ma thob pa'o //
translated: They are: the subtle signs that are in motion, the application to the signless itself, the nonapplication to the benefit of sentient beings, and the nonobtainment of power over all phenomena.

original: de la sa bdun pa la mtshan ma med pa la mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par gnas pas mtshan ma phra mo kun du sgrib pa dang bral lo ;
analyzed: de la sa bdun pa la mtshan ma med pa la mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par gnas pas mtshan ma phra mo kun du sgrib pa dang bral lo ;
translated: On the seventh ground, the bodhisattva is free from the obscuration that is the subtle signs of the existence of subject and object, because he abides in signlessness with effort.

original: / sa brgyad pa mtshan ma med pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med par gnas pas mtshan ma med pa la mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa dang bral lo //🔽sa dgu pa la sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i 'bras bu grub pas sems can gyi don @256a * //
analyzed: / sa brgyad pa mtshan ma med pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med par gnas pas mtshan ma med pa la mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa dang bral lo // sa dgu pa la sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i 'bras bu grub pas sems can gyi don @256a * //
translated: On the eighth ground, the bodhisattva is free from the obscuration that is the existence of subject and object, because he abides in signlessness without effort.

original: bya ba la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i sgrib pa dang bral lo //
analyzed: bya ba la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i sgrib pa dang bral lo //
translated: On the ninth ground, the bodhisattva is free from the obscuration that is the lack of effort in bringing about the welfare of sentient beings, because he has accomplished the result of bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: sa bcu pa la gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa thob pas chos thams cad la dbang ma thob pa'i sgrib pa dang bral te /
analyzed: sa bcu pa la gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa thob pas chos thams cad la dbang ma thob pa'i sgrib pa dang bral te /
translated: On the tenth ground, the bodhisattva is free from the obscuration that is the lack of mastery over all phenomena, because he has attained immeasurable powers of retention and concentration.

original: de bas nas de dag la ni rnam par grol ba'i phung po rnam par sbyong bar gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas nas de dag la ni rnam par grol ba'i phung po rnam par sbyong bar gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, on these grounds, the bodhisattva is said to be purifying the aggregate of liberation.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni thogs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung por rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni thogs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung por rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: On the buddha stage, the aggregate of seeing transcendent awareness is established as being completely liberated from the obscurations to the unimpeded.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa thob pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dar las chod pa tsam yod pa dang bral nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa thob pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dar las chod pa tsam yod pa dang bral nas /
translated: Because, having attained the buddha stage and become free from the mere obstruction of the obscurations to omniscience,

original: ye shes kyis shes bya thams cad la thogs pa dang chags pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyis shes bya thams cad la thogs pa dang chags pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: transcendent awareness engages all objects of knowledge without impediment or attachment.

original: brgal ba / rnam par grol ba'i 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: brgal ba / rnam par grol ba'i 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Objection: It is the nature of the truth of cessation that is completely liberated.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni 'dus ma byas pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni 'dus ma byas pa yin pas /
translated: And the truth of cessation is unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas la spangs pa dang bcas pa'i don med na ji ltar 'dus ma byas phung por rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la spangs pa dang bcas pa'i don med na ji ltar 'dus ma byas phung por rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: So if unconditioned phenomena do not have the meaning of being abandoned, how can the unconditioned be established as an aggregate?

original: mngon pa'i chos mdzod las kyang /
analyzed: mngon pa'i chos mdzod las kyang /
translated: The Abhidharma Treasury says:

original: phung po 'dus ma byas ma bshad /
analyzed: phung po 'dus ma byas ma bshad /
translated: The unconditioned is not explained as an aggregate.

original: don dang rmi lam tsam phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: don dang rmi lam tsam phyir zhes smos so //
translated: Because it is merely a meaning or a dream.

original: lan 'dus ma byas ni phung po'i mtshan nyid du mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: lan 'dus ma byas ni phung po'i mtshan nyid du mi gzhag ste /
translated: The unconditioned is not posited as a characteristic of the aggregates.🔽In the Indian language,

original: 'di ltar rnam par grol ba la rgya gar skad du /🔽bi muk ti zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par grol ba la rgya gar skad du / bi muk ti zhes 'byung ste /
translated: vimukti is said.

original: bi muk ti'i don ni rnam pa gnyis su 'gro'o //
analyzed: bi muk ti'i don ni rnam pa gnyis su 'gro'o //
translated: The meaning of vimukti goes in two ways.

original: gang zhe na nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid la yang bi muk ti ste /
analyzed: gang zhe na nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid la yang bi muk ti ste /
translated: What are they? The characteristic of the abandonment of afflictions is also vimukti,

original: rnam par grol ba zhes bya /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba zhes bya /
translated: called liberation.

original: mos pa'i mtshan nyid la bi mug ti ste /
analyzed: mos pa'i mtshan nyid la bi mug ti ste /
translated: The characteristic of aspiration is vimukti,

original: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba las /
translated: called liberation.

original: 'di skabs su ni rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba mos pa'i mtshan nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: 'di skabs su ni rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba mos pa'i mtshan nyid la bya ste /
translated: In this context, liberation is taken to be the characteristic of aspiration.

original: mos pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus byas yin pas /
analyzed: mos pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus byas yin pas /
translated: Since the characteristic of aspiration is conditioned,

original: rnam par grol ba'i phung por gzhag pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phung por gzhag pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: there is no fault in positing it as the aggregate of liberation.

original: gzhan du na rnam par grol ba phung po 'dus byas kyi phung por bsdus par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rnam par grol ba phung po 'dus byas kyi phung por bsdus par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, liberation would not be included in the conditioned aggregates.

original: thogs pa'i sgrib pa las ni sangs rgyas kyi sa la ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thogs pa'i sgrib pa las ni sangs rgyas kyi sa la ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: From the obstruction of obstruction, on the Buddha ground.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po thob par rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po thob par rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The buddha stage is posited as the attainment of the aggregate of seeing the pristine wisdom that is liberated from the obscurations that are with impediment.

original: gang gis shes bya gzhan dag gi ye shes la thogs @256b par byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gis shes bya gzhan dag gi ye shes la thogs @256b par byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: That which impedes the pristine wisdom of other knowable objects.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa thob pa na sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yod pa'i sgrib pa dar la tsam gyis chod pa dang bral nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa thob pa na sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yod pa'i sgrib pa dar la tsam gyis chod pa dang bral nas /
translated: When one attains the buddha stage, one is free from the mere trace of the obscurations that exist for the bodhisattvas on the ten stages.

original: gang gi phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i ye shes kyis kyang thogs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i ye shes kyis kyang thogs te /
translated: Because even the pristine wisdom of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and so on is impeded.

original: de dag gi ye shes kyis kyang khong du chud pa'i shes bya thams cad la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes 'jug pas na sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus na ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba rnam par sbyong bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de dag gi ye shes kyis kyang khong du chud pa'i shes bya thams cad la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes 'jug pas na sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus na ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba rnam par sbyong bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Because even their pristine wisdom does not comprehend all knowable objects, the pristine wisdom of the tathāgatas engages them. Therefore, at the time of the buddha stage, the aggregate of seeing the pristine wisdom of liberation is purified.

original: 'grub pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'grub pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams te /
translated: The third concerns the classification of the stages of realization.🔽Three verses on this.🔽The stages of realization are the ten spiritual levels.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The stages of realization are the ten spiritual levels.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.

original: sa gang dang gang thob par bya ba'i phyir brtsams shing brtsal ba las sa de dang de 'grub pa'am /
analyzed: sa gang dang gang thob par bya ba'i phyir brtsams shing brtsal ba las sa de dang de 'grub pa'am /
translated: The ten spiritual levels are the stages of realization of the bodhisattva.

original: thob pa'am ma rdzogs par gyur pa la 'grub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thob pa'am ma rdzogs par gyur pa la 'grub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The stage of action in faith is the stage of realization of the bodhisattva.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa dang sa bcu rnams su yon tan ji tsam zhig ni grub /🔽ji tsam zhig ma grub pa phye ste /
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa dang sa bcu rnams su yon tan ji tsam zhig ni grub / ji tsam zhig ma grub pa phye ste /
translated: The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.

original: bstan pa la 'grub pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ste /🔽de tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bstan to //
analyzed: bstan pa la 'grub pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ste / de tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bstan to //
translated: The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.

original: ma grub pa dang grub pa ni //🔽sa rnams thams cad shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽sa bcu dang mos pa spyod pa'i sa bsnan te /🔽sa bcu gcig dag la rnam pa gnyis su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ma grub pa dang grub pa ni // sa rnams thams cad shes par bya // zhes bya ba la / sa bcu dang mos pa spyod pa'i sa bsnan te / sa bcu gcig dag la rnam pa gnyis su shes par bya ste /
translated: The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.

original: ma grub pa dang grub pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa dang grub pa'i sa'o //
translated: The ten spiritual levels and the stage of action in faith are the stages of realization.🔽The ten spiritual levels and the stage of

original: de la mos pas spyod pa'i sa thams cad ni ma grub pa'i sa ste /
analyzed: de la mos pas spyod pa'i sa thams cad ni ma grub pa'i sa ste /
translated: All the stages of devoted engagement are stages of non-establishment.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du ma rtogs pas /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du ma rtogs pas /
translated: Because they have not realized the characteristic of the all-pervading dharmadhatu,

original: sa bcu las sa 'ga' yang khong du chud pa med pa'i phyir ma grub pa'i sar gzhag go //
analyzed: sa bcu las sa 'ga' yang khong du chud pa med pa'i phyir ma grub pa'i sar gzhag go //
translated: they have not comprehended any of the ten stages, and so they are posited as stages of non-establishment.

original: sa dang po pa yan chad sa bcu pa man chad ni grub pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa dang po pa yan chad sa bcu pa man chad ni grub pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
translated: The stages from the first up to the tenth are called stages of establishment.

original: chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs shing so so'i sa gang yin pa mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir grub pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs shing so so'i sa gang yin pa mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir grub pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they have realized the characteristic of the all-pervading dharmadhatu and have actualized their respective stages, they are called stages of establishment.🔽And establishment is also non-establishment,

original: grub pa yang ni ma grub dang // grub par yang ni 'dod pa ste //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grub pa yang ni ma grub dang // grub par yang ni 'dod pa ste // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And establishment is also asserted.

original: sa dang po yan chad sa bcu man chad grub par bshad pa la yang rnam pa gnyis su gzhag ste /
analyzed: sa dang po yan chad sa bcu man chad grub par bshad pa la yang rnam pa gnyis su gzhag ste /
translated: The stages from the first up to the tenth, which have been explained as stages of establishment, are also posited in two ways:

original: grub par gzhag par 'dod pa dang / ma grub par gzhag par @257a * //
analyzed: grub par gzhag par 'dod pa dang / ma grub par gzhag par @257a * //
translated: as stages of establishment and as stages of non-establishment.

original: 'dod pa'o // de la sa dang po yan chad sa bdun pa man chad ni ma grub pa zhes bya ste /🔽brtsal 'bad dang bcas par mtshan ma med pa'i lam la bsgom pa'i phyir ma grub pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'o // de la sa dang po yan chad sa bdun pa man chad ni ma grub pa zhes bya ste / brtsal 'bad dang bcas par mtshan ma med pa'i lam la bsgom pa'i phyir ma grub pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The seventh stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The eighth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The ninth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The tenth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.

original: sa brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa rnams la ni grub pa zhes bya ste /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa rnams la ni grub pa zhes bya ste / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The eleventh stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The twelfth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The thirteenth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The fourteenth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The fifteenth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The sixteenth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The seventeenth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The eighteenth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.

original: lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma med pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma med pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nineteenth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The twentieth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The twenty-first stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.

original: de las rnams la grub pa dang ma grub pa rnam pa gnyis su bstan pa las /🔽grub pa rnams kyang thabs gang gis grub ce na /
analyzed: de las rnams la grub pa dang ma grub pa rnam pa gnyis su bstan pa las / grub pa rnams kyang thabs gang gis grub ce na /
translated: The twenty-second stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.

original: ji ltar rnam gzhag yid byed pas ;
analyzed: ji ltar rnam gzhag yid byed pas ;
translated: The twenty-third stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The twenty-fourth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The twenty-fifth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The twenty-sixth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The twenty-seventh stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.

original: / de ni brtags par shes pa dang // de nyid rnam par mi rtog ste //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: / de ni brtags par shes pa dang // de nyid rnam par mi rtog ste // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The twenty-eighth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The twenty-ninth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The thirtieth stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The thirty-first stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.

original: 'di ltar sa re re la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa re re la /
translated: The thirty-second stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The thirty-third stage is the stage of the direct perception of the universal.🔽The thirty-fourth stage is the stage of the direct perception

original: sa'i yon tan gang yod pa dang / sa'i skyon gang yin pa dang / sa de la bsgom par bya ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag kyang sems la gsal bar snang la /
analyzed: sa'i yon tan gang yod pa dang / sa'i skyon gang yin pa dang / sa de la bsgom par bya ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag kyang sems la gsal bar snang la /
translated: The qualities of the level, the faults of the level and the phenomena to be cultivated on that level all appear clearly to the mind.

original: sa gong ma'i yon tan ci 'dra ba dang / sa gong ma thob par bya ba'i chos gang yin pa dag kyang yid la byed pa ni ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa gong ma'i yon tan ci 'dra ba dang / sa gong ma thob par bya ba'i chos gang yin pa dag kyang yid la byed pa ni ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: And the qualities of the higher levels and the phenomena that are the causes for attaining the higher levels are also kept in mind. This is known as keeping the principles of the levels in mind.

original: dper na sa dang po grub par bya ba yang sa dang po'i yon tan dang / bsgom par bya ba dag kyang yid la byed la /
analyzed: dper na sa dang po grub par bya ba yang sa dang po'i yon tan dang / bsgom par bya ba dag kyang yid la byed la /
translated: For example, in order to accomplish the first level, bodhisattvas keep in mind the qualities of the first level and the things to be cultivated on it.

original: sa gnyis pa thob par bya ba'i rgyu chos rnams kyang yid la byed pa ni ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa thob par bya ba'i rgyu chos rnams kyang yid la byed pa ni ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And they keep in mind the phenomena that are the causes for attaining the second level. This is known as keeping the principles of the levels in mind.

original: de la sa dang po'i yon tan yid la byed pa yang dper na sa dang po las /
analyzed: de la sa dang po'i yon tan yid la byed pa yang dper na sa dang po las /
translated: Keeping the qualities of the first level in mind, for example, is as described in the Sūtra of the ten levels:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de la sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags pa spyad pa /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de la sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags pa spyad pa /
translated: O sons of the Victor, there, those sentient beings who have accumulated the roots of virtue, who have practiced,

original: tshogs shin tu bsags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshogs shin tu bsags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: who have accumulated the collections, and so on.

original: sa dang po thob pa des sa gnyis pa thob par bya ba'i rgyu yid la byed pa yang sa dang po nyid las /
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa des sa gnyis pa thob par bya ba'i rgyu yid la byed pa yang sa dang po nyid las /
translated: The mental contemplation that is the cause for attaining the second ground by one who has attained the first ground is stated in the first ground itself:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po la shin tu sbyang bar byas pa de sa gnyis pa la mngon par mos pa yin te /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po la shin tu sbyang bar byas pa de sa gnyis pa la mngon par mos pa yin te /
translated: O sons of the Victor, in that way, the bodhisattva who has trained well on the first ground aspires to the second ground.

original: de'i sems kyi bsam pa bcu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i sems kyi bsam pa bcu 'byung ngo //
translated: Ten thoughts of his mind arise.

original: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the ten? They are:

original: drang po'i bsam pa dang / 'jam pa'i bsam pa dang / las su rung ba'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba la @257b sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: drang po'i bsam pa dang / 'jam pa'i bsam pa dang / las su rung ba'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba la @257b sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the thought of straightness, the thought of gentleness, the thought of serviceability, and so on.

original: yang na sa re re'i don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams ji ltar bshad pa /
analyzed: yang na sa re re'i don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams ji ltar bshad pa /
translated: Or, in order to realize the meaning of each ground, the collections of names, the collections of phrases, and the collections of letters are explained as follows.

original: sems shing yid la byed pa ni ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems shing yid la byed pa ni ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Reflection and attention are called attention to what is well-established.

original: ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pa de'ang brtags pa tsam du shes te /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pa de'ang brtags pa tsam du shes te /
translated: And that attention to what is well-established is understood as mere conceptualization.

original: ji ltar sems nyid sa rnam par gzhag pa lta bur snang bar zad kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sems nyid sa rnam par gzhag pa lta bur snang bar zad kyi /
translated: Just as the mind itself appears as the well-established levels,🔽apart from the mind there is no external object called a level.

original: sems las ma gtogs par sa zhes bya ba'i don phyi rol na yod pa ma yin no zhes rtogs pa ni brtags pa tsam du shes so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems las ma gtogs par sa zhes bya ba'i don phyi rol na yod pa ma yin no zhes rtogs pa ni brtags pa tsam du shes so zhes bya'o //
translated: Understanding this is called understanding as mere conceptualization.

original: de nas de'i 'og tu gzung ba'i yul med na /
analyzed: de nas de'i 'og tu gzung ba'i yul med na /
translated: Then, after that, when there is no apprehended object,🔽how could there be an apprehending mind?

original: 'dzin pa'i sems kyang ga la zhig yod ces brtags pa tsam du shes pa de la yang mi rtog ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i sems kyang ga la zhig yod ces brtags pa tsam du shes pa de la yang mi rtog ste /
translated: Understanding that as mere conceptualization, one does not even conceive of that.

original: gzung 'dzin la rtog pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bsgoms nas dang po 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzung 'dzin la rtog pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bsgoms nas dang po 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Having meditated on non-conceptual wisdom, free from the conception of apprehended and apprehender, one attains the first level.

original: de nas ni gong du yang /🔽de nas 'dzin gnyis rnam grol pa //
analyzed: de nas ni gong du yang / de nas 'dzin gnyis rnam grol pa //
translated: Then, from there,

original: 'jig rten 'das pa bla na med //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das pa bla na med //
translated: one attains the supramundane, unsurpassed,🔽liberated from the duality of apprehender and apprehended.

original: rnam par mi rtog dri med pa'i //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog dri med pa'i //
translated: The stainless, nonconceptual

original: des ni ye shes de thob po //
analyzed: des ni ye shes de thob po //
translated: wisdom is attained by that.

original: des na gnas gzhan 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: des na gnas gzhan 'gyur ba ste //
translated: Therefore, there is a transformation of the basis,

original: dang po'i sar ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dang po'i sar ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: desired on the first stage.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sa gnyis pa la sogs pa sa gong ma rnams la yang /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa la sogs pa sa gong ma rnams la yang /
translated: On the second stage and so forth, the higher stages,

original: tshul de ltar bsgoms pas so so'i sa 'grub par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul de ltar bsgoms pas so so'i sa 'grub par rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know that the individual stages are accomplished by cultivating in that way.

original: bsgom pa dang ni 'grub pa yang //
analyzed: bsgom pa dang ni 'grub pa yang //
translated: Cultivation and accomplishment

original: sa rnams la ni bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: sa rnams la ni bsam mi khyab //
translated: are inconceivable on the stages.🔽Because of the individual self-realization

original: so so rang gis rig pa dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul phyir //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul phyir //
translated: and the domain of the buddhas,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: thus it is said.

original: sa dang po nas sa bcu pa man chad kyi so so'i bsgoms pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab //
analyzed: sa dang po nas sa bcu pa man chad kyi so so'i bsgoms pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab //
translated: From the first stage up to the tenth stage, the individual cultivations are inconceivable.

original: de dag bsgom pas sa'i mthar phyin te /
analyzed: de dag bsgom pas sa'i mthar phyin te /
translated: By cultivating those, one reaches the end of the stages.

original: sa grub pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pas na /
analyzed: sa grub pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pas na /
translated: The accomplishment of the stages is also inconceivable.

original: bsgom pa dang / grub pa gnyis tshig gis bshad cing gtan la dbab par mi nus te /
analyzed: bsgom pa dang / grub pa gnyis tshig gis bshad cing gtan la dbab par mi nus te /
translated: Therefore, both cultivation and accomplishment cannot be explained and determined by words.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sa so so'i sgom pa dang grub pa gnyis ni sa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rang bzhin rig par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: sa so so'i sgom pa dang grub pa gnyis ni sa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rang bzhin rig par bya ba yin pas /
translated: The meditation and accomplishment of each stage are to be known by the bodhisattvas who have attained the stages.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyod yul du 'byung bas na /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyod yul du 'byung bas na /
translated: Since they occur in the domain of the Bhagavat Buddha,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab @258a * //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab @258a * //
translated: they are inconceivable.

original: pa ste / de'i phyir sa'i bsgom pa dang / grub pa ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sems kyis kyang mi rtogs la /
analyzed: pa ste / de'i phyir sa'i bsgom pa dang / grub pa ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sems kyis kyang mi rtogs la /
translated: Therefore, the meditation and accomplishment of the stages are not understood by the minds of ordinary beings.

original: tshig gis bshad pa'i yul yang ma yin pas na bsam gyis mi khyab par gzhag go //
analyzed: tshig gis bshad pa'i yul yang ma yin pas na bsam gyis mi khyab par gzhag go //
translated: Since they are not the domain of verbal explanation, they are posited as inconceivable.🔽Therefore, the explanation of the first ten stages was requested by Vimuktisena,

original: de'i phyir sa bcu dang po bshad pa rnam par grol ba'i zla bas gsol ba btab pa dang / de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos phyogs bcur bltas nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bcu dang po bshad pa rnam par grol ba'i zla bas gsol ba btab pa dang / de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos phyogs bcur bltas nas /
translated: and then the bodhisattva Vajra garbha, looking in the ten directions,

original: 'khor thams cad de bas kyang dad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor thams cad de bas kyang dad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to cause the entire retinue to have even more faith,

original: de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so //
translated: at that time spoke these verses.

original: phra la shel dkar drang srong chen po'i lam //
analyzed: phra la shel dkar drang srong chen po'i lam //
translated: The path of the great sages is subtle and clear.

original: mi rtog spyod yul ma yin lta bar dka' //
analyzed: mi rtog spyod yul ma yin lta bar dka' //
translated: It is not the domain of the nonconceptual, difficult to see.

original: rang bzhin zhi zhing 'gag med 'byung ba med //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhi zhing 'gag med 'byung ba med //
translated: It is peaceful by nature, unceasing and unborn.

original: mkhas gsal shes pas khong du chud pa yin //
analyzed: mkhas gsal shes pas khong du chud pa yin //
translated: It is comprehended by the wise and clear consciousness.

original: ngo bo nyid stong zhi zhing gnyis med mi zad pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong zhi zhing gnyis med mi zad pa /
translated: Empty of essence, peaceful, nondual, and inexhaustible,

original: brgyud pas rnam grol mnyam nyid thob las mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: brgyud pas rnam grol mnyam nyid thob las mya ngan 'das //
translated: Liberated through the continuum, it is nirvana, attained through equality.

original: mtha' dang dbus med tshig gis brjod du med //
analyzed: mtha' dang dbus med tshig gis brjod du med //
translated: Without end or middle, it cannot be expressed in words.

original: dus gsum grol ba nam mkha' 'dra zhing mtshungs //
analyzed: dus gsum grol ba nam mkha' 'dra zhing mtshungs //
translated: Liberated in the three times, it is similar to and equal with space.

original: bde gshegs spyod yul zhi zhing nye bar zhi //
analyzed: bde gshegs spyod yul zhi zhing nye bar zhi //
translated: The domain of the sugatas is peaceful and utterly peaceful.

original: smra ba'i lam rnams kun gyis rdzogs par dka' //
analyzed: smra ba'i lam rnams kun gyis rdzogs par dka' //
translated: It is difficult to complete through all the paths of speech.

original: de dag sa dang spyod pa de 'dra bas //
analyzed: de dag sa dang spyod pa de 'dra bas //
translated: Those who have such a level and conduct

original: smra ba dka' na shes par ga la nus //
analyzed: smra ba dka' na shes par ga la nus //
translated: are difficult to speak of, let alone understand.

original: de ni bsams pas sems lam rnam par spangs //
analyzed: de ni bsams pas sems lam rnam par spangs //
translated: That is the path of the mind, abandoned by the mind through reflection.

original: ye shes mngon bsgrubs rgyal ba'i spyod yul te //
analyzed: ye shes mngon bsgrubs rgyal ba'i spyod yul te //
translated: It is the domain of the victors, the manifest wisdom.

original: phung po skye mched khams kyis brjod pa min //
analyzed: phung po skye mched khams kyis brjod pa min //
translated: It is not expressed through the aggregates, sense bases, or elements.

original: sems kyis mi shes yid kyis rnam ma brtags //
analyzed: sems kyis mi shes yid kyis rnam ma brtags //
translated: The mind does not know them, nor does the intellect investigate them.

original: ji ltar bar snang gnas kyi bya yi rjes //
analyzed: ji ltar bar snang gnas kyi bya yi rjes //
translated: Like the trace of a bird in the expanse of the sky,

original: shin tu smra dka' blta bar mi nus pa //
analyzed: shin tu smra dka' blta bar mi nus pa //
translated: Very difficult to show, impossible to see,

original: de ltar bde gshegs sras kyi sa rnams kyang //
analyzed: de ltar bde gshegs sras kyi sa rnams kyang //
translated: So too the stages of the Sugata’s sons

original: yid dang sems kyi yul gyis shes mi nus //
analyzed: yid dang sems kyi yul gyis shes mi nus //
translated: Are not known by the domain of the mind and intellect.

original: 'on kyang byams dang snying rje smon lam gyis //
analyzed: 'on kyang byams dang snying rje smon lam gyis //
translated: Nevertheless, through love, compassion, and aspiration,

original: de las phyogs tsam rim pa'i tshul bzhin du /
analyzed: de las phyogs tsam rim pa'i tshul bzhin du /
translated: A mere part of them is practiced in stages,

original: spyad par bya ste sems kyi spyod yul min //
analyzed: spyad par bya ste sems kyi spyod yul min //
translated: But not as the domain of the mind.

original: ye shes tshul gyis rdzogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes tshul gyis rdzogs par bya ba'o //
translated: They are perfected by the method of wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gang yang rab tu dga' ba'i 'grub pa ni sngar smras pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yang rab tu dga' ba'i 'grub pa ni sngar smras pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: And it is said: “The accomplishment of the Joyful One is as previously stated.”

original: sa grub pa'i don 'chad de /
analyzed: sa grub pa'i don 'chad de /
translated: Here, the meaning of accomplishing the stages is explained.

original: sa dang po 'grub par 'gyur ba yang /
analyzed: sa dang po 'grub par 'gyur ba yang /
translated: The accomplishment of the first stage

original: sngar smras pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sngar smras pa lta bu ste /
translated: Is as previously stated.
