original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / chos @258b kyi dbyings khong du chud par 'gyur ba la bar du gcod pa gzung 'dzin gnyis dang bral bas sa ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / chos @258b kyi dbyings khong du chud par 'gyur ba la bar du gcod pa gzung 'dzin gnyis dang bral bas sa ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the attention to the arrangement of the stages, which is free from the duality of subject and object, and which prevents the obstacles to the attainment of freedom from the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing and to the comprehension of the reality realm.

original: sa so so'i yon tan dang / bsgom par bya ba yid la byed cing /
analyzed: sa so so'i yon tan dang / bsgom par bya ba yid la byed cing /
translated: One should attend to the virtues of each stage and to what is to be cultivated.

original: sa gong ma 'thob par 'gyur ba rnams la yang bsgom pa ni ;
analyzed: sa gong ma 'thob par 'gyur ba rnams la yang bsgom pa ni ;
translated: And one should cultivate the attainment of the higher stages.

original: ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called attention to the arrangement.

original: yang na sa rnams kyi don 'chad par byed pa'i ming dang tshig dang yi ge la sogs pa yid la byed pa ni ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //🔽sa rnam par gzhag pa de yang /
analyzed: yang na sa rnams kyi don 'chad par byed pa'i ming dang tshig dang yi ge la sogs pa yid la byed pa ni ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o // sa rnam par gzhag pa de yang /
translated: Or else, attention to the names, phrases, letters, etc. which explain the meaning of the stages is called attention to the arrangement.🔽And that arrangement of the stages should be understood

original: rtog pa tsam du shes pa dang / de nyid du de mi rtog pa'i phyir rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtog pa tsam du shes pa dang / de nyid du de mi rtog pa'i phyir rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: as mere imagination, and as non-imagination in reality.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba nyid las /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba nyid las /
translated: It is like the presentation of mind and mental factors.

original: rnam par gzhag pa lta bu snang bar zad kyi /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa lta bu snang bar zad kyi /
translated: It is only an appearance,

original: sems las logs shig na sa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no zhes kyang rtog la /
analyzed: sems las logs shig na sa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no zhes kyang rtog la /
translated: but apart from mind there is no so-called earth.

original: sems tsam du rtog pa de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sems tsam du rtog pa de yang ma yin te /
translated: But even that conception of mind-only is not so,

original: ci la yang mi rtog pa la gnas na 'grub par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci la yang mi rtog pa la gnas na 'grub par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: for it is to be understood that one will succeed if one abides in the non-conception of anything at all.

original: yang sa rnams la bsgom pa dang / grub pa gnyis ka bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'dis kun la bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang sa rnams la bsgom pa dang / grub pa gnyis ka bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'dis kun la bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, this inconceivable cultivation and achievement of all the stages is to be applied to all.

original: so sor ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur ba mdo tsam du ni gong du bshad pa yin mod kyi /🔽yang dag par re re la yang so so'i sa bsgoms pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: so sor ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur ba mdo tsam du ni gong du bshad pa yin mod kyi / yang dag par re re la yang so so'i sa bsgoms pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: Although it has been explained above in brief how each is achieved,🔽the cultivation of each stage is inconceivable,

original: sa 'grub pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pas na /
analyzed: sa 'grub pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pas na /
translated: and the achievement of the stages is also inconceivable.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sems kyis kyang bsam par mi nus la tshig gis kyang gtan la dbab cing bshad par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sems kyis kyang bsam par mi nus la tshig gis kyang gtan la dbab cing bshad par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the minds of ordinary beings cannot conceive of them, and words cannot determine or explain them.🔽Why is it that words cannot explain them?

original: de ci'i phyir tshig gis bshad par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir tshig gis bshad par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it says:

original: de'i phyir / 'di ltar de gnyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so rang gis rig pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di ltar de gnyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so rang gis rig pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul te /
translated: In this way, these two are the individual self-cognizant wisdom of the bodhisattvas and the domain of the buddhas.

original: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They are not the domain of others.

original: 'di ltar sa bsgom pa dang / sa 'grub pa gnyis ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bsgom pa dang / sa 'grub pa gnyis ni /
translated: In this way, the cultivation of the levels and the accomplishment of the levels

original: sa 'thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi sa so so rang gis rig pa yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod yul yin gyi /🔽so so'i skye bo dang / nyan @259a * //
analyzed: sa 'thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi sa so so rang gis rig pa yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod yul yin gyi / so so'i skye bo dang / nyan @259a * //
translated: are the individual self-cognizant wisdom of the bodhisattvas who have attained the levels and the domain of the tathāgatas.🔽They are not the domain of ordinary beings, śrāvakas, or pratyekabuddhas.

original: thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi spyod yul ma yin pas na bsam gyis mi khyab po //
analyzed: thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi spyod yul ma yin pas na bsam gyis mi khyab po //
translated: Therefore, they are inconceivable.

original: sa la rab tu zhugs pa'i mtshan ma rab tu dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa la rab tu zhugs pa'i mtshan ma rab tu dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po zhes bya ba la /
translated: Two verses on the analysis of the signs of entry into the stages.

original: dper na chu skyar gang na snang ba de na chu yod par brtag pa dang / dud pa'i mtshan ma gang na snang ba de na me yod par rtag pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na chu skyar gang na snang ba de na chu yod par brtag pa dang / dud pa'i mtshan ma gang na snang ba de na me yod par rtag pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as one infers the presence of water from the sight of a crane, and the presence of fire from the sight of smoke,

original: mtshan ma dang rtags ji lta bu dag snang na sa thob po zhes brtags pa ni sa rab tu zhugs pa'i mtshan ma rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang rtags ji lta bu dag snang na sa thob po zhes brtags pa ni sa rab tu zhugs pa'i mtshan ma rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: so one infers the attainment of the stages from the sight of certain signs.

original: don du na sar zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mtshan ma rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: don du na sar zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mtshan ma rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: In fact, there are ten signs for the bodhisattvas who have entered the stages.

original: mtshan ma rnam pa bcu snang ba dang sa la zhugs pa yin par shes par bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan ma rnam pa bcu snang ba dang sa la zhugs pa yin par shes par bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: Two verses to show that the bodhisattva who has the ten signs should be known as having entered the stages.

original: de la gong du snying rje ba dang / legs par smra ba la sogs pa'i skabs su yang mtshan ma bshad na der mtshan ma bshad pa dang nga 'dir mtshan ma bshad par bye brag ci yod ce na /🔽gong du ni sar zhugs pa dang / ma zhugs kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de la gong du snying rje ba dang / legs par smra ba la sogs pa'i skabs su yang mtshan ma bshad na der mtshan ma bshad pa dang nga 'dir mtshan ma bshad par bye brag ci yod ce na / gong du ni sar zhugs pa dang / ma zhugs kyang rung ste /
translated: What is the difference between the explanation of the signs in the above context of compassion, speaking well, etc., and the explanation of the signs here?

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyi'i mtshan mar bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyi'i mtshan mar bshad do //
translated: In the above, the signs are explained as being common to all bodhisattvas, whether they have entered the levels or not.

original: 'dir ni sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan ma bshad de bye brag ni de yod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan ma bshad de bye brag ni de yod do //
translated: Here, the signs of bodhisattvas who have entered the levels are explained. That is the difference.

original: lhag par mos pa thams cad du //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag par mos pa thams cad du // zhes bya ba la /
translated: In all the stages of resolute intent

original: sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The signs of bodhisattvas who have entered the levels are as follows.

original: sa gang la ma zhugs shing gang la ma thob pa la ni sa de thob par bya ba'i phyir mos pa dang / dad pa dang / 'dod pa skye'o //
analyzed: sa gang la ma zhugs shing gang la ma thob pa la ni sa de thob par bya ba'i phyir mos pa dang / dad pa dang / 'dod pa skye'o //
translated: In the levels that they have not entered and in those that they have not attained, they give rise to resolute intent, faith and desire in order to attain those levels.

original: snang bar bcas pa'i mtshan mar 'dod //
analyzed: snang bar bcas pa'i mtshan mar 'dod //
translated: The signs of those who have entered

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: are held to be the opposite of those.🔽The signs of those who have entered the levels are held to be the opposite of those.

original: sa gang la bzhugs te sa thob par gyur ba'i sa de la snang ba dang bcas zhes bya ba ni bdag gis thob pa'i spang ba dang blang ba dang / bsgom par bya ba'i chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sems la gsal bar snang ste /
analyzed: sa gang la bzhugs te sa thob par gyur ba'i sa de la snang ba dang bcas zhes bya ba ni bdag gis thob pa'i spang ba dang blang ba dang / bsgom par bya ba'i chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sems la gsal bar snang ste /
translated: The stage on which one is situated and has attained is said to be “with appearance” because the general and specific characteristics of the phenomena to be abandoned, adopted, and cultivated by oneself appear clearly to the mind.

original: shes rab kyis gsal bar mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis gsal bar mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: This means that one clearly sees them with wisdom.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is one kind of sign.

original: don du na sa dang po thob pa dang / sa dang po'i spang ba dang blang ba dang / bsgom pa'i chos rnams ni sems la gsal bar snang la /
analyzed: don du na sa dang po thob pa dang / sa dang po'i spang ba dang blang ba dang / bsgom pa'i chos rnams ni sems la gsal bar snang la /
translated: In fact, the phenomena to be abandoned, adopted, and cultivated on the first stage appear clearly to the mind of one who has attained the first stage.

original: ma @259b thob pa'i sa gnyis pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ni mos pa dang dad pa dang 'dod pa skye ste /
analyzed: ma @259b thob pa'i sa gnyis pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ni mos pa dang dad pa dang 'dod pa skye ste /
translated: But in order to attain the second stage, which has not been attained, one generates interest, faith, and desire.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan ma byung na sa dang po thob zin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan ma byung na sa dang po thob zin par rig par bya ste /
translated: When such a sign occurs, one should know that one has already attained the first stage.

original: sa gnyis pa la sogs pa gong ma la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa la sogs pa gong ma la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies to the higher stages, such as the second.

original: ma zhum pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma zhum pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Not discouraged means

original: nam sa thob par gyur nas dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba rnams la skrag pa dang zhum pa'i sems mi skye ste /
analyzed: nam sa thob par gyur nas dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba rnams la skrag pa dang zhum pa'i sems mi skye ste /
translated: that once one has attained the grounds, one does not develop a frightened or discouraged mind with regard to the profound and extensive teachings of the Great Vehicle, which are endowed with the perfections.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second sign.

original: de la gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa bsgom pa zab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa bsgom pa zab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The meditation on the selflessness of persons and of phenomena is called profound.

original: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos ston pas rgya che ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos ston pas rgya che ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The teaching of the perfections, the grounds, the powers, the fearlessnesses, and so forth is called extensive.

original: skye ba med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: skye ba med ces bya ba la /
translated: Not discouraged means

original: sar zhugs pa dang bdag gzhan gyi don du grang ba dang tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang skom pa dang / mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa gtong ba'i dka' bar spyod pa sdug bsngal sna tshogs 'byung yang skyo ba'i sems mi skye zhing sems ldog par mi byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sar zhugs pa dang bdag gzhan gyi don du grang ba dang tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang skom pa dang / mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa gtong ba'i dka' bar spyod pa sdug bsngal sna tshogs 'byung yang skyo ba'i sems mi skye zhing sems ldog par mi byed par 'gyur te /
translated: that even though various sufferings arise, such as the cold and heat, hunger and thirst, and the giving away of one's head, legs, arms, and so forth, for the sake of oneself and others, one does not develop a discouraged mind and one does not turn back.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third sign.🔽The fourth sign is:

original: gzhan dring mi 'jog bdag nyid do //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dring mi 'jog bdag nyid do // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The self-assurance that does not rely on others.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi stobs kyis mngon sum du byas shing /
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi stobs kyis mngon sum du byas shing /
translated: The self-assurance is the realization and actualization of the stages by the power of one’s own merit and wisdom.

original: rtogs par byas zin pa'i sa la bya ste /
analyzed: rtogs par byas zin pa'i sa la bya ste /
translated: It is the stage that one has already attained.🔽One does not rely on others for the stage that one has already attained.

original: rang gis thob zin pa'i sa la ni gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog gi / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rang gis thob zin pa'i sa la ni gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog gi / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sa de bdag gis mngon sum du byas ma zin pas /
analyzed: sa de bdag gis mngon sum du byas ma zin pas /
translated: Because one has not yet actualized that stage.

original: da de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten mi dgos te 'di ni mtshan ma bzhi pa'o //🔽rab tu rtogs pa thams cad du //
analyzed: da de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten mi dgos te 'di ni mtshan ma bzhi pa'o // rab tu rtogs pa thams cad du //
translated: One does not need to rely on a spiritual friend in order to actualize it now. This is the fourth sign.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fifth sign is:🔽The self-assurance that does not rely on others.
